loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Agée de 53 ans monsieur A. Yaovi est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants. Il mène l’activité de stockage et vente de céréales depuis vingt (20) ans. Le stockage se fait dans des futs et des bidons en plastique pour éviter l'attaque des insectes nuisibles aux grains de céréales. C’est une activité très rentable dans la mesure où le maïs, principal produit d’alimentation de base de la population de la région, devient une denrée rare en temps de soudure. Malgré l’importance des stocks de Mr A., il ne parvient pas à satisfaire à la forte demande de la population. Il sollicite donc un financement qu'il compte utiliser pour constituer un stock plus important de céréales. Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et le niveau de vie de son ménage.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaovi A. is 53 years old, married and father of five (05) children. He has been in business storing and selling grain for the past twenty (20) years. This is a quite profitable activity to the extent that corn - which is the main staple of the population in the region - becomes a rare commodity during the off-season. Despite the size of Mr. A.'s stock supply, he is currently unable to satisfy the strong demand of the population. He therefore requests a loan that he will use to increase his grain storage capacity. The benefits will allow him to improve living conditions for his family and the household living standards.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Storage and selling of corn

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia T. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old. Anesia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Anesia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Anesia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anesia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anesia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anesia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jesus Daniel

texts.es: Jesús Daniel tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es venta y elaboración de repostería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo es un hombre luchador su historia es muy asombrante ya que tuvo que emigrar a otro país, para mejorar los ingresos y mantener a su hijo que es el único que tiene y quiere proporcionarle los estudios necesarios para que tenga la oportunidad de seguir adelante. Ya que el no pudo finalizar sus estudios. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio. Su deseo es establecer una panadería para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Jesús Daniel, 28, creates and sells confectioneries. He has been in this business for more than 5 years. He is a real fighter with an amazing past, since he had to emigrate to another country in order to improve his income to support his only son, whom he wishes to provide with the education necessary to give him the opportunity to get ahead, especially since he himself was never able to complete his education. This loan is for the purchase of the raw materials necessary for his business. His goal is to start a bakery to improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Davronbek

texts.en:
Davronbek M. is a successful father and dedicated husband and together with his wife he has a little kid. Davronbek began a small grocery store two years ago with a small amount of savings that he had earned as a carpenter. He was assisted by his father who helps him with serving his clients. Today, his clientele has grown greater and his grocery become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Davronbek is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff to increase his range of goods.

loans.name: Ntungamo Tukore Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
K. Abdu, shown at the top left and also in the group photo, is the leader of his group in Kihihi. He is 34 years old and married with three children, all in primary school. He also takes care of two dependents.

Abdu has operated a retail shop in Kyabiyorwa Upper Cell for four years. It started as a small shop but now is expanding. He is able to make 400,000/= as monthly profits and this helps him in taking care of his family and mostly his children’s school fees. He has good customer care skills and this has tremendously improved his business and increased his profit margin.

Abdu sells general merchandise and he needs a loan to be able to buy more goods to increase the stock he has for sale.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Chhoeng

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeng Y. is 50 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She has eight children. The first three are married and live separately, and the other five are single. To help feed the family, two of her children have ready attained suitable occupations. Y. is married to Ty, 41, who is a chop-wood (firewood) seller with a net income of $3 a day. Since 1998, Y. has earned a living by raising pigs in her pig pen behind her house. Her business is going well and she needs to buy more pigs to raise, so that is why she requested a loan of 1,200,000 KHR from Kiva’s project partner, HKL. She is hopeful this will bring her additional income.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es:
El señor O. H. Martinez Sandoval, tienen la edad de 64 años,  es soltero y se dedica a la topografía y es pintor pero hace poco se  jubilo,  habita en el barrio de Laureles Sur y padre de familia de 2 hijos.

El solicita un préstamo para levantar el techo de su hogar, debido a que cuando se vienen las temporadas veraniegas, el calor lo agobia y teme alguna complicación a su salud, este es uno de sus principales necesidades y espera que lo apoyen a mejorar su estilo de vida, para habitar en un ambiente cómodo y seguro, los días que le quedan en esta vida. Agradece que en otras ocasiones se le haiga ayudado a mejorar su hogar para reformar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Señor O. H. Martinez Sandoval, age 64, is single and worked as a surveyor and painter before retiring. He lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood and is the father of 2 children.

He is applying for a loan in order to make the roof of his house higher because when summer comes the heat is hard on him, and he fears for his health ( a higher roof will make the house cooler). This is one of his principal needs, and he hopes that he has support for improving his living conditions so that he can live in a comfortable and secure environment in the days remaining in this life. He is grateful that on other occasions he has been helped to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising the roof on his home.

loans.name: Alily

texts.en:
Alily D. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old, married, and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alily plants and harvests coconut for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately $350 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Alily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Alily is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business, and part of this loan will be used to pay for services extended by her farm helpers. This will be her 15th loan from from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí, de  21 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Reside en una comunidad ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tiene su casa que es propia.A pesar de su corta edad decidió instalar  una pequeña bodega con la necesidad de cubrir sus gastos familiares. En la actualidad  tiene una buena cantidad de habituales clientes , esto debido al  buen servicio que ofrece.Además le gusta su trabajo, ya que sabe medir las necesidades de sus clientes, y siempre se abastece de productos indispensables, para ofrecer lo mejor a sus compradores . Generalmente trabaja sola  y de vez en cuando recibe la ayuda de su esposo. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma localidad y a pesar de obtener buenas ganancias económicas, para el futuro  planea ampliar su  tienda de abarrotes, introduciendo nuevos productos, para captar nuevos clientes.Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente  , además felicita el desempeño de  su banco comunal , por el buen trabajo  que vienen realizando.Noemi tiene planeado invertir  el dinero  solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería, para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, así sabe que obtendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Noemí is 21 years old, married, and has two children. She resides in a community in the tropical Peruvian jungle where she has her own home. Despite her young age, she decided to open a small grocery store in order to cover her family’s expenses. She currently has a good number of regular customers as a result of the excellent service that she offers. Noemí enjoys her job since she likes getting to know the needs of her customers and always having essential products on hand so that she can offer the best to them. She generally works alone, but occasionally receives help from her husband. Her grocery store is located within her community and she has future plans for expansion. Noemí will introduce new products so that she can attract more customers and generate better revenues.

This is her third loan with MFP. Noemí promises to complete her payments on time and is happy with the good work that her Communal Bank has accomplished. She will use the money she requested to purchase large quantities of merchandise to restock her store so that she can earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them. 

Mary K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Kamakwe town in northern Sierra Leone, about 26 years ago. Mary is single and has one child who is still a baby. Mary sells rice, sugar and 'gari' (quick-cooking food made out of cassava roots).  She has been doing this business for three years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying rice, sugar and 'gari' wholesale. 

In the picture are members of the 'Mary's group' and loan officer Daniel Banya, handing over the loan.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and 'gari' wholesale

loans.name: Ana Zela

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector La Arenita del distrito de Paiján,una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar junto a su esposo como obrera agrícola en una empresa de la zona desde hace más de tres años, generalmente trabajan en la recolección de espárragos y otras verduras. Con los ingresos que percibieron de esta actividad han ido instalando desde hace seis meses una bodega en su domicilio, allí ellos ofrecen a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes de uso diario.

Este negocio está teniendo bastante acogida ya que le provee a sus vecinos artículos por los que tendrían que ir hasta el centro del distrito (que está muy alejado) para adquirirlos, Ana es consciente de ello y trata de brindar a sus clientes productos de primera calidad, de modo que pueda seguir manteniéndolos y mediante ello pueda seguir percibiendo ingresos que le permitan seguir adelante.

Actualmente ella ha creído conveniente adquirir más productos para incrementar sus ventas y percibir sus ganancias, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ana es una mujer trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es verlos progresar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 28 year old mother who lives with her husband and their children in La Arenita, in the region of La Libertad, located about 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. Together with her husband, she has worked in agriculture for more than 3 years for a company located in the region. They usually work harvesting asparagus and other vegetables. Six months ago, with the income they earned from this work, they opened a small market in their home from where they offer their customers all kinds of grocery and every day household items.

Their business has been well accepted as they provide their neighbors with many things they would have to travel to the city center to get. Ana is careful to provide her customers with high quality products, and she knows that in this way they will continue to increase their sales and their quality of life. She is requesting a loan to purchase more products for their store, so that she can continue to grow the business. Ana is a hard working woman who is very dedicated to her family. Her greatest dream is to see her family improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for the small market they run from their home.

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Madame Mamou Samaké est une femme mariée de 39 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier Nanierila de Bougouni. 
Elle a vite abandonné l’école au profits des activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente de crème de mil apprise auprès de sa tante.  Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et elle  la maitrise bien. Son point de  vente est situé eu plein cœur du marché de Bougouni.
Elle s’approvisionne en matière première au marché de Bougouni.
Elle a intégré le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt, pour  pouvoir acheter et stocker une grande quantité de matières premières pour la préparation du crème de mil. 
Elle  espère réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 28 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
39-year-old Mamou Samaké is married and a mother of 2. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Nanierila neighbourhood of Bougouni. She left school early to pursue income-generating activities, specifically to sell millet cream just as her aunt had taught her. She has run this business for 10 years and she runs it well. She sets up shop right in the heart of the market in Bougouni. She also gets her ingredients from the market in Bougouni. She is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program in order to buy and stock a large quantity of ingredients to prepare millet cream. With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 28,000 XOF.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make millet cream

loans.name: Makhsud

texts.en:
Z. Makhsud is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Makhsud has been a farmer since he was very young. He plants potatoes and other vegetables and also raises cattle at his house. Makhsud alternates the crops so that while one is growing the other is ready to be cleaned and prepared, until finally be begins to plant potatoes again. Growing potatoes is very profitable because there are certain seasons when prices are higher and farmers have the opportunity to increase their capital. Currently Makhsud needs funds for growing his crops and purchasing young cattle, and for that reason he applied to IMON International with the request of 13000 Somoni loan. He will spend this loan for buying seeds, fertilizer and young cattle. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds, fertilizer and young cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy scrap metals for making his products and materials for making a cowshed

loans.name: Tserenchimed

texts.en: Tserenchimed S. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia in a ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Tserenchimed manages a meat retailing business out at Bayanzurh, one of the largest markets in her town, with the help of her husband. She began her business in 2000 and since then, she and her husband have gained much experience and knowledge. Today, their working capital has reached 600,000 MNT. The two have received a lease from Xacbank to purchase a car and eco-fuel, a fuel that is ecologically friendly and its production and use have a minimal impact on the environment. Tserenchimed is a modest woman who wishes to have her own yard and house where the family would live more conveniently than today. Tserenchimed is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Beatrice Dinah

texts.en:
Beatrice Panyako is 33 years old and married to Meshak Otieno. Meshak operates a taxi in Kisumu, to add to her family's income. They have three children: aged 13 years, 11 years, and 5 years, respectively. She manages a retail shop and has been in this business for 16 years, with an income of KES 17, 000 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 with KADET LTD to purchase more stock for the retail shop, like bread, soap, sugar and others. She intends to use the anticipated income to pay back the loan, and to pay school fees for her children.

Beatrice desires to grow her business to be stable and also to have a good income that can provide the basic needs for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the retail shop, items like bread, soap, sugar and others.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a forty-year-old peasant man, married with ten children, nine of them below 18 years of age.  He is the head of a family of 15 members based in Fort Portal, Uganda. Edward deals in alcohol distilling and he has been in this business for ten years. From this business he has been able to build a house. 

He boasts of not having any hardships in his business so far and his ambition is to increase his output and supply the region. Edward intends to use the loan to purchase plant seeds for  bananas for increased input of raw material into his alcohol distilling.

loans.use: Purchasing plant seeds for  bananas for increased input into alcohol distilling

loans.name: Mirella Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Mirella,  está casada y tiene dos niñas que aun se encentra en la escuela y que según ella requieren de muchos cuidados. Su  esposo es vendedor.

Tiene una ferretería en su casa y en un terreno al lado de su casa que utiliza como bodega, dice que tiene de todo en lo que a productos de ferretería se refiere, ya son siete años que tiene este negocio y dice que le va muy bien ya que por su sector es el único negocio que se dedica a esto.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 17h00. Sus productos se los traen directo de las fábricas de Guayaquil y otras ciudades.
 
Está en el Banco comunal ya hace 4 años y está muy contenta porque siempre sus créditos le han sacado de muchos apuros. Este crédito lo va a ocupar en pagar productos que están por llegarle en estos días.
 
Su sueño es tener una ferretería más grande en el centro.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank meets in the San Alejo neighborhood in the very beautiful city of Portoviejo, Manabí province capital, famous for the beautiful beaches that line its coasts popular with national and international tourists alike.

Here we find Mirella.  She is married and has two daughters that are still in school and still need much care.  Her husband is a salesman.

She has a hardware store in her house and uses an adjacent piece of property as a warehouse.  She says she has all kinds of hardware supplies. She has been in business for seven years and she says she does quite well because she is the only one in her area in this kind of business.  She is open daily from 8am until 5pm.  She brings her stock directly from the factories in Guayaquil and other cities.

She has been in the communal bank for 4 years now and is very happy because her loans have always gotten her out of difficult situations.  She plans to use this loan to pay for products that are about to arrive in the next few days.

Her dream is to have a larger hardware store downtown.

loans.use: To buy hardware supplies.

loans.name: Alhamdulilai Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Alhamdulilai” Group. They are entrepreneurs running small scale businesses based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata T.. Fatmata is age 45. She was born in Makeni city where she now lives with her husband and five children. Her husband is a teacher and one of her children is attending secondary school. For 22 years now, Fatmata has been selling fried food and breads. She will use her share of this loan to expand her business by buying bread, eggs, etc.

loans.use: To buy bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Gulbahor's Group

texts.en:
Gulbahor R. is the leader of the group. She is 49 and a widow, and has raised two daughters. The first daughter is married and lives separately with her family, and the second daughter helps her mom with housework. Gulbahor earns money by providing sewing services; she has been sewing clothes for 30 years. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase fabrics and materials for sewing. In the future she wants to expand her business and open a sewing workshop.

Nigorahon S., 24, is the treasurer of the group. She is married, her husband works in construction, and together they are raising two sons. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 soms, Nigorahon started to breed cattle. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase cement and wood for building a house.

Tasilhan G., 61, is married. Her husband works in a car repairing center. Together they have raised a son and two daughters. Tasilhan earns money by selling food products. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase food products for sale and construction materials for building a house.

Haethon S., 27, is married. Her husband works in construction. They have a son, who is five. In order to make money, Haethon breeds cattle. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a bull for breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren J. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son attends university while her youngest daughter attends a secondary school. Dolgorsuren operates a consumer-goods retailing business. She sells a variety of small consumer goods that are imported from Erlian, China. She started her business in 2000 and has built a stable and successful operation. Since then, she has found success in her business and bought a grocery trading shop next to her home. After years of successful operation, she has managed to increase her family's standard of living greatly. Dolgorsuren hopes to expand her business and increase her product line by selling clothes. She is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to purchase a variety of products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo R. is from the village of Olango. He is 40 years old. Rodolfo is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rodolfo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 31,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Rodolfo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand this business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Thirty-five year old Lisa J. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is currently single and hopes to have her own family someday. Lisa is involved in farming and hog-raising. She tills her land for planting and harvesting rice crops. She sells her harvest to the market and also gives some to her family for consumption. Lisa also grows pigs for fattening and sale. While she is still single, Lisa happily helps her family financially.

Lisa needs additional fertilizers and pig feed. She applied for a loan of Php20,000 from CEVI, which she will use to buy the things she needs for the farm and pigs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more spare parts and petroleum products for his business.

loans.name: Munhtuya

texts.en:
Munhtuya is a 40 years old single parent who lives with her three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student while her younger two sons both attend a local high school. After saving money from her previous job as a salesperson at her sibling's grocery store, she purchased a car which enabled her to start her own transportation business in 2005. She has established a stable business in her local community and was able to start operating a second business, which is dairy trading, in 2009, to supplement her earnings. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. 

For the future, she hopes to continue to increase both businesses. Munhtuya is a hardworking and diligent person who says, "All I want is to provide a higher education for my three children" She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to buy more dairy products to sell for the upcoming Tsagaan Sar, Mongolian New Year holiday when demand for such products rise.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products

loans.name: Sarkar

texts.ru:
Sarkar B. 45 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, Sakir pereselenec iz Lachin regiona, Seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy i detmi. Sarkar uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom. 
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Sarkara v perviy raz on bral 1500$ za etu ssudu on blagodaren Kive i lenderam. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit baranov dlya pereprodaji. Sarkar tak je prodayet i sherst baranov obrabativaya iz.

http://www.kiva.org/lend/2943
texts.en:
Sarkar B. is 45 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person from the Lachin Region now living in the Absheron Region with his family and children. He has been in this line of work for 10 years. This is Sarkar’s second loan. The first time he took out $1500. He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy sheep for resale. He also prepares and sells sheep wool.



http://www.kiva.org/lend/2943

loans.use: kupit baranov

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel A. is from the village of Bantay. He is 37 years old. Joel is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Joel owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Joel has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP per harvest. In 2011, Joel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Malika Group

texts.fr: APEC  Al Ouma Malika est un groupe mixte de 11 personnes  représentée par madame Fally D. .Madame D. exerce l’activité de commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle achète  et vend  des denrées  alimentaires et beaucoup d’autres  produits divers. Elle a l’amour et la passion de cette activité depuis son enfance. Elle sollicite un prêt de 1 925 000 prévus pour l’achat de produits alimentaires tels que produits agro-alimentaires ou forestiers, et divers autres dans le but d’élargir d’avantage leur activité. Ainsi ils pourront accroitre leur revenu et mieux subvenir aux besoins de leurs familles respectives.
texts.en:
APEC Al Ouma Malika is a mixed group of 11 members represented by Mrs. Faly D.. Mrs. D. has been a merchant for over 20 years. She buys and sells foodstuffs and many other miscellaneous products. She developed a passion for this activity since childhood. She is seeking a loan of 1,925,000 FCFA to purchase foodstuffs such as agro-food and forest produce, and various others products, in order to further expand their business. They hope to increase their revenues and better provide for their respective families.

About this loan:
Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 

Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas),  Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children.   They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.

Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week.  Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.

loans.use: To strengthen their working capital

loans.name: Antoliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Antoliana G. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, Compañia Tajy Loma, tiene 58 años de edad, con dos hijos profesionales docentes.
Hace más de 10 años que trabaja como macatera (vendedora ambulante) en las zonas de Asunción y Lambaré, además de Carapeguá, manifiesta que con su sacrificio logró contar con una buena cantidad de clientela, quienes semanalmente realizan sus pagos, también cabe destacar que los productos que lleva son de buena aceptación por parte de sus clientes ya que son de buena calidad.
Agradece a  Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo crediticio constante que le brinda para aumentar su oportunidad de negocio.
Ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra de colchas, hamacas, edredones y pantalones para su reventa.
Su máximo sueño es no depender de sus hijos y que no sea una carga a la sociedad por lo que se empeña en mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Antoliana G. is from the neighborhood of Tajy Loma in the city of Carapeguá. She is 58 years old and has two children who are teachers.

For more than ten years, Antoliana has worked as a traveling saleswoman in the areas of Asunción, Lambaré, as well as Carapeguá. She says that her sacrifice resulted in a large number of customers who pay her on a weekly basis. It should also be mentioned that her products are well-received by her customers since they are of good quality.

Antoliana appreciates Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the constant support they have provided so that she can increase her business opportunities. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of blankets, hammocks, quilts, and trousers for resale. Her greatest wish is not to depend on her children and become a burden on society, so she strives to improve her income.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, hammocks, quilts, and trousers for resale.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is married and a loving mother of five children. She lives in Kurgantube, Tajikistan with her husband, children and mother-in-law. Dilorom works hard, because she wants to improve her life. She is engaged in animal husbandry. Her husband sells car spare parts at the market and he helps his wife in his free time.

Mostly, Dilorom buys a cow with a newborn calf. Then, once the cow stops giving out milk, she sells the cow and keeps the calf.  She sells milk to private entrepreneurs, who produce dairy products. Dilorom would like to get a loan of 7,900 Somoni to purchase young cattle. She is hoping to further develop her business with this additional assistance.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth P. is from the village of Sta. Ines, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Ruth joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and biscuits. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and biscuits

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana tiene 42 años D. edad, y es casada con 2 hijos. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito Pacasmayo, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque. 

DesD. hace más D. dos años, cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propio domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos D. consumo diario entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Gracias a esta actividad pueD. mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo, quien es mototaxista, con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia.

Diana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería D. abarrotes D. modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su objetivo es ser uno D. las bodegas más surtidas en la zona. Por lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Diana, age 42, is married and has two children. She lives together with her family in the Pacasmayo district -- an area with substantial commercial traffic located in the region of La Libertad, more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For over two years, Diana has been running a convenience store from her own home. In it, she offers groceries and various basic necessity products. Thanks to this business, Diana has been able to proviD. for her family and to help her husband, who is a driver of a mototaxi (a tricycle cabin attached to a motorcycle), with the financial needs of their household.

Diana would like to expand her business by purchasing a larger inventory of groceries which will help her increase her sales and earnings. Her goal is to have one of the best-supplied grocery stores in the areas. To achieve this goal, Diana has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles.

loans.use: to purchase grocery store inventory

loans.name: Khadija's Group

texts.en:
Khadija is a resident of Faisalabad, which is a big city in Pakistan and famous for its textile industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Mae-Di-Jughi. She moved here 25 years ago. She is 47 years old and married to M. N. with four children. Her eldest son is a factory worker while her elder daughter also works in a private organization. Her remaining two daughters are studying. Khadija is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her children. 
 
Her husband has a job in the factory. His salary is not enough to meet the financial expenses of his family. So in order to supplement the income, he operates a donkey cart and offers loading services to the clients. Khadija has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new donkey cart for her husband because his current cart has become rough and needs to be replaced. By purchasing a new donkey cart, Khadija hopes that her husband will be able to put more loads on it and perform his work well. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In a previous loan year, she proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Khadija”.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and married. She supports 8 members of her family and is blessed with seven children aged 23, 19, 16, 14, 12, 9 and 5 years old. Rosa has been selling secondhand clothes in Languse trading centre for one year, earning a monthly income of KES 1,000.

Rosa has borrowed a loan of KES 7,500 from KADET LTD. This is her first loan and she wishes to use it to purchase one bale of secondhand clothes for resale. The profits generated from the loan will be used to pay her children's school fees. Rosa hopes to expand her business to greater heights and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Mirela Luz

texts.es: Mírela vive en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 13 a19 años de edad;  allí tiene varios negocios, por un lado hace 7 años inició con la venta de comidas rápidas y almuerzos, así mismo a este mercado agregó el de venta de productos mediante guías especializadas y como si fuera poco  también ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras; en todos ellos su mercado principal  son  las mujeres de las familias, que interactúan en los diferentes negocios.  Su experiencia de negocio la adquirió en empresas donde trabajó como empleada y despertó su espíritu emprendedor que puso en marcha con muy poco capital, con el que gradualmente ha ido creciendo y todo esto con la ayuda de su cónyuge quien le ha apoyado en trabajo y motivación. Su sueño es  tener su propio local para crear una empresa de comidas rápidas, generar empleo,  y sobre todo para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento comprará utensilios de cocina, ollas, platos, sillas, mesas para mejorar la infraestructura física de su negocio de alimentos. Mientras Mírela le aporta trabajo a la consecución de su sueño, continua manejando un margen de utilidad no menor de un 30%,  que persiste en aumentarlo para lograr ayudar a sus hijos en la educación universitaria, porque continua con la esperanza de que estos sean apoyados por el estado nacional en la carrera universitaria que a ellos les guste.
texts.en:
Mirela lives in the July 20th neighborhood with her husband and three children who range in age from 13 to 19. It is here that she manages several businesses. She launched her first business seven years ago selling fast food and lunches. From that point, she also began selling products through specialized catalogs and renting out washing machines. Her main target customers are women with families, and each of her businesses reaches out to that demographic. Mirela gained her experience while working as an employee for different companies. This sparked her entrepreneurial spirit despite the fact that she had very little capital. Her resources gradually increased over time. She has been able to accomplish all of this with the full support of her husband and the motivation he provides. Her dream is to have her own shop where she can establish her fast food business and generate jobs so that all of her children can get ahead.

This is Mirela’s first loan. She will use the Kiva funds to buy cooking utensils, pots, plates, chairs, and tables to improve the physical infrastructure of her food business. While she continues to work toward achieving her dream, Mirela is able to maintain a minimum profit margin of 30%. She strives to improve on those results so that she can help her children obtain a university education. Mirela is hopeful that the state will allow them to enroll in any of the national universities they wish to attend.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils, pots, plates, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, a married mother of two boys and three girls, lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and rent bills.

For the past four years, Rehema has been selling fish from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition from other fish sellers in the market, and she dreams of establishing a retail outlet in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, Rehema will purchase bundles of fish and a frying pan in which to cook them. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish and a frying pan.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 43 years old and has one child. Bella earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Bella is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mapendo, leader du groupe d’affaire « Mufariji », est entrepreneur, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 12 enfants qui étudient tous et dont  3 autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse des bananes. Son mari est un tailleur couturier. Elle installe ses bananes au marché communal de Katindo-Alanine.  Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  les fruits (4 régimes de bananes, 1 paniers des avocats) à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  développer une autre entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Mufariji » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Mapendo is a client and the leader of the business group "Mufariji". She is an entrepreneur, 45 years old, married, and the mother of twelve children who have all had schooling. Three of them already have their own homes. 

Mapendo sells bananas, and her husband is a tailor-clothier. She sets up her bananas at the community market of Katindo-Alanine. She has been operating small revenue-generating businesses of these types for ten years. However, she has just completed ten loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan must serve to buy a supply of fruit (4 bunches of bananas and a basket of avocados) to be sold. In addition, her ambition is to educate her children and to develop another enterprise.

Our client thanks Hekima for its actions favoring poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. It is appropriate to note that the business group Mufariji is composed mostly of women.

loans.use: to buy 4 bunches of bananas and a basket of avocados

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. Ysabel tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales los dos mayores son independientes y el ultimo de 17 años estudia en un instituto, la Sra. Ysabel tiene su tienda grande de abarrotes la cual está ubicada en su vivienda, ya lleva en el negocio por más de 20 años; lo cual ha hecho que tenga muy buena experiencia en compra y venta de abarrotes. La Sra. Ysabel va a inventir el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su tienda, ya que tiene un stop por la gran afluencia de clientes. Su sueño principal es poder ampliar su negocio y crear nuevos rubros en ventas y así poder tener mayores ingresos y la economía familiar crezca; ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que así va a poder crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ysabel is 52 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them are grown and independent, while the youngest is 17 years old and a student at an institute. Sra. Ysabel has a large grocery store that is located in her home. She has been in business for more than 20 years. Ysabel has gained a great deal of experience through buying and selling groceries. She will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise for her store. A large number of customers come to her store because there is a bus stop nearby.

Her main wish is to expand her business and create new sales so that she can earn more income and improve the family finances. Ysabel is grateful for the loan that has been provided because it will allow her to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Luis es conviviente, tiene una hija de 1 año, Luis se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte urbano haciendo taxi en un auto alquilado, ya lleva 2 años en el negocio. Los desafíos que enfrenta el Sr. Luis es el frío con lo cual su hija está constantemente a gripada, el crédito lo va a invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda, su sueño es poder algún día comprarse su propio auto para poder brindar el servicio y así le quede más rentabilidad. Toda la familia está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Luis has a spouse and a one-year-old daughter.  He provides urban transportation services in a leased taxi; he’s been in business two years.  The challenge Luis faces is the intense cold weather which causes his daughter to constantly have a cold.  He will invest the loan in home improvements.  His dream is to be able someday to buy his own car to provide service with and be able that way to keep more of the profits.  All of the family is very grateful for the loan granted.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yoni; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara caldos como caldo de pollo, caldo de carne entre otros caldos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de caldos. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el local como comprar sillas y mesas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Yoni belongs to the “Cusco” Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to Cusco province and department.

She is 28, lives with her partner and has 2 children. Her daily activities are devoted to her restaurant business for which she prepares soups, such as chicken soup and beef bouillon among others. She works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. With this business she has been able to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand and improve her business selling soups. She is requesting a loan to fix up the premises such as by buying tables and chairs.

Yoni is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy items such as tables and chairs to fix up her restaurant.

loans.name: Rosse Mary

texts.es: La señora   Rosse  es cliente antiguo desde el año 2004, trabajo en un inicio con un  grupo solidario Fortaleza, trabajando muchas secuencias en el indicado grupo, después de dos años retorno a la institución, actualmente la cliente tiene un crédito individual es una cliente muy cumplida y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además de trabajar atiende a sus hijos que están en edad escolar la cliente   tiene un salón de belleza  el crédito lo invertirá en  el  equipamiento de  su negocio el  salón de belleza, desea comprar sillones, tintes, y materiales para su salón de belleza, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
Rosse has been an old client [of Emprender] since 2004, and initially she worked with the solidarity group Fortaleza [Fortress]. She worked long sequences in the group.  

She came back to the institution two years ago and she follows the agreements and is a responsible borrower when paying her bills. She also takes care of her children who are school age. 

The client has a beauty salon, and will invest in equipment for the salon. She wants to buy chairs, hair dye, and other supplies she needs for her business. She is a hard worker and thanks the institution for their support.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Luz Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luz Carlota, la socia tiene 57 años de edad, la socia es viuda y tiene5 hijos, la socia es cesante de educación y la socia compra y vende ropa al por mayor, la socia trabaja desde hace 9 años, la socia  desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa la socia viaja a la ciudad de Lima cada 2 meses y trae ropa para vender a damas y caballeros, la socia tiene sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Luz Carlota belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women), located in the District of San Jeronimo in the Province and Department of Cusco. Luz is a 57-year old widow with 5 children and a retired teacher. 

Luz buys and sells wholesale clothing. She has been working for 9 years and travels to the city of Lima every 2 months to bring back clothing for men and women. She has an established customer base. 

Luz would use the loan to buy clothing for resale. She is thankful for the support that will be granted to her and is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Baatarjargal

texts.en:
Baatarjargal, 21, has been working as a taxi driver since 2009 and has gained much experience from this business field. At first, he used to hire his taxi car for MNT 20,000 a day from a private taxi company. 

He started his career after he had just graduated from secondary school in order to have a life challenge. His job starts at 7am and finishes at 11pm at night on weekdays. Now he lives with his brother and his family in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Recently, he decided to move out to start his own individual life. To do so, he needs a complete ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) with insulation on the walls before this coming cold winter. Therefore, his loan will be used to cover the payment for a new ger for himself.

loans.use: To buy a new ger for starting his own individual life.

loans.name: Mart

texts.en:
Mart, an unmarried 24-year-old who lives with her brother in the slum district of Kherlen, is a taxi driver around the Kherlen area. She started her business in 2009 and already has many permanent customers. She recently purchased a newer car, but unfortunately it broke down a month ago and her business is now stopped.

Because of the urgent need to earn a living and save money so that she can enter college and develop a career, she needs this loan to repair her taxi for renewed operation.

loans.use: to repair her taxi.

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en: Banzragch is 23 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife works in a billiard club. He started his bakery business in 2011 when he quit from the local bakery manufacturer therefore, he is well experienced and has contact with the customers as well. Now that he has all the required knowledge, he is lacking the resources. He is a sharp young man who says "I have to do everything I can in order to support my daughter". He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy flour to make bread and cake.

loans.use: To buy flour to make bread and cake

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Jamila has operated a tailoring business for the past three years; in addition, she also sells juices which adds to her other source of income. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expand her business in the future.

With this loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase a new sewing machine and fabrics, as well as food flavors for her juice business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and fabrics, as well as food flavors for her juice business.

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru: Файзулло житель города Куляб. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Он занимается торговлей фруктов. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Fayzullo lives in Kulob. He is 26 years old, married, and has five children. He sells fruit. He is taking out a loan to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy tangerines, oranges, and kiwi.

loans.name: Foulératou

texts.fr: Foulératou est mariée avec un enfant à charge. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des articles de mercerie, divers, produits cosmétiques et boissons dans sa boutique .Elle s'approvisionne  à dans les marchés du bénin et hors du bénin. Pour agrandir son atelier et renforcer la revente, elle sollicite un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Elle utilisera le revevu complémentaire pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et le reste pour ses propres besoins.
texts.en: Foulératou is married and financially supports one child.  She sells small articles for sewing, and other products such as cosmetics and drinks, from a shop.  She buys her products at various markets in Bénin  and outside of Bénin.  In order to increase the size of her shop and to bolster her sales, she is requesting a loan from Finadev.  She will use the additional revenues to boost her business and the rest to meet personal needs.

loans.use: To buy several spools of thread, zips, needles, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta, tiene 42 años, se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos, tiene 4 hijos, esta en Finca hace 10 años.
Adela agradece todo el progreso que tiene, ya que con los préstamos y capacitaciones le ayudan a poder tener una educación financiera, ha mejorado su vida económica, y familiar, es una entidad que ayuda a las mujeres de bajos recursos económicos, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropas y zapatos.
texts.en: Adela is a member of the communal bank "Violeta."  She is 42 years old, has 4 children,  and has a business selling clothing and shoes.  She has been with FINCA for 10 years.  Adela appreciates all of the progress that she's made with the loans, and the training that has helped her to become educated on financial matters.  This has improved her finances and her family life.  FINCA is an organization that helps low-income women.  With this loan, Adela will invest in the purchase of clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Perlena

texts.en:
Perleta is 40 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Perleta has a fish-vending business and she earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for five years.

Perleta is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to buy a fishing boat to provide money for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 32 year old married woman  who has 2 family members from Irbid Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors. She wants to expand her project

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Kimsang's Group

texts.en:
Kimsang, 30, is married with three dependent. Her family lives in a house with thatch roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Phnom Proek district and the main sources of her family’s income are from growing cassava and working for others for a fee. She has been running her business for seven years, earning about 70,000KHR per day and she is able to save about 40,000KHR each day. 
Kimsang is just with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sewèdo Claude

texts.fr: Âgée de 23 ans, Sewèdo Claude n'a pas fréquenté l’école mais a appris la maçonnerie activité qu'il exerce depuis huit ans. Sewèdo Claude est marié à une couturière du nom de Jeanne. Le couple a un enfant, qui n'est pas scolarisés et à sa charge. Sewèdo Claude vit ensemble avec son enfant et sa femme. le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Parallèlement à son activité, Sewèdo Claude achète  des noix de palme pour transformations à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Sewèdo Claude s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Sewèdo Claude devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Sewèdo Claude sollicite une première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des pelles, des brouettes et des noix de palme.

loans.name: Ma. Mercia

texts.en:
Ma. Mercia is a 57-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with seven children; five adults and two dependents ages 17 and 15 years old.

Her husband works hard as a farmer while Ma. Mercia runs a sari-sari (variety) store business to earn a living. 

With this, she is requesting for a loan to improve her store. She will buy grocery items such as noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered juice, milk, candies, chips, biscuits, laundry soap, noodles, and canned goods. 

In the future, Ma. Mercia wishes to improve her business to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered juice, milk, candies, chips, biscuits, laundry soap, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Brenda Yaneth

texts.en:
Brenda is very friendly and helpful. She has a very large family with 5 children, all of who are just beginning school, which has been very difficult for Brenda because the family has many expenses and even more when the children are in school. So, she thought about beginning a business which would allow her to take care of her children at the same time since they are still very young. She works preparing food like flautas, chiles rellenos, and other Mexican food. She needs a $250.00 USD loan to buy basic material that will allow her to increase her production of food, since this Christmas season there is great demand for her products that Brenda still does not have the ability to fulfill; this is why she needs your support and generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Brenda es una persona muy amigable y servicial, tiene una familia muy grande compuesta por 5 hijos y todos se encuentran estudiando los primeros años de escolaridad, por lo que para Brenda esto ha sido difícil, porque los gastos de su familia son muchos y aun más cuando se encuentran estudiando. Por lo que pensó en hacer un negocio que le permitiera al mismo tiempo cuidar de sus hijos ya que son muy pequeños aún. Ella trabaja en la preparación de comidas como Flautas, Chiles Rellenos y otras comidas mexicanas.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $250 USD para comprar materia prima que le permita incrementar su producción de comidas, debido a que esta temporada navideña tiene una alta demanda por sus productos pero aun Brenda no cuenta con la capacidad para atenderla; por lo que requiere de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Material

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Marta teaches crafts and one of her main objectives is to promote art and crafts among young people, children, and adults. This occupation is also her only source of income, since she makes handicrafts and sells them. The main materials she uses are seeds, flowers, glue, carpentry, and piñatas. She is now requesting a loan of $475 with which she plans to buy the materials she needs to continue giving her art workshops.

Marta’s goal is to be able to continue working as a teacher and cultural promoter. It is very important to her to plant the love of art in her students, so that they can develop their abilities and get out of bad habits and delinquency. You can help her school continue. Your support is very useful for Martha and each one of her students.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marta es maestra de manualidades, uno de sus principales objetivos es promover el arte y las manualidades en los jóvenes, niños y adultos. Este oficio también representa para ella su única fuente de ingresos, ya que se dedica a hacer manualidades y venderlas. Los principales materiales que utiliza son semilla, flores, resina, carpintería y piñatas. Ahora ella solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares con los que planea comprar los materiales que necesita para seguir impartiendo sus talleres de arte.

La meta de Marta es poder seguir ejerciendo como maestra y promotora cultural, para ella es muy importante sembrar el arte en sus alumnos, que ellos puedan desarrollar sus habilidades y se retiren de los vicios y la delincuencia. Tú puedes ayudar a que esta escuela continúe, tu apoyo es de mucha utilidad para Martha y para cada uno de sus alumnos.

loans.use: To buy craft materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is a 65-year old mother of three living children (she has lost four children due to HIV-related illness). Rose and her husband live in one of slums in Kisumu, Kenya. She has taken out and successfully repaid three previous microfinance loans from KMET.  Rose began selling clothes door-to-door in 1995 and has since expanded her business. She used the funds from her first loan to open her own store and currently rents the shop (pictured) where she sells second-hand clothes. She also employs one person to help her run the shop and meet customer demands.  Rose is also a community-health worker trained in home-based care by KMET in 2002.  She is well-known within her community for her health-care work. Rose is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more second-hand clothes for her shop.

loans.use: Add stock to her clothing business

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru:
Махмудова Нури занимается реализацией домашнего обихода. Замужем, имеет 4х детей, образование среднее. Муж работает сторожем, дети работают и каждый имеет свою отдельную семью. Клиентом «Микроинвест» является более два года, ее активы составляли на 150$. После кредитования добавила в свой ассортимент ремни для мужчин, пластиковые пакеты. Увеличила свой товарооборот на 350$. В дальнейшем планирует увеличить ассортимент и улучшить место своей деятельности.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Nuri M. sells household goods. She has high-school education, is married, and has 4 children. Her husband works as a security guard. Nuri M.’s children are all employed and have their own families. Nuri M. has been a client of MLF MicroInvest for more than 2 years. She had $150 in loans from MicroInvest, which she used to add belts and plastic packages to the assortment of the goods sold and increase her sales volume by $350. In the future, Nuri M. plans to expand her product selection and improve the place of business.

loans.use: For business expansion and improvements

loans.name: Ferembe

texts.en:
Ferembe is a widowed mother of six. Now thirty-seven years old, she started her business two years ago. With the death of her husband, she is left with the responsibility of bringing up the children and providing for their education.

Ferembe runs a grocery shop in the open market in Kabala Town of Sierra Leone. With her previous loan, Jerembe managed to get her children back in school after they were dismissed for not meeting school fees. She says a loan of US$ 275 will enable her to diversify her business. She would like to use the funds for purchasing rice and beans from farmers to store them for selling in the off-season when her profit margin will be higher.

loans.use: Purchase excess rice and beans for storage until the off-season when profit margins are higher

loans.name: Temukisa Wong

texts.en: Temukisa is a strong, married mother of five children. She was employed at one of the companies in Apia but she resigned because she had no one to look after her children. She is now able to make money by selling chips to her fellow villagers and shops in town. She makes around 250-300 Tala ($100-120 US) which she uses for her children’s school fees, family remittances, and growing her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her chips business

loans.name: Ojiefoh

texts.en: Ojiefoh T. is 32 years old and lives in Uromi, Edo state of Nigeria. For the past ten years he has been involved in the photography and video coverage business.  Ojiefoh would be thankful for a loan of US$875 to be able to buy a video camera for his business.

loans.use: Purchase of a video camera

loans.name: Jennifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 23 year-old Jennifa B.. She is married with one child, aged 7. In 2003 Jennifa established a batik cloth business, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Jennifa would like to purchase additional stocks of batik cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Yuli

texts.en: Yuli is 23 and married. Everyday, she goes door-to-door to sell clothing and other household goods, such as towels, sheets, and blankets. She earns $10.00 a week. She will use this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Marhamad

texts.en:
Marhamad is 52 years old and has worked for 15 years as a market vendor. She sells dishes of the Oriental style in the central local market. This kind of china is popular and is widely used for girls' dowries and family celebrations.
