Marhamad plans to enlarge the range her goods and to purchase china in the neighboring countries of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan. For this purpose she requests US $1,000.00 for 5 months. Marhamad is a client of IMON with a positive credit history. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chinda Chok and her husband married in 2002. They have two sons. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chinda has been a silk weaver for fifteen years. It’s a skill she learned from her relative. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who will then sell it in Phnom Penh. 

Her husband works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband for work purposes.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband for work purposes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
I wish to make some improvements in my home. In the dining room area I have a wall that is not finished. I would like to remodel the dining area, I have been trying to do it for sometime now. For this purpose I am requesting a loan in the amount of $800.00.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Quisiera dar a mi vivienda una mejor estabilidad; en la parte del comedor tengo una pared con sus fachadas sin terminar, me gustaría remodelar la parte del comedor ya que tengo tiempo intentando su remodelación, solicito el préstamo de $800.00 dll. Para pder terminar la remodelación de mi comedor.

loans.use: Remodel the dining room of my home.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is very grateful to all Kiva lenders who made her life better as compared to a year ago. She had a small kiosk, but with the loan she increased her stock, earned more income, and purchased a motor bike for transport services in the city. Her income increased, and she diversified her business. She now supplies retailers, especially women, with clothes, sandals, headscarves, and other African prints. Zainab invested part of her income to repair the family house. She is very thankful to Kiva, and she said, "My business, family, and life have changed for the better because of Kiva." Zainab would like to continue building her economic status and is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 3,426,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase her wholesale inventory

loans.name: Taase

texts.en:
Taase N., 44, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells the produce to friends, relatives, and the local community. Also, during the harvest season she supplies the public market with bananas and taro 3 days per week.

Taase has had 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). SPBD loans are Taase’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband also helps to operate the business.

loans.use: To purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, a weedkiller sprayer machine, shovels, a bushknife, claves, and wire for a fence.

loans.name: Sara Ruth

texts.es:
Sara is 34 years old and lives with her parents, along with her two small children. She sells beauty products in a small store she was able to set up in her mother’s home, where she also sells other types of items. She can manage her activities without having to sacrifice caring for her kids. Her store has been operational for 4 years now, and she dedicates a great part of her day to selling her merchandise. She likes her work, because selling and negotiating are activities she enjoys doing especially because of the contact it allows her with other people. Despite all this, selling the beauty products is difficult without having demonstrations to help customers make their decisions. Having two young children motivates her and she wants to be able to provide good educations for them so that they can become professionals. Sara wants to invest in buying more beauty products at wholesale, and wants to use these both for demonstrations and also to sell them quickly without having to wait for the catalog orders to come in. She would like to designate an area in her store for only her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Sara tiene 34 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a sus 2 hijos jóvenes. Ella vende productos de belleza en la pequeña tienda que logró instalar en la casa de su madre, donde también puede dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, sin descuidar el cuidado que tiene que brindar a sus dos hijos. Su tienda viene funcionando ya 4 años, juntamente con sus productos de belleza, y en estas actividades dedica gran parte del día, lo cual le agrada, porque el vender y negociar es algo que le gusta realizar, sobre todo por el contacto que tiene con las personas. Sin embargo, lo dificultoso es poder ofrecer sus productos de belleza sin tener una muestra que ayude a las personas a tomar decisiones en sus pedidos. El tener dos hijos jóvenes la motiva a que poder ofrecerles la posibilidad de cursar estudios superiores y que logren ser profesionales. Sara desea invertir en la compra de productos de belleza al por mayor, y tener así la posibilidad de que no sólo le sirvan de mostrador a sus clientes, sino también venderlos rápidamente sin tener que esperar la llegada de los pedidos por catálogo y así poder instalar en su bodega un espacio solo para sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products at wholesale, so she can have them for demonstrations for her customers and also turn around and sell them quickly.

loans.name: Soledad Pacesa

texts.es:
Soledad es productora de leche de vaca, la cual es comercializada en la población para la producción de queso, percibe un sueldo quincenal por la venta de dicho producto, además cultiva lechuga, acelga, toronjil (todas estas verduras son comercializadas en el mercado Rodríguez de la ciudad de La Paz jueves y sábados). Así ayuda a sus padres y sus hermanos. 

Vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos en la población de Palomar.
 
El crédito sera invertido en una vaca lechera, cree que ya es hora de aumentar las ventas.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, esta calificada para obtener un préstamo
texts.en:
Soledad produces cow's milk, which is sold to be used in cheesemaking. For this, she receives a biweekly income. She also grows lettuce, beets, and lemon balm, all of which are sold in the Rodríguez market in the city of La Paz on Thursdays and Saturdays. In this manner, she aids her parents and siblings. Soledad lives at home with her parents along with her siblings in the city of Palomar. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase a dairy cow because Soledad thinks that now is the time to increase sales. This is Soledad's first loan with field partner IMPRO; she is qualified to be granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Taulagia

texts.en:
Taulagia T., 58, is married with six children. She has four years of experience in the taxi/plantation business. She sells to the village people and public five days per week.

She has four previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Taulagia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

The loan will be used to finance improvements to both businesses. Her husband operates the taxi business and also does farming.

loans.use: To purchase car doors, wheels, engine repairs, car paint, fertilizers, weedkiller, pesticides and chemicals.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha J. has been baking and selling bread in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works for six hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $50 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more ingredients and produce more bread. If she is able to increase her profit, she intends to use the additional money to pay her children's school fees, begin saving money, and reinvest in her business.

Asha is 31 years old, married, and has two children, aged 5 and 9.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the bread that she bakes.

loans.name: Celia Cruz

texts.es:
Su nombre es Celia Cruz Martínez  su edad es de 34 años, su estado civil es casada esta señora tiene 2 hijas mujeres, su hija tiene la edad de 15 años y cursa recientemente el 4 año de secundaria y su otra hija de 8 años de edad que cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su esposo labora como vendedor de bolsas plásticas y las distribuye en las diferentes pulperías, en sus metas esta aumentar su negocio en sus deseos esta el mantener activo su negocio ya que por medio de este es que ha logrado obtener los ingresos que le genera a su familia y en sus propósitos esta  el darle mejoras a su casa de habitación para que sus hijas puedan tener un lugar digno donde vivir.



El tiempo que lleva en este negocio es de 9 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de bolsas plásticas,  además de este negocio tiene uno mas pequeño como lo es la venta de golosinas y refrescos ella inicia este negocio por que su esposo trabajaba en lugar donde vendían  bolsas plásticas y el negocio se traslada a otro lugar y así como el decide independizarse e instala su negocio en  su casa de habitación y es su esposa quien es la encargada de este negocio, el financiamiento es para capita de trabajo por lo que necesita la compra de mas de sus productos ya que los productos que mas vende es la bolsa de pocicle, las de gabacha pequeña y pajillas para asi ofrecer lo que el cliente necesita.
texts.en:
This is Celia Cruz Martínez, she is 34 years old and married. She has 2 daughters; her 15 year-old daughter recently finished her 4th year of secondary school and her other daughter, who is 8 years old, is in the 4th grade of primary school. Her husband works as a salesmen, selling plastic bags which he distributes to different convenience stores. Among her goals is to increase her business and her dream is to keep her business alive since this is how she has been able to get income for her family. Another goal is to make some home improvements so that her daughters can have a decent place to live. She has been in the business of selling plastic bags for 9 years. Additionally, she has a smaller business selling candy and soft drinks. She started up her business when the company where her husband worked selling plastic bags moved to another location and she decided to go on her own and set up in her home. Her husband is in charge of the business. This loan is for working capital so she can buy more of the goods which sell the most, such as small plastic bags (commonly used to serve soft drinks or juice) and straws and in this way be able to give clients what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Soul

texts.en:
Mr. Soul M. lives in Tavak village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a cow breeder. Since his cow-breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it; thus, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy two more cows for breeding. He hopes to increase his income after he sells his cows. His wife, Mrs. Phorn Phet, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.

Mr. Soul M. is 51 years old and the father of six children, one of whom is a chicken breeder while two others stay at home to do housework and help with their parents' business. The remaining three are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Hala has been working as a hairdresser since 2004. She also does makeup. Hala requests a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase supplies for her work. This is the first time that Hala has requested a loan.
Hala is speciA. in her work because she does it well and she is fast. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. Hala decided to start her business because she always wanted to be a hairdresser and because she is a motivated person, especially when it comes to her work. In the future, she plans to open a salon.

loans.use: Hala will use the loan to purchase supplies for her work.

loans.name: Mariama Siré

texts.fr: Mariama Siré D. est une femme de 66dans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont un scolarisé. Elle fait un petit commerce en détail de pâte d’arachide, de tomate et d’oignon. Elle compte ainsi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille en santé, nourriture et habillement.
texts.en:
Mariama Siré D., a 66 year-old woman, is married and has 8 children, one of whom is in school. She runs a small business retailing peanut butter, tomatoes, and onions. In this way, she intends to meet her family's health, food, and clothing needs

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell peanut butter, onions, and tomatoes

loans.name: Turan

texts.ru:
Абдурахимов Туран пожелой мужчина в возрасте 67 лет отец пятерых детей. Закончив первый займ, Туран увеличил свой скот. И в сезон дешёвого скота опять решил получить кредит для закупа скота. За скотом у него дома ухаживают его сыновья, они не дают утомляться отцу. Туран только присматривает и советует как лучше кормить и пасти скот.
Ему на этот раз понадобилось 2000 сомони, для закупа скота и корма.
texts.en:
Turan A. is a 67 year old elderly man and a father of five. The first loan allowed Turan to increase the number of cattle. Now, when cattle prices are again low, he decided to apply for another loan that would allow him to purchase more cattle. His sons tend to cattle and do not let their father get tired. Turan only supervises the process and gives advice on how to improve livestock raising. This time he would need 2000 somoni to buy cattle and fodder.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle raising and sales

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 66 años D. edad, está casada hace 45 años y tiene 7 hijos. Junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta D. cuadros decorativos, los cuales hace su esposo y ella es la encargada D. negociarlos; por cada uno gana entre 15 y 20 soles, la dificultad es que demora la venta D. todos. Mientras tanto, cada fin D. mes viaja a la capital llevando quesos y carnes rojas para vendarlas allá, donD. el precio le favorece mucho más. Esta última actividad le resulta muy rentable y pueden sostener sus gastos básicos. El resto D. días, en su pueblo, ofrece los cuadros que arma su esposo, con este negocio ya llevan más D. 15 años, y ha mejorado desD. hace 5 años que empezó a ser la proveedora D. una tienda D. artesanías, por ello, Genoveva y su esposo están muy felices, ya que les permitirá obtener mejores ganancias. Ella es una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos, este es su 3er crédito con MFP, del cual está muy agradecido porque le permitirle trabajar, y se siente feliz con cada uno D. la reuniones D. su banco comunal, porque es un motivo para que se encuentre con sus paisanos. El dinero que solicita ahora es para la compra D. materiales para la producción D. sus cuadros, y D. ese modo ser una proveedora eficiente con la tienda D. artesanías.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 66 years old, married, 45 years old and has 7 children. Along with her husband she sells decorative artwork which her husband makes and she is in charge of selling them. For each piece she earns 15-20 soles. The difficulty is it takes time to sell them all. Meanwhile, each weekend she travels to the capital, taking cheeses and red meats to sell there, where the price is more favorable. This latter business is very profitable and they can meet their basic needs. The rest of the days, in her town, she sells the artwork her husband provides, and they have been doing this for more than 15 years, and the last 5 years have improved she began to proviD. pieces to an artisan store. Genoveva and her husband are very happy as they will be able to generate greater earnings. She is very punctual with her loan payments. This is her 3rd loan with MFP, to whom she is very grateful because it enables her to work. She feels very happy with each one of the communal bank meetings because this is an opportunity to meet her colleagues. The money she seeks now is to buy materials to produce the artwork and in this way be an efficient provider of artwork for the artisan store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for artwork

loans.name: Abdumutalim

texts.en:
G. Abdumutalim has worked as a cable man for two years. He is married and the father of two children and he started his business in order to support his wife and children.

Abdumutalim provides the service of installing dish antennas. His plans are to increase his business and invest in tools so he can provide better service to his customers. So Abdumutalim began working with IMON International three years ago and has received a total of three loans that he has used to increase his business and to purchase tools.

His most urgent need is to purchase tools as they are extremely expensive and he doesn't have enough money to buy them.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase the necessary tools to install antenna dishes

loans.name: Syrena

texts.en:
Syrena is married. She owns a retail business and sells souvenirs, gift sets and artificial flowers at the market in Beregovo. She has been in this business for five years. Her working capital is $1950 and her monthly profit is $325.

Syrena loves her business. She chooses her inventories personally and enjoys selling them. Syrena has a very open and kind personality that helps her sales. The large assortment helps her sales as well. 

Syrena would like to borrow $1025. She is going to increase the assortment of her inventories to attract more clients. In this way she can make more money to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment.

loans.name: Liway

texts.en:
"For now, I am busy maintaining a 1-hectare farm. I never owned it. I was just there taking care of everything including the plants and the owner will just pay me or give me a share from the harvest. But I never stop dreaming that someday I will be able to own even a small parcel of land. To provide for the growing needs of our family", says Liway M., 34-year-old mother of four children. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 4,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase foliar fertilizer, seeds and insecticide. The loan will really help her improve the harvest and income as well.

CEVI gives not just loans. They also give training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase foliar fertilizer, seeds and insecticide

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2. 7 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 7 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide comme activité  secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2.7 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers   prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz, d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba et Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail et en gros, au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 7 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Ankabenkélenkan 2.7 is a group of married women of the village of Fonfona in Koutiala City, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. And they have an average age of 35 and at least five children. They grow mainly rice, and they grown peanuts as a secondary business. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program five years ago. After having correctly repaid the first four loans, they are now on their fifth farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting rice and peanuts; some minor supplies and equipment; and fertilizers and such, for farming. Supplies are gotten at the marketplaces of Fonfona, M’pessoba, and Zansoni. Following the off-season, the crops are stored for a certain time, so that they gain in value. Then the crops are sold retail in cash transactions at the M’pessoba market and at surrounding markets. Their customers come generally from large cities. After selling their produce, the group members each intend to realize a profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Marcelino Alexander

texts.es: Marcelino Alexander E. tiene la edad de 37 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que dedica a es brindar el servicio de taller de carpintería. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio inicio con los ingresos del trabajo que poseía anteriormente, ya que el se instruyó en una carpintería de sus tías, por lo que Marcelino con su propio esfuerzo decide establecer su propia carpintería, a pesar que enfrento dificultades como lo fue la compra de todas las herramientas necesarias para su taller, pero esto no desanimo a Marcelino para seguir adelante. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de maderas, clavos, pega para la elaboración de sillas, camas, escritorios, mesas entre otras cosas. El sueño de Marcelino es obtener más ingresos para proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación.
texts.en:
Marcelino Alexander E. is 37 years old and married. He has 2 children under his care. He has been working as a carpenter for the past 15 years.

He started this business with income from a previous job. Marcelino learned this trade in his aunt’s carpentry shop but he decided to work hard and establish his own business despite difficulties like purchasing the necessary tools for his workshop. This difficulty did not discourage him from moving forward.

The loan will be used as working capital to purchase wood, nails, and glue to make chairs, beds, desks, and tables, among other things. Marcelino’s dream is to increase his income so he can provide his children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 61 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y con mucha vitalidad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos viven con ella en su casa propia. Desde que enviudó comenzó a trabajar con mayor ahínco en sus cultivos, también vendía comida en el parque de su pueblo para obtener dinero para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Pero desde que enfermó y crecieron sus hijos dejó de vender comida y tampoco trabaja mucho en las chacras, pues sus hijos realizan ahora los trabajos pesados. Lo que hace Elena es preparar los alimentos y en horas de la tarde los apoya en la recolección de las arvejas. A ella le gusta estar dedicada a los trabajos agrícolas porque lo hizo desde su infancia. Para obtener mayor cantidad de dinero ella viajaba a la ciudad de Lima donde comercializaba sus productos, pero ahora el viaje se le hace muy pesado y cansado, por lo que empezó a vender a los comerciantes de la ciudad de Tarma a un menor precio.  Pero ahora que sus hijos ya son adultos pueden volver a enviar sus productos directamente a los mercados de Lima y que los ingresos económicos les den la oportunidad de mejorar su nivel de vida. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, a pesar de sus carencias económicas pagó todas sus cuotas anteriores y aunque tiene dificultades de audición no deja de asistir a las reuniones de su banco comunal para mantenerse enterada de los acuerdos tomados. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y una bolsa de semilla de arvejas para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elena, 61, is a very hardworking woman with lots of vitality. She is a widow, and she has three children. Two of the children live with her in her own house. Since she became a widow, she started to work her fields more eagerly. She also sold food in her town’s park in order to get the money to feed and educate her children. But, since she became ill and her children grew up, she stopped selling food. She does not work much in the fields, either. Her children now do the heavy work. What Elena does is prepare the food, and in the afternoon she helps collect the peas. She likes doing farm work because she has been doing this since she was a child. To obtain more money, she traveled to the city of Lima to sell her products. But, now the trip is very difficult and tiring for her. So, she started to sell at a lower price to the business people in Tarma. Now that her children are adults, they can return to sending their products directly to the Lima markets so that their income gives them the opportunity to improve their quality of life. This is her eighth loan with MFP. In spite of her lack of savings, she made all of her previous payments. Even though she has difficulty hearing, she goes to her community bank meetings to keep herself informed of the agreed upon decisions. The money she is asking for is to buy chemical fertilizers and a bag of pea seeds for the next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario del Carmen G. D. V. resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán , Rosario tiene 41 años D. edad, vive con sus  dos hijos Carlos D. 11 años y  Alberto D. 8 años, actualmente se encuentran estudiando. Rosario es una madre muy responsable y trabajadora con su familia siendo ella el único sustento para sus hijos , sale a trabajar día a día , en el mercado municipal D. Cuscatlán vendiendo productos D. belleza como cosméticos, gelatina para el cabello , esmaltes D. uñas, entre otros. Rosario tiene 15 años D. experiencia en su negocio; el crédito que solicita es para surtir su inventario, y así generar más ingresos a través D. sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosario del Carmen G. D. V. lives in the Cuscatlán department. Rosario is 41. She lives with her two sons; Carlos, 11, and Alberto, 8. They are currently in school. Rosario is a responsible and hard working mother. She is the only one who supports her children. She goes to work every day in the Cuscatlán municipal market. She sells beauty products like cosmetics, hair gel, nail polish, and other things. She has 15 years of experience in her business. The loan she is asking for is to stock her inventory and generate more income through her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a member of the Idunda B borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 25 years old woman,she is married.

Emelda started her Tailoring own business  5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings. 

This is Emelda first loan from BRAC _Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy materials.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Emelda hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Mrs. Johnna S. is from Puntas, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is 39 years old, married with 4 school-aged children.

Aurillo, her husband, is a contractual worker, which is not a stable source of income. So early on they both decided that Johnna should have a business to supplement her husband's salary, and they saved enough capital to start a business selling salted dried fish. With the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon over the last 9 years, Johnna's business has flourished and has been able to support their young family, even with school-age kids.

Now on her 12th loan cycle, Johnna is proposing to borrow the amount of PHP 28,000 to add more capital to her dried fish business. She plans to use her profits to have their house repaired, buy appliances for their home to make life a bit more comfortable for her family, and to save up for the education of her children.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her Dried Fish Business

loans.name: Comunidad Unida 4 Group

texts.en:
Milka is the coordinator of her Bank of Hope and an associate of Esperanza International, currently looking to take out her third loan. She lives with her husband and children in a cement house with a tin roof. They live in the northern part of Santo Domingo, the crowded capital of the Dominican Republic, where running water and electricity are unreliable. 

Milka owns her own cafeteria that she runs from insiD. of her house. With this loan, she is planning on buying much more rice, bananas, potatoes, yucca, carrots, lettuce, and different types of meat, which will allow her to offer her customers more variety and therefore increase her earnings.

 In the long run, she hopes to open a larger cafeteria that is separate from her house, allowing business more room to thrive and more space in the house for her children to grow up. She would like to thank all of you for your generous support.

loans.use: Yucca, bananas, potatoes, meat, rice

loans.name: Gretchan

texts.en:
Gretchan earns a living by making and selling cradles. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to help her husband Melchor, a computer technician, provide for the needs of their family, especially their three-year-old son Lord Heintji. 

Gretchan is applying for a PHP 5,000 loan to expand her business by buying the supplies she needs to make more cradles. This will allow her to generate a larger income and better provide for the needs of her family, which is why she hopes and prays that this application will be funded.

loans.use: To expand a small cradle-making business

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en: At 65, Anacita still manages to tend a hectare of rice field. Together with her husband, they were able to produce 130 sacks of rice at their last harvest. To assist her financially, she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. last November 2008. According to her, her loans were very helpful with her farming. Now, she is applying for Php10, 000. This loan will again be a huge help in financing Anacita’s farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products for her manicure set.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita V. is from the village of Miputak. She is 47 years old, is widowed, and has five children, four of whom are adult and the youngest is school-aged. Anecita owns and operates a business running a retail stall, selling a variety of agricultural produce and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Anecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: 02.03.1.8 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"Huệ Ngô Thị (39) is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Huệ is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.03.1.8 Nam Ngạn (02.03.1.8 Nam Ngạn).


Huệ is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Huệ owns and operates a business selling rice products in the local community.  Huệ has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $165 a month from these activities.


In 2009, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which again will be used to purchase morer raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  This will be her 2nd loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Chinh (40) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a bakery.


2.  Ngô Thị T. Hằng (41) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the service sector operating a service-based business.


3.  P. Thị Hà (42) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huệ Ngô Thị (39) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Huệ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.03.1.8 Nam Ngạn (02.03.1.8 Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huệ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huệ kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Huệ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huệ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Chinh (40) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh lò bánh mì.


2.  Ngô Thị T. Hằng (41) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  P. Thị Hà (42) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIMBANDI depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés. Son crédit lui permet de poursuivre son activité de vente de bétail. En effet, elle achète des bœufs, les engraisse et les revend. Elle participe à l'éducation scolaire de ses enfants et au bien-être de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D. is a 43-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de SIMBANDI for seven years and has obtained from it fourteen loans, which she always managed well and repaid.  Her loan is enabling her to pursue her business selling livestock.  Basically, she buys cattle, fattens them, and then sells them.  She takes part in educating her children and in the family's well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business selling livestock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a businesswoman who makes a living selling clothes, linen and lace. She hawks her goods on her own, and moves them very quickly.  She is 43 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are in school, while her oldest is learning a trade. She supports her family with the income she earns from her business. She has been working for eight years, but growth is slow due to insufficient funds. She buys her goods in Accra, Ghana's capital, and hopes that this loan will allow her to expand her business and increase her income. She is grateful for the assistance she receives from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mrs. Ngon Toum Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who are all living in Thnuoh village in the TaK. province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. NgO. T. is the village-bank president who has been selected by the members, who all will use the loan for different purposes. 

She is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. S. Chea, is fisherman. Now he needs more fishnets to support his fishing. Thus, Mrs. NgO. T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more bamboo for her husband to make fishnets. 

She is 40 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in the local school. All the members are shown in the picture, but one of tH. is blocked.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo for her husband to make fishnets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase craft foam, fabric, and lining

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: The photo shows Mrs. Kong R., 48, a rice farmer. She has been growing rice since 1995, a skill she learned from a grandparent who died of senility years ago. She is married to Oun Phom, 49, who works with her on the farm. This old couple has given birth to nine childR.. Three are married and the others are single and are studying or working. Kong R. lacks some farming supplies and is looking for assistance in order to plant dry season rice.

loans.use: To buy supplies for planting dry season rice.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La Sra. Isidora pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 52 años y es madre de 4 hijos todos ya independientes.

Isidora tiene por actividad la venta de relojes que se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado 
Nº 02 de Tarapoto, cuenta con clientela fija, amigos, moradores y otros. Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró relojes de todas las marcas y modelos diferentes, piezas y otros.

Con este préstamo de S/2,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará, relojes  de todas las marcas y modelos, para damas, caballeros y niños, así como correas, pilas  para relojes y lentes de sol, etc.

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me ofrece el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos,  de  contar con los préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Isidora is a member of the “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” ("Our Lady of Peace") communal bank, in the Tarapoto District, Province of San Martín, Department of San Martín. She is 52 years old and has a live-in partner, and she is the mother of 4 children who are already independent. Isidora's business is selling watches in Tarapoto's Market 2. She has a steady customer base among friends, local residents and others. With her first loan for 300 Peruvian new soles, she bought watches of all brands and various models, along with parts and other items. With this loan for 2,000 new soles, she will buy watches of all brands and models, for men, women and children, as well as straps, watch batteries, sunglasses, etc. She says: "I am grateful for the opportunity offered to me by the Manuela Ramos Movement organization, providing loans that help me develop as a woman and a small business owner."

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various models of watches to stock her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma G. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 37 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities. (The photograph shows Emma and her husband in the sari-sari store.)
In 2009, Emma joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita B. is a 56-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Bantayan, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her general store and fish-vending business. Teresita’s husband, Juanito, is 60 years old and is a fisherman. They have six children who are between 16 and 38 years old. Five of their children have their own families while their youngest child is still currently going to school and also helps in the business as part of the daily chores. Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store and fishing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities. Teresita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and fish-vending business which had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now, Teresita is borrowing Php 10,000 as her 9th loan which she intends to use for her general store and fish-vending business. She is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a married woman with two sons, one of whom is in school. Her husband works at the port clearing goods and she sells clothes and home products. With the ksh. 40,000 loan she plans to purchase more curtains, doormats, bed sheets, clothes and handbags. She has been in this business for seven years and sells her products from home and door-to-door. She aspires to own a shop in the future so that she doesn't have to transport her goods door-to-door. Asha wanted to work with Kiva partner Yehu because their terms are good and clients are not harassed with paying their loans.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthorn T. is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in Ta Pech village in Kandall province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. For this farm, Mrs. Chanthorn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Choeun Mom, is a fisherman who supports his family by a little income. This couple has two children who are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Petrona De Los Angeles

texts.es: Petrona es una Madre de familia que tiene 31 años y vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Se dedica desde hace más de 6 años a la venta de ropa, adicionalmente ofrece su mercadería en todos los mercados, pues no importan las distancias que tiene que recorrer, con tal de ofrecerle a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que ella no la pudo tener.  Desea ampliar su negocio para captar más clientes y así poder percibir más ingresos que le permitan salir adelante. es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima en su negocio.
texts.en:
Petrona is a 31 year old mother who lives with her husband and her son who is dependent on her. She has been selling clothes for more than six years. Petrona offers her merchandise at all of the markets because it makes no difference to her how far she has to travel as long as she can give her son the opportunity to study, something that she did not have. She wants to expand her business by attracting more customers so that she can generate better revenues to get ahead. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.ru: Назридинова Хикоят проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 56 лет. Вдова, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Более 2 лет занимается торговлей. У нее магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Hikoyat N. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 56 years old. She is a widow and has one child. She has secondary education and has been in the retail business for more than two years. She has a store where she sells groceries. She is asking for a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Zinc, cement.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Zunilda  Benítez   domiciliada en el Barrio Romancito  de C.D.E. Ella ya formo parte del comité de Mujeres emprendedoras, decidió contactar con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres al Poder”  están  iniciando el Primer Ciclo   con 15   integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras,  ellas tienen distintas actividades  y otras que están emprendiendo una nueva labor y para generar ingresos.
La señora Luisa es una de las integrantes quien trabaja entre las mujeres para fomentar el trabajo en grupo entre las mujeres.
Ella realiza varias  actividades en la semana para generar ingreso, como preparar comestibles, realiza trabajos de limpieza y actualmente está vendiendo bebidas en su domicilio y solicita el préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, licores de varios tipos.
texts.en:
This existing committee was started by Sra. Zunilda B., who lives in the Romancito neighborhood of Ciudad del Este. She decided to contact her neighbors and friends to form a local committee and now they are part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program.

The committee is named “Mujeres al Poder” (Women in Power). They are starting their first loan with 15 members. The group consists of very responsible and hardworking women, some of whom already have established businesses. Others are starting a new venture in order to generate income.

Sra. Luisa is one of the members who was encouraged to join this group of working women. She engages in different activities during the week to earn money such as preparing food and providing cleaning services. Luisa currently sells beverages out of her home and is requesting a loan to buy sodas, juices, beer, and different types of liquor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, liquor, sodas, and juices

loans.name: Emergildo

texts.es: Emergildo, tiene 40 años y está casado con Deysi de 28 años, ambos tienen un hijo Nelvis, de 4 años, ellos viven en su casa propia. Siembra papa, arveja, avena, maíz y gladiolo, en sus terrenos propios, lleva 15 años, en la agricultura y en época de cosecha, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, quien es comerciante y posee una tienda, trabajando todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana. Por otro lado cría animal ovino, en el que luego son vendidos, y cuya ganancia le ayuda en el sustento de la familia, otro de los animales que tiene son los asnos, que le ayudan a trasladar sus insumos y herramientas agrícolas  a las chacras donde trabajará. Lo que más le gusta de su labor, es surcar la tierra para sembrar, porque siempre consideró que su actividad agrícola es bastante rentable porque le permite cubrir sus gastos domésticos y que su familia tenga una adecuada calidad de vida, por ello, para el futuro, quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad sobre todo arveja y gladiolo, también anhela incrementar la mercadería de su bodega. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, y  está contento de trabajar en su grupo comunal, donde integra la junta directiva, con el cargo de fiscal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará dos bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Emergildo, 40, is married to Deysi, 28. They have a 4-year old son, Nelvis, and live in a house that they own. They grow potatoes, peas, oats, maize and gladiolus. Emergildo has farmed for 15 years. At harvest time, he counts on support from his wife. He also operates a store. Emergildo works every day from early in the morning. In addition to the farm, he raises sheep which he then sells. The earnings go to supporting his family. He also has donkeys that help him move agricultural tools and supplies to the fields where he works. What he most likes about his work is plowing his fields before planting. The farm is fairly profitable and he is able to cover the family's expenses and provide them with a decent quality of life. In the future, he wants to plant larger crops of peas and gladiolus. He would also like to increase the merchandise in his store. This is Emergildo's fourth MFP loan. He likes his community bank where is among the directors. He will use this loan to buy two bags of seed and several sacks of organic manure.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seed and manure for farming business.

loans.name: José Romeo

texts.es: José Romeo G. M. de 39 años de edad, reside en Cantón Ojo Agua, el cual se encuentra en el departamento de Usulután, al oriente del país, él vive junto a su esposa, una madre de familia muy  responsable y esmerada por el bien de su casa y su familia, y así también vive junto a sus dos hijos, los cuales estudian educación básica en la escuela del lugar. José posee su propio negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, en el cual se dedica a elaborar diferentes estructuras metálicas como: balcones, puertas, escaleras, portones y otras estructuras más que sus clientes le piden. Debido a la amplia experiencia que José posee en este trabajo cuenta con muchos clientes quienes se sienten muy satisfechos con su trabajo y por ser una persona muy responsable quien en estos últimos 15 años de trabajo siempre ha dado lo mejor de si. José solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar más metal para invertir en el negocio y de esta forma elaborar más trabajo, así mismo el desea comprar  algunas herramientas nuevas para elaborar mejor su trabajo. José es una persona que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y clientes, y así mismo se destaca por ser muy trabajador y por esforzarse por darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
José Romeo G. M. is 39 years old and lives in Cantón Ojo Agua, which is located within the Usulután department, in the eastern part of the country. He lives with his wife, who is a very responsible mother who cares for the wellbeing of her home and family. They have two children who attend the local school. José runs his own business out of his home, where he manufactures various types of metal structures, such as balconies, doors, stairs, gates, and other things that his customers request. José is very experienced, so he has many customers who are satisfied with his workmanship. He is a very responsible person who, for the past 15 years, has always given his best. He is asking for this loan so that he can buy more metal for his business, which will allow him to complete more jobs. He also wants to buy some new tools so that he can do his job better. José comes with very good references from his neighbors and customers. He distinguishes himself as being a hard worker who makes a great effort to bringing the best for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever tiene 22 años, vive en casa de sus padres y sus hermanos. Desde hace 1 año se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte publico, cubriendo toda la ruta de su ciudad, de esta manera saca provecho de la vida generándose ingresos, además la actividad que realiza, es muy escasa por que no todos los transporte que hay recorren caminos inhóspitos como lo hace Ever. Por lo pronto desea tener su propia movilidad, pues el que trabaja pertenece a su padre, su propósito es aumentar su rentabilidad y mantener su vehiculo en buenas condiciones. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el pago del mantenimiento mecánico que realizará a su carro.
texts.en:
Ever is 22 years old and lives at home with his parents and siblings. He has worked as a taxi driver for 1 year with a city route, and in this way he earns a living. Drivers who cover routes like his are scare, because not everyone will drive the rough roads like he does. Right now he wants to own a car since the one he currently uses belongs to his father. His goal is to increase his earnings and keep his car in good condition.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is very happy to know he has financial support that recognizes that he is a responsible person in making his payments. He is also thankful to be part of a community bank because he knows all the members and they are responsible and very close. He thanks the lenders who will provide the loan he is requesting that will be be very useful for his business. He will use the loan money to pay for vehicle repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es:
María Nela es una mujer trabajadora, con deseo de superación, se dedica al comercio para apoyar a su familia. Procreo dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en supervisión.
Su negocio es una pulpería que puso hace tres años, con ahorros que su compañero dio. Lo que ha venido a mejorar los ingresos y pagar los gatos básicos de agua y luz.
Atreves del financiamiento ha logrado invertir más en productos lo que ha sido de beneficio para crecer en inventario y lograr mejores ventas.
Con este préstamo quiere hacer un cuarto ya que la casa es pequeña y quiere que sus hijos estén en mejores condiciones. Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, perlines, zinc para comenzar hacer a construir.
texts.en:
María Nela is a hard-working woman with a desire to improve her situation. She runs a business to support her family. She has had two children and her husband works as a supervisor. Her business is a pulpería [small grocery store] that she started three years ago with savings that her husband gave her. It has improved their income enough to pay the basic expenses of water and electricity. With the loans she has received previously, she has been able to invest more in merchandise, which has been good for growing her inventory and achieving more sales. She wants to build a room with this loan, as their house is small and she wants her children to be in better conditions. To start construction, she will buy construction materials like: stone, sand, cement, ceiling beams, and corrugated metal sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room, in order to make her children more comfortable

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad O. is 56 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Maikay, Tudela municipality in Misamis Occidental province on the islands of Mindanao. Caridad runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Caridad has been in business for over twelve years and earns approximately 2400 PHP a month.

In 2004, Caridad joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Caridad is requesting a new loan, her tenth from PMPC, of 35,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: C2143 Umuseke Group

texts.en:
Solange is 22 years old and single; however, she has to contribute to her family even though she is single. Solange tries to provide all the necessities for her family. She owns a business selling various foodstuffs. She has one and a half years' experience and she employs one person as help. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day except on Saturday. In addition, Solange is the leader of this group of five people with different businesses:  some of them sell foodstuffs; restaurant and so on.

Solange and her group are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. She will purchase additional products for her store. With this loan, the members of group will be able to satisfy their customers and will be able to be more effective and more efficient.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Hishigjargal

texts.en:
Hishigjargal D. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her older daughter, age 9, attends a local secondary school, while her younger daughter, age 2, attends kindergarten. 

Hishigjargal rents and operates a local public bath house, one of only two in the town. Bathhouses are important for local people as many of them do not have running water with which to bathe. She began her business in 2008 and has built a stable operation. Her husband supports her business by working as a fireman in the bath house. At first her monthly earnings were 300,000 MNT, but they have since increased to 500,000 MNT. After years of successful business, her profits have enabled her to start building a new house for her family. Hishigjargal is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase coals for her bath house.

loans.use: To purchase coals for her bath house

loans.name: Drusira

texts.en:
Drusira is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya and has been doing mixed farming for over 8 years. She produces milk, eggs, and vegetables, all of which are sold locally.

She has applied for a loan of 31,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.   She says the loan will improve her milk production,  hence income.  She plans to own three cows and a water tank.

Animal feed shortage and diseases remain her greatest challenge.  She is focused on repaying the loan to apply for the second one.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga B. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house with fence in the Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. The family has been living in their current home for the past nine years. 

Her husband works in the 256th squad as a soldier and her two children both attend a local school. Since 2004, she has been operating a business trading dairy products, milk and groceries in a rented stall at the local market. During the summertime, she sells mare's milk (fermented milk) and has been quite experienced in the trade over the many years. 

She hopes to continue to operate her business as a stable operation and in the future, she dreams to establish her own dairy-product processing factory. 

Battulga is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase dairy products and other goods at wholesale prices for her trading business. Also, she wants to grow her milk-products business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob A. is 47 years old; he lives in Tsovaghugh village, Sevan area, with his wife and his two sons. He has technical education and for several years Hakob worked with a bus fleet as a mechanic. Since 1996 Hakob and his family are engaging in animal breeding. 

In his farm Hakob breeds cows and calves, sheep and chickens. Hakob’s family works very hard and thanks to this fact they support their family and were able to buy a truck, which they use for fodder transportation. 

Hakob is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some calves for his farm.

loans.use: To buy some calves for his farm

loans.name: Alma Raquel

texts.es:
La Joven Alma Raquel de 26 años de edad Habitante en el Barrio Linda Vista de petronic 4 c. al norte en Nueva Guinea, su esposo trabaja como tecnico con quien tiene 2 hijos varones los cuales son su  mayor felicidad, ella trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal  como asistente del asesor legal desde hace 6 años de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para cumplir con sus compromisos de pago ya que los gastos del hogar los comparte con el marido, ambos son responsables y honesto, y son personas muy queridos por sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos.  

Solicita su primer  crédito para invertirlo en arreglo de cocina y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su hogar, por lo que esperan el apoyo de Kiva para realizar este pequeño proyecto.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida  es que sus hijos no les falte nada y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Alma Raquel is a young woman of 26.  She lives in Linda Vista de Petronic neighborhood, 4c. al norte, in Nueva Guinea.  Her husband works as a technician and they have 2 sons who are their greatest joy.  Alma Raquel works for the City of Nueva Guinea as an assistant to their legal counsel.  She has been in this job for 6 years and she makes a monthly wage which covers her loan repayments since she shares her household expenses with her husband.  They are both responsible and honest people who are very well liked by their work colleagues and neighbors.

Alma Raquel is requesting her first loan to invest in fixing up her kitchen so that she can have better conditions in her home.  They are hoping for Kiva's support in carrying out this small project.

Alma Raquel's biggest dream in life is for her children not to want for anything and to have stability in her work.

loans.use: To buy materials to fix up her kitchen

loans.name: Carinsan

texts.en:
Carinsan C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur.  She is 30 years old.  Carinsan is separated from her spouse and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Carinsan owns and operates a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members.  Carinsan has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.  She decided to reduce her loan from 10,000 PHP to 5,000 PHP because she finds it easier to pay.

In 2010, Carinsan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carinsan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring material such as needles and threads.  Carinsan is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabric and materials.  This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Carinsan from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Marleni Yessenia

texts.es:
Marleni, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, se dedica la venta de frutas, tiene 37 años, es madre soltera de Rosaura de 17 años, Blanca de 16 años, Luis Antonio de 15 años, Teresa de 14, Maribel de 13, José María de 9 y Sandra de 7 años de edad.
El negocio de Marleni es vender frutas y verduras, tiene varios años de estar en esta actividad de donde le provienen los ingresos para comprar lo necesario para sus hijos, lo atiende todos los días en la ciudad de Corinto, actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercadería frutas y verduras que necesita para fortalecer el negocio.
Sus sueños es sacar a sus hijos adelante, que puedan estudiar ya que son muchos y con mucho esfuerzo atiende cada día el negocio esperando vende mucho para tener ahorros y que no les falte nada en su familia.
texts.en:
Marleni lives in Corinto of the Morazan department. She sells fruits. She is 37 years old and the single mother of Rosaura, 17, Blanca, 16, Luis Antonio 15, Teresa, 14, Maribel, 13, Jose Maria 9, and Sandra, 7.

Marleni's business is to sell fruits and vegetables. She has several years in the business and it provides her with a source of income to provide her children with what they need. She looks after them every day in the city of Corinto. Currently she requires a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables with the goal of strengthening her business. 

Her dream is to support her many children, to send them to school, and to manage her business every day. She hopes to make many sales to be able to save and to not have her family want for anything.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita C. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Susanita is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Susanita owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) transport services. Susanita is just starting this business.

In 2007, Susanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susanita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC.   Susanita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and accessories. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Susanita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and accessories

loans.name: Las Turquesas Group

texts.es:
La señora María V. García, vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Fidel Saraos Hernández, a su responsabilidad tiene una hija de nombre Matilde de veinte años quien también la apoya en los ingresos de su hogar.

     Ella es la primera vez que solicita el préstamo y es para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ella lleva  tres años trabajando éste negocio y comenta que le va bien ya que dice que le deja ingresos.

     Para iniciar esta pequeña actividad lo animaron sus hijos quienes ya están casados que si quería trabajar ellos le iban  a dar un apoyo para emprenderlo en abarrotes y así poyarse my salir adelante con su familia.

    Con lo que obtiene compra las cosas que le hacen falta en su hogar, con de eso mismo, surtirse con las mercancías que se le terminan en su tienda.
Lo que más desea es que su negocio se incremente día con día, para tener ahorros y así lograr salir adelante hasta que dios le preste vida.

     En el grupo formo parte por una invitación que le hizo la señora   Ma Luisa, en la que  le agrado la idea y acepto. El grupo se llama "Las Turquesas" la razón del nombre es porque les gusta el olor de esa flor.

Las personas que integran el grupo  son las siguientes y son:

     María del Rosario Sánchez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales y luego venderlos en el mercado.

    Vila V. V.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de telas para luego venderlo por metro en las comunidades.

     Eunice Pérez Vázquez: el préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de vestido y luego venderlo.

     Ma luisa M. V.:   invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes.

     Ramiro F. Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de dulces de nuégado, chicharrones. 

     María V. García:   invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: María V. García lives in the state of Tecpatan, Chiapas, México. She's married to Fidel Saraos Hernández. They have a 20-year-old daughter under their care, Matilde, who also supports the household income. This is María's first loan request, and she plans to use it to invest in merchandise to supply her small convenience store. She has three years' experience with this business and says that it is going very well because it provides income. She started this business after she was encouraged by her children, who are married and said they would support her in starting the convenience store, and in that way support herself and make headway for the family. With what she earns, María buys things that her household is lacking, often the same stocked goods that end up in her store. What she desires most is for her business to grow day by day, have savings, and keep making headway until she goes to God. She joined the group out of invitation by Ma Luisa. María liked the idea, so she accepted. The group is called "Las Turquesas" ("The Turquoise"), and the reason for the name is because they like the smell of this flower. The group members are as follows: María del Rosario Sánchez Sánchez, who will use the loan to purchase fabrics to sell by the meter in the communities; Eunice Pérez Vázquez, who will use it to buy dressmaking materials so she can make items to sell; Ma Luisa M. V., who will invest in ingredients to make bread; Ramiro F. Sánchez, who will use it to purchase ingredients to make local dishes dulces de nuégado and chicharrones; and finally María, who will purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to stock store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
