This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children. He is from Lebanon. For the past 15 years, he has made his living as a professional home painter. He operates his business by taking private projects. Thanks to his income, he is able to offer good living conditions for his family. 

Today he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase scaffolding and renew his tools. He reports that these improvements will enable him to serve more customers. In the future, he is planning to more expand his business operation by taking bigger projects and building a good business reputation.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and renew his tools.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 34 year old single mother. She runs a salon so as to provide for her three year old child. She also operates a mobile-phone money transfer business. She has employed two people to assist her in the business, and hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to add a float to the mobile phone money transfer business.

loans.use: to add float to the mobile phone money transfer business

loans.name: Olmaskhan's Group

texts.en:
Olmaskhan B., the 42-year-old leader of this group, lives with her husband and 11-year-old daughter in the small town of Karabalta. Twenty years ago the family was in a desperate economic state, experiencing great difficulty in covering basic living costs. The development of microfinance in Kyrgyzstan pulled her out of this situation when Olmaskhan received a loan in 1991 to start up a business. Purchasing potatoes seeds which she then planted on her small piece of land, she achieved a rich fall harvest.

Agriculture has helped the family improve its living conditions, buy an automobile, and increase the number of cattle the family owns. A monthly income of 6,000 soms, however, is not always sufficient to cover all costs, so Olmaskhan is now requesting a loan from Kiva to pay for the services of a tractor driver and other operating expenses. Olmaskhan hopes to get enough profit so that she can give a good education to her daughter.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for the services of a tractor driver

loans.name: Eloisa's Group

texts.en:
Eloisa E. is from the village of Macalaoat, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Eloisa is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. Each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Eloisa is married and has four children. She operates a general store. Eloisa has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Eloisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her family living situation. She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase commodities like coffee, sugar, soap, canned goods and many daily used products that she retails. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand her store. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase many daily use products that she retails.

loans.name: Harrison Mwangi

texts.en: For the last two years, Harrison has made a living running a store in the town of Naivasha where he sells cereals. He is 45 years old, married to Joyce Wanjiru and is the father of five children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and is applying for his second loan. He repaid his first loan on time and plans to use the new loan to buy more cereals to sell to his customers. In the future, he hopes to open a butcher shop as well as continue to sell cereals.

loans.use: To buy more cereal to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 23, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Pov is employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $2.66 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of $1.43 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

Pov is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase cows to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. Her husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise for sale.

loans.name: Unsun

texts.en:
Unsun is 52, married and has three children.  Her husband works as a taxidriver.  Unsun has been engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivating since 1981, which was started with initial capital of 1.000 KGS.   

She worked hard to develop her business in fattening and reselling cattle and she also cultivated vegetables and sold it at the local market.  With the revenues, she was able to pay for the education of her daughter. 

To further develop her small farm, which now has two milk cows and calves, Unsun is applying for a loan of 40.000 KGS to purchase cattle.  It will allow her to broaden her business and raise the sales of meat and milk products.
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in the market. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, sacks of beans and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, sacks of beans and cooking fat.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
She is 38 years old and married to a farmer. She has three children and one goes to school.

She is currently in the business of selling milk. She purchases milk and sells it in the market.

Now she is requesting a loan to purchase more milk to get more profit. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to make her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more milk to sell.

loans.name: Aminita

texts.en: Aminata, a 33-year-old married mother of a nine-year-old, lives in Jacob Town where, for the past six years, she has been selling dry goods (spices, oil, rice, etc.) One of her major problems is price instability, forcing her to sometimes buy goods at very high prices. Now requesting a loan to purchase more spices, oil and rice for her business, Aminata plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spices, oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Aldo Omar

texts.es:
Aldo de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, no tiene hijos todavía, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican específicamente al comercio, crianza de aves de corral y turismo.

Aldo  maneja su propia mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la gran competencia que existe realizando el mismo trabajo, el trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades diarias de su casa.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2600 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y para cubrir algunos gastos personales, al no tener fallas  podrá seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Aldo es una persona trabajadora y responsable que desea que su esposatenga las comodidades necesarias en su casa.
texts.en:
Aldo, 51, lives with his wife in his own home.  He has no children.  His house has all the basic utilities, and is located in an urban neighborhood of Chiclayo province.  The residents of this area tend to work raising poultry, and in retail trade and tourism.

Aldo has had his own mototaxi (a light vehicle used to move a maximum of 3 people short distances) for several years.  He provides mototaxi service in the same neighborhood where he lives.  In spite of the significant competition in this line of work, he tries as hard as possible to move a large quantity of people to their various destinations, starting in the early morning hours.  In this way, he can have a higher income to pay for the household expenses and necessities.

The loan he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa is for 2,600 Peruvian soles, and it will be used to maintain his mototaxi and to cover some personal expenses.  This way he will not fail to keep providing good service to his customers and improve his quality of life.  Aldo is a hardworking and responsible person who wants his wife to have all of the comforts she needs in the home.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi and cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk, 47, is a fruit seller. She is a single mother with two children who are 26 and 20 years old. Neither of her children are studying but work in the factory making $6 per day all together. Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a cow to raise and some fruit to sell. She has a plan to repair her house when she is able to make more income.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise and some fruit to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza toda su vida ha trabajo en negocio de arepas gracias a que su familia siempre ha trabajado en este negocio, sin embargo desde hace un tiempo ella tiene su propio negocios para así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, además porque su sueño es poder tener una gran empresa distribuidora de arepas en la región.
texts.en: All her life Esperanza has worked making arepas [pancake-like bread made from corn].  Thanks to her family she has always worked in this business.  However, she has had her own business for a while now to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  Her dream is to be able to have a large arepa distributing business in the region.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle to make home deliveries.

loans.name: Carmen Diocelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de clima frió, su belleza arquitectónica la hace una ciudad muy admirada y visitada, su gente es de un corazón cálido, amable y mantienen la cultura y las tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. Carmen tiene 35 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Carmen se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y trabaja también hace 6 meses en la limpieza de casas medio día. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal y esta labor la realiza hace 5 años.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir compra de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería para continuar con esta actividad.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia y darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank Damas Responsables (Responsible Women).  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with a cold climate.  The city's beautiful architecture makes it a much admired and visited city.  Its people have a warm heart, are friendly, and maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.  

Carmen is 35 years old.  She is married and has 2 children ages 14 and 9.  Her older daughter is in high school and her son attends school in the city.  Her husband is a private sector employee.  They do not own a home so they rent.

Carmen takes care of her children and for the past 6 months she has also cleaned houses for half-days. In her free time, she sells Yanbal products, as she has done for the past 5 years. 
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years and this new loan will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry to continue with her business.  

Her goals are to own her own home and to provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos como chocolate,café,leche,mates y sandwichs,ella vende en el mercado de Anta desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia también vende maíz y cebada en el mercado de Anta, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de desayunos y negocio de venta de maíz y cebada. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como leche, panes, maíz y cebada al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca, 49, belongs to the “Amanecer Anteña” (Anta Dawn) communal bank located in Anta District belonging to Anta Province, Cusco Department.

She’s single and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with selling breakfasts of chocolate, coffee, teas and sandwiches.  She sells in Anta’s market from 6am until 2pm.  She also sells corn and barley in Anta’s market.  Through these businesses she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand the business of selling breakfasts and the sales of corn and barley.  She is requesting the loan to buy products like milk, bread, corn and barley at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy products like milk, bread, corn and barley at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mwahanje

texts.en:
Mwahanje is a married man with 10 children, eight of whom attend school, while two are too young for school. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Mwahanje has operated a retail shop for the past 24 years; his potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of credit sales when his customers take too long to pay their debts. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for his shop. He decided to join Yehu to acquire loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for his shop.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 40 years old and lives in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past twenty years, Rachael has been working hard to manage her store, which sells mattresses and bedding. 

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more mattresses for resale, and will help Rachael to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. Rachael hopes that in the future she will be able to continue growing her business. 

Rachael is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rachael who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses for resale

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.es:
La Sra Maria tiene 42 años y está casada con Héctor, tienen 5 hijos, todos ellos aún está estudiando en la escuela.
María es costurera y con ella trabajan sus tres D. sus hijas, todas juntas por medio del apoyo constante ayudan con los gastos D. la casa. Anteriormente Maria trabajaba en una empresa D. costura y D. poco fue juntando su plata hasta comprar una máquina D. coser y así se independizó. Su sueño es tener bastante capital para comprar telas y tener su negocio D. ventas en su casa, la empresa es familiar y también quiere que la empresa siga creciendo para darle oportunidad a otras personas para que trabajen.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. una máquina D. coser, lo cual le será D. mucha ayuda en su taller D. costura y agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da en el crédito, ya que para ella y su familia es un apoyo importantísimo.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 42 years old and married to Héctor. They have five children who are all attending school.

María is a seamstress and works with three of her daughters. They constantly help one another in this business so that they can cover the household expenses. María previously worked at another sewing business and was gradually setting asiD. enough money so that she could buy a sewing machine and become independent. Her dream is to have enough capital in order to buy fabrics and have a retail business in her home. Her venture is family-owned, but she also wants to continue growing so that she can proviD. employment opportunities to other people.

María is requesting a loan in order to buy a sewing machine, which will be a great help in her workshop. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity given to her through this loan. This is an important source of help for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Lauren Vanessa

texts.es:
Lauren Vanessa tiene 27 años de edad, y vive con sus dos pequeños hijos de siete y cinco años. Lauren es madre y jefa de hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de marca desde hace un año, vendiendo de forma ambulante de comunidad en comunidad. Lauren vende 100% de sus productos al contado, por lo que cada 15 dias introduce nuevos productos para la venta. Ella se levanta a las 5 am para alistar a sus hijos para la esculea, y posteriormente ella sale a vender en la mañana hasta las 11:30 am. A esa hora ella recoge sus hijose de las escuela, les da de almorzar, y luego sale a vender de nuevo hasta las 6 pm.

Lauren ha solicitado un prestamo a Fundacion Mujer para la compra de ropa de marca para la venta. Ella tiene como objetivo crecer sus ventas y su negocio, ya que sus hijos dependen enteramente de ella. De esta forma ella espera darles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Lauren Vanessa is 27 years old and lives with her two young children who are 7 and 5 years old.  Lauren is a mother and head of household.  Her business is selling brand-name clothing and she has been in business for one year.  She makes her sales as a traveling saleswoman, moving from community to community.  Lauren sells 100% of her products for cash and, every two weeks, she introduces new products for sale.  She gets up at 5.00am to get her children ready for school and then she goes out to make her sales in the morning until 11.30am.  At this time she picks her children up from school, gives them lunch, and then goes back out to sell her products until 6.00pm.

Lauren has requested a loan from Fundación Mujer to buy brand-name clothing to sell.  Her goal is to grow her sales and her business as her children depend completely on her.  In this way, she hopes to provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to buy unisex brand products to sell

loans.name: Navruz

texts.ru: Навруз проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Навруз занимается изготовлением деревянной национальной посуды из дерева (табаки чуби). Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Он берет кредит для приобретения сырья.
texts.en: Navruz lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children.  Navruz is involved in making national wooden dishware (tabaki chubi).  He has been in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of raw materials.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with three children. She is 33 years old and resides in Montol, Ozamiz City, Philippines. 

Zenaida owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Zenaida has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost 4 years. In the future, Zenaida hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling used clothing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell for her buying and selling of used clothing business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 22 years. Cecilia earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en: Knarik lives with her husband and children. She keeps an orchard and cultivates land. Knarik has applied for a loan to improve her orchard. She will use the loan to purchase wire and columns to protect the orchard and fertilizer for it. Improvement of the orchard will allow Knarik to grow trees, cultivate the land more effectively, and increase her harvest.

loans.use: to pay for wire, columns and fertilizer for her orchard.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has one child.  She sells charcoal at Asebu Brebia, which she has done for six years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family.  She will use the loan to purchase bags of charcoal to resell.  With the new profits, Efua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Chirongo

texts.en: Chirongo is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruits such as oranges, tomatoes, mangoes, tomatoes, maize, beans etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located along a busy shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the shortage of vegetables and fruits. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. His business goal and dream is to own a big farm within 5 years.

loans.use: to add stock of  vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pisco la cual se caracteriza por su clima acogedor y sus hermosos atractivos turísticos, Maria vive al lado de su madre a quien cuida y apoya con el fruto de su trabajo. Maria aprendió desde joven el valor del trabajo ya que su madre no tenia muchos ingresos y tuvo la necesidad de apoyarla, por ello no logro terminar sus estudios. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar de venta de abarrotes, desde hace desde 3 años, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con sus clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos  a precios cómodos y sobre todo de calidad.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz por sacos, azúcar, fideos, conservas, entre otros; de esta manera podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer y mejorara sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para lograr su más grande sueño:”  Tener un minimarket y seguir apoyando a su madre”.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pisco known for its warm climate and beautiful tourist attractions. She lives next to her mother who she cares for and supports with the payoff from her work. Maria learned at a young age about the value of work since her mother did not have much money. She needed to support her, so she was not able to finish her studies. Little by little, with a lot of effort and savings, she started to sell groceries three years ago. She works in her business about ten hours and she can serve up to 15 customers daily. She believes that her business is going very well because she is very friendly with her customers and more than anything, because she offers good quality products at a comfortable price. 

Maria is very grateful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they offer she will be able to purchase merchandise for her business like bags of rice, sugar, noodles, canned food and other items. With these products, she will have a greater variety of products to offer to customers and she will improve her earnings. This will allow her to continue fighting to achieve her biggest dream of having a minimarket and to continue supporting her mother.

loans.use: purchase merchandise like bags of rice, sugar, noodles, canned food and other items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more land.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.en:
Piedad has been selling clothing since she was 16 years old due to the financial circumstances in her home. After working in a department store for a small wage, she decided it would be more profitable to buy clothing wholesale and sell on her own. Piedad sells her clothing by traveling around the community offering her products. She targets friends and families as her main client base.

Piedad is a single mother of four children. Three of her children are in school and the youngest one is stays at home with Piedad’s mother. She lives with her brother and mother who help her as much as they can. Piedad’s income is used to educate and feed her kids and to contribute the household.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy clothes from a wholesale distributor

loans.name: Darwing

texts.en:
Darwing works making and selling "encebollados" (a local dish made with onions). Darwing arrived in Guayaquil five years ago, coming from Milagro where where he did agricultural work. He started out with the help of his cousin, who taught him the business. He makes the encebollados and sells them on the corner in his neighborhood.

Darwing will use this loan to invest in the purchase of tables, benches, and pots that he needs. He is convinced that his sales will increase and improve his quality of life.

Darwing is 30 years old, he is married and his wife helps him in the business. He has one child, 2 years old. He hopes with his earnings to save enough money to expand the business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Darwing se dedica a la elaboración y venta de encebollados. Darwing llego a Guayaquil hace 5 años proveniente de Milagro donde se desempeña en labores agrícola. Empezo con la ayuda de su cuñado que le enseño el negocio.El elabora los encebollados y los vende en la esquina de su barrio.

Darwing usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mesas, bancos y ollas que necesita. El esta convencido que sus ventas crecerán y mejorara su condición de vida.

Darwin tiene 30 años, es casado y su esposa le ayuda con su negocio. Tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edades espera con las ganancias ahorrar para crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Darwing will use the loan to invest in the purchase of tables, benches, and pots that he needs.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina A. is a 65-year-old widow and mother of four children. She lives in Kisumu, Kenya. Dina started her business selling fish in 1961. With the profits, Dina set up four housing units (mud-walled houses), which she rents out at Kshs 500 (approximately US $15) a month. Her monthly income totals US $200. Dina's business is in a prime location on a busy street. Her years of experience and the friendly relationship she has with customers, plus three previous loans from KMET, have enabled her to establish a good clientele base. Dina plans to expand her business with her next loan of US $800.  She will use  the loan to invest in purchasing a stock of dry fish and to build more housing units.

loans.use: To increase the stock of dry fish.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Mrs. Moa P. is a widow of 39 years old. She sells rice and khmer food in front of her house in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She earns 10 dollars a day. Mrs. Moa P. would like to purchase tools and equipments for her store. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She hopes to receive $1,000 in loans to help her food sales business.

loans.use: To purchase equipments and tools for her store.

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy Ebeye is a young dynamic woman who is 45 years of age. She is married with four children, lives in the semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo, State of Nigeria and started her business in the year 2002. She sells provisions, bread, and drinks to the people living in her community. She hopes to get the loan of US $550 to enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, bread, and drinks

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en: Rafik has a bakery in which he sells what is called a 'mankouché,' which is dough on which is added thyme or other ingredients. The 'makouche' is very tasty and very well-known in Lebanon. Rafik bakes the 'mankouche' and sells it in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. He is 30 years old and wants to buy enough flour to stock it because the price of that item is getting more and more expensive. Rafik is an ambitious man who also opened a vegetable shop in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: To buy enough flour for his bakery

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Mrs. Ines lives in her own house with her husband and sons on December 14Th Street in the Alto Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz. She has previously obtained a loan through Kiva which she totally repaid. She used the money to increase her working capital. Ines makes wool blankets from Vicuna and Alpaca. In the mornings and part of the afternoons she spins the wool using wooden staffs. She works together with another lady who is in charge of the knitting. They divide the profits between them.

She is now requesting a loan to buy a wool spinning machine. Spinning manually is very tiring and she cannot fulfill all the outstanding orders.

Her credit history makes her eligible for a new loan. Her repayment history is very good.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ines vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle 14 de diciembre de la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella ya obtuvo un primer crédito a través de Kiva, el anterior fue cancelado en su totalidad y sirvió para aumento de su capital de trabajo; Ines se dedica a la elaboración de mantas de Vicuña y Alpaca durante la mañana y parte de la tarde ella hila en ruecas de madera y trabaja con una señora que es la que se encarga de tejer con la cual divide las ganancias.

El crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar una maquina de hilar ya que manualmente se cansa mucho y no alcanza a cubrir los pedidos que le hacen.

Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, pues su historial de pagos es muy bueno.

loans.use: Purchase of wool spinning machine

loans.name: Elham

texts.en: Elham is the 58-year-old mother of ten children. She lives with her family in the region of Lebanon known as Borj Barajneh, where she owns a grocery store. She needs a loan to buy merchandise to sell to her customers. This is the fourth time Elham has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua, and we are very confident that she will make good use of this one, as she has with all the previous ones.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Namuyingi Ii E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jafat N.. She currently runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator. Jafat is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has four children, ranging from 5 to 11 years old. Her children do not go attend school. Each week, Jafat makes approximately UGX 80000 in profits. With the extra profits she will make with the help of a loan, she hopes to build a house. Jafat has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, to the amount of UGX 150000, in order to increase her capital. The loan was paid back on time.

Jafat is joined in her small group by Aliyas M., Hadijah N. and Sarah N.. Aliyas M. has a business selling charcoal and wants to start a poultry business. Hadijah N. is currently operating a grocery store and wants a loan to expand her business. Sarah N. operates a retail shop and wants to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Khakim

texts.en:
Khakim is 34 years old. He is married and has a one-year-old son. Khakim is running his own store selling foodstuff along with personal use items like perfumes, tooth brushes razors and other items. Khakim's wife helps him by working as a sales person in the store. At the same time Khakim provides taxi services with his vehicle. His store is located at one of the stops of the public transport system. This helps Khakim to have many clients part of who are customers for his store. Both of these businesses are successful, generating a stable income for the family.

Khakim purchases the goods for selling in his store in the neighboring city. Currently, he's planning to purchase additional inventory in order to increase the range of goods in his store. At the same time his car needs minor fixing. For all of this Khakim is requesting $600 for the term of 9 months. This is the first loan for Khakim and he thanks all who trust and support him, and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for selling in the store and minor fixing of the vehicle.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en: Almira was born in 1978 and she is not married. She lives alone in a small place called Orahovica. She earns 300,00KM monthly from agriculture work. In the period when she is not employed, Almira sells cosmetics. She wants to use this loan for 1000, 00KM for growing potatoes to enlarge her business and earn additional income.

loans.use: For growing potatoes.

loans.name: Norma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Norma is single and sells women’s shoes and purses for a living. She started this business in order to cover some of the expenses she had because she was not able to help her family with the salary from her job. She started her business 5 years ago with the help of her mother, who lent her some money so that she could buy merchandise. Her business is going well since she now has a business space in which to sell her products.

She needs a loan of $975.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can remodel her business space because she would like to expand it. With your support, she will achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es soltera y se dedica a la venta de zapatos y bolsas para dama inicio el negocio para cubrir algunas necesidades económicas que tenia, ya que con el sueldo que percibía en su trabajo no le alcanzaba y ella deseaba ayudar a los gastos familiares. Inicio hace 5 años con la ayuda de su mama quien le presto dinero para que empezara a comprar mercancía. Actualmente le va bien ya que cuenta con un local donde vende sus productos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para la remodelación de su local, ya que desea ampliarlo. Con tu apoyo ella podrá hacer esto posible.

loans.use: Remodel business space

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga and Alejandro are the parents of two young children who have become the center of their lives. Since their marriage, they have worked hard to provide safety, tranquility and above all education for their children. For these reasons, this diligent and creative couple has decided to begin making handcrafted shoes in their own workshop. Aside from this job, on the weekends Olga buys and sells cattle to earn extra money to use in the creation of her workshop. However, due to the recent surge in demand for her shoes, Olga needs to buy a large quantity of raw materials to complete these orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Olga y Alejandro son padres de 2 pequeños niños que se han convertido en el principal impulso de sus vidas. Desde que se unieron trabajaron arduamente con el fin de brindarles seguridad, tranquilidad y sobre todo educación a sus retoños, es así que esta diligente pareja por iniciativa y creatividad propia decidió incursionar en el oficio de elaboración de calzados, iniciaron de manera artesanal pero poco a poco fueron implementando su tallercito.Adicionalmente a esta labor Doña Olga los fines de semana se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, los ingresos que obtiene con este oficio le permitieron implementar aún más y en poco tiempo su tallercito, pero ahora viendo la cantidad de solicitudes que tienen se ve en la necesidad de adquirir gran cantidad de materia prima y así cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of a large quantity of raw materials

loans.name: Perci

texts.es:
Ever since creating a family, Perci has devoted himself to satisfying the needs of his home. Thanks to successfully obtaining a motorcycle, he can work regularly and with joy thanks to being able to bring bread home daily, and moreover, being able to educate his children. Because his work is very demanding due to the hours invested in driving all over the city, Perci would like to increase his work by buying another motorcycle that he can rent out and manage in order to obtain better earnings. The amount that is required to buy a new vehicle is $200, money that he does not have right now, but asks for as a loan with the hope that he can count on your economic support as his business grows.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Perci desde que consolidó su familia se entregó por entero a poder satisfacer las necesidades dentro de su hogar. Gracias a que logró adquirir un motocarro, puede trabajar con normalidad y con mucha alegría, porque gracias a su trabajo puede llevar un pan diario a su hogar y sobre todo tener la posibilidad de educar a sus hijos. A pesar de que su trabajo es muy sacrificado por las horas invertidas manejando por toda la ciudad, Perci desea multiplicar su trabajo comprando una moto más, la cual pueda alquilar y administrar para obtener mayores ganancias, el monto que requiere para adquirir esta nueva movilidad es de 500 soles, dinero con el que por ahora no cuenta, pero lo solicita como préstamo con la esperanza de poder encontrar en usted un apoyo para crecer económicamente.

loans.use: To purchase an additional motorcycle to rent out and improve income to sustain his family.

loans.name: Chany

texts.en: Mrs. Chany L. lives in Tie Muoy Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She is a middleman who buys sugarcane to resell.  Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it.  She decided to ask for a loan to buy more sugarcane to sell.  Her husband, Mr. Hoeurn Chhay, is a taxi driver who can earn a small income for their family.  Mrs. Chany L. is 50 years old and the mother of three children, who are all attending high school.  Mrs. Chany L. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more sugarcane to resell

loans.name: Minerva Herminia

texts.es:
Minerva inició el negocio porque no tenía un trabajo estable y tenia que obtener recursos para los gastos de su casa y de sus 3 hijos: Lorena Elizabeth de 20 años, Yaneth de19 años y Guadalupe de 18. Comenzó hace 4 años vendiendo accesorios para teléfonos celulares, posterior mente agrego, teléfonos y tarjetas telefónicas y ahora vende varios otros articulos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Minerva opened her business because she could not find stable work and she needed income to cover the costs of raising her three children: Lorena Elizabeth (20 years old), Yaneth (19 years old) and Guadalupe (18 years old). Four years ago she began selling cellular telephone accessories. She later added telephones and telephone calling cards, and now sells many more goods. Minerva needs a loan of $250 -- which she will pay back in 4 months -- to purchase merchandise and, in doing so, continue making sales.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom P. is 29 years old and lives in Odombang II Commune, Battambang Province. She is a hairdresser and has a small shop. She has been in this business for more than two years. Sreymom is married to Mr. Ho Chan, who is a motorcycle taxi driver, earning approximately US$5.00 per day. Sreymom does not have children.

Mom has regular customers and their number has been increasing. Recently, she decided to improve her business, but she lacked the capital to do so. Facing this obstacle, Sreymom decided to ask of a loan of US$500 to purchase more hairdressing materials and to decorate her shop in order to attract customers.

loans.use: To improve a beauty salon

loans.name: Satou

texts.fr: SATOU N. EST VEND  DES CEREALES DEPUIS 07 ANS AU QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. AVEC LE PRET , ELLE COMPTE RENFORCER SES ACTIVITES.ELLE EST MARIEE.
texts.en:
SATOU N. has been selling grain for seven years in the NDAYANE district of DIOURBEL. With the loan, she intends to bolster her business. She is married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in grain

loans.name: Gladys Del Carmen

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Gladys P. H., me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, como ser granos basicos, harina, manteca, mantequilla, refrescos, churros, embutidos, jabones, azucar, tortillas, rasuradoras, baterias, sopas, avena etc, soy casada y medre de dos hijos, me he dedicado a trabajar independiente desde hace mucho tiempo, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para cubrir con los gastos de nuestro hogar, en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder hacer crecer mi negocio el cual es mi unica fuente de ingresos, en estos tiempos es muy dificil conseguir trabajos.
texts.en:
Hi. My name is Gladys P. H.. I am dedicated to selling popular products such as basic grains, flour, lard, butter, refreshments, sausages, ham, sugar, tortillas, razors, batteries, soups, oats, etc. I am married and a mother to two children. I have been dedicated to working independently for a long time. I receive help from my husband to cover the bills. At this time, I need a loan in order to grow my business which is my only source of income. Currently, it is difficult to find work.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna A. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Achutti in the Bware sublocation of Rongo District. In 1981, she married a local school teacher; they now support 7 dependents, and 2 of them are in school.

Anna runs a tailoring and dressmaking business in Achutti Market. She has had this business since 2002; she started with her own savings and has improved the business with additional funds from K-MET. She purchases supplies in small quantities from nearby Migori and sells her sewing creations around locally and from her stall at the Achutti Market.

Anna is requesting a loan of 22,500 KSH (US$ 300) in order to buy more materials and sewing supplies. The profits from her business enable her to pay school fees for her children and pay household expenses, so she would like to expand and be able to make higher profits.

loans.use: To purchase dressmaking materials and supplies

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen tiene 36 años, vive con sus  hijos en su propio departamento. Desde hace más de 5 años vende productos de belleza, Karen es una persona muy ordenada y bien organizada, tiene una detallada lista con todos los datos de sus clientes, para poder ofrecerles sus productos y atenderles con mayor calidad. Ella disfruta de realizar esta actividad, porque le permite tener tiempo disponible para atender a sus 3 hijos que están en edad escolar, a su vez, ha aprendido a afrontar los riesgos de su negocio, tales como dar crédito y que sus clientes no le paguen a tiempo, a la que Karen se provee de diversos mecanismos de cobranza. En el futuro le gustaría tener un stand comercial, donde pueda exponer sus productos. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a trabajar con mucho compromiso y ganas de emprender un trabajo coordinado con las integrantes de su grupo solidario. La cantidad que está solicitando, en su totalidad, será usada para la compra de más cosméticos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Karen is 36 years old and lives with her children in her own apartment. For more than 5 years she has been selling cosmetics. Karen is a very orderly and well organized person, she keeps a detailed record with all the data of her clients to be able to offer them her products and attend to them properly. She enjoys this activity because she has time to be with her 3 school-aged children, and she has also learned to face the risks of her business, such as giving credit and that her clients do not pay punctually and she knows several mecanisms for debt collection. In the future she would like to have a commercial stand where she can exhibit her products. This is her first loan with MFP and she feels obliged to work with commitment and wholeheartedly with the members of her solidarity group. The total amount requested with be spent on buying cosmetics in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise.

loans.name: Abdilia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Abdilia del carmen tiene la edad de 49 años,  habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad para apoyarle con los gastos de la familia ya que ellos tiene a su cargo una hija la cual actualmente estudia y trabaja .Doña Abdilia tiene quince años trabajando como comerciante en el mercado oriental su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras, a través del financiamiento que Afodenic le a brindado durante este ha mejorado su inventario. A veces tiene dificultad ya que las ventas actualmente  están bajas, con esta solicitud va a comprar productos variados y verdura para llenar el inventario y ofertar a sus clientes las frescas frutas para su consumo diario., espera que con la ayuda de Dios y el  apoyo de Afodenic saldrá hacia delante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Abdilia del Carmen is 49 years old, lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood of Ticuantepe municipality with her husband who works as a security guard to support her with the family’s expenses as they have a daughter who is in school and works. Abdilia has been working as a vendor in the western market for 15 years, selling fruits and vegetables. Through financing form Afodenic she has improved her inventory. Sometimes she has difficulty as her sales today are low. With this loan she is going to buy a variety of products and vegetables to fill her inventory and offer her customers fresh fruits for daily eating. She hopes that with God’s help and Afodenic’s support she will be successful in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits, vegetables, and othe products

loans.name: Ravshanjon

texts.en:
Ravshanjon S. is 34 years old. He is married and has 2 children to support and provide an education for. 

Ravshanjon has been providing tractor services at the local farm since 1999. To earn additional income, he breeds calves, cows, and sheep and sells them at the local market. He has been able to improve his financial situation by wisely using prior loans he received from IMON International to breed his animals. Now his biggest dream is to expand his business by offering dairy products to the community. He would also like to purchase spare parts to repair his tractor.  Ravshanjon is requesting a loan of $1100 USD and is hopeful for your generosity.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for repairing tractor, purchasing cattle

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El socio JULIAN; tiene 73 años de edad, es casado y tiene 12 hijos, el último hijo del socio Julian tiene 22 años de edad, el vive en el barrio de picchu la rinconada; a 35 minutos de la cuidad del Cusco.

El socio es jubilado, el trabajo en el club Cusco durante 35 años, el ahora se dedica junto a su esposa a atender su tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual solicita el préstamo para así el poder implementar su negocio de abarrotes y tener más variedad en sus productos.

El socio está muy agradecido por la oportunidad otorgada y valora el esfuerzo de este medio, por lo cual se compromete a cumplir con los pagos establecidos, ya que el es una persona muy confiable y cumplida.
texts.en:
Julian is 73 years old. He is married and has 12 children. His youngest child is 22 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of Picchu La Rinconada, which is located 35 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Julian is retired now. He worked for 35 years at Club Cusco. Now he and his wife work together running a small grocery store that they own. He is asking for a loan so that he can add merchandise to his store and have a greater variety of products.

Julian is very thankful for the opportunity to get a loan for his business. He really values the help being offered to him and he promises to be very responsible about making payments on the loan. He is a very responsible and trustworthy person.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add stock to his small grocery store

loans.name: Todjiddin

texts.en:
Todjiddin M., 25 and single, comes from a very large family, so  to support his parents, he has been running his own business for four years selling perfume for women,  cologne for men, air fresheners, tooth pastes and brushes. Todjiddin has been a client of IMON since June of 2007 and has always met his repayments on time. Today Todjiddin is requesting $1300 to expand his business and increase his working capital.  He would like to thank all supporting him and promises to repay the loan in nine months.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods he carries.

loans.name: Pernalin

texts.en: Pernalin M. is fifty-five years old and married with six children. She lives in Goleo, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She started her fishing venture in 2004. Her husband plays a big role in the business by operating one of the boats. Most of their income is derived from their fishing business. So far they are doing well, and they are planning to purchase another fishing boat. Pernalin is very optimistic that they can raise more income to support the family when she is granted the loan.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP15,000 ($325) as her working capital for the maintenance of her hog raising business.  She is 54 years old and single. She is happy with her life and raising her hogs.  

She considers her business a family, a home, a habit and a good livelihood that she hopes to grow in the future for it really helps her in providing for the needs of her parents and assisting her younger sister and brothers with their own families.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase small farm tools and training

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is thirty five (35) years old.  She is married and has been blessed with one child.  She is resourceful and enterprising.  She attended vocational school, but she could not complete her program for lack of adequate funds.  She later married a man and gave birth to a child.  It is her dream to continue her vocational program in cooking to add value to herself.  She operates a local restaurant and sells local food like “fufu”.  Fufu is prepared from pounding cassava and plantain and is eaten with soup, together with any kind of fish or meat.  She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly, and she is no longer able to meet her production expenditures.  

She needs the loan to inject additional capital into the business in order to scale up production and maintain quality.  She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.  Dora is a member of a group called ‘Success.'

loans.use: To buy more baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Alakonon

texts.fr:
A. Alakonon est née vers 1950 à AGBODJEDO, un quartier populaire de COTONOU, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Alakonon est originaire de Hlacomey, un quartier situé à quelques mètres du premier. Alakonon est veuve et mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles et deux garçons tous majeurs. 

Alakonon vend de crevettes fumées et  de crabes frais.  Alakonon obtient ses produits de deux pêcheurs par troc. C’est-à-dire que échange les crevettes et crabes frais avec des filets de pêche. En effet, Alakonon connaît exceptionnellement deux pêcheurs qu’elle aide à acheter les filets servant à pêcher. Ceci permet à ces pêcheurs de se doter de matériel de travail efficace. De retour de la pêche, ces pêcheurs livrent le fruit de leur travail à Alakonon qui trouve de quoi ravitailler ses nombreux clients. 

Pendant la saison des pluies actuelle au Bénin, la crue fait monter le niveau d’eau sérieusement.  La pêche est pertubée et  les crustacées se font de plus en plus rares. Par conséquent, les produits de pêche coûtent très chers actuellement. Afin de faire face à cette inflation, Alakonon sollicite pour son sixième crédit de ALIDé. Alakonon est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien et régulière ses crédits.
texts.en:
A. Alakonon was born around 1950 in AGBODJEDO, a working-class district of COTONOU, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She traces her roots to Hlacomey, a district located a few meters away. She is a widow and the mother of four children, of whom two are girls and two are boys, all of age. Alakonon sells smoked shrimp and fresh crabs. She obtains her products from two fishermen through bartering, that is, the exchange of shrimp and fresh crabs for fishing nets. Basically she knows two fishermen exceptionally well who she helps by buying nets. This allows the fishermen to be supplied with effective work equipment. Upon returning from fishing, these fishermen deliver the fruits of their labor to Alakonon, who finds something there to supply her numerous customers. During the current rainy season in Benin, the flood waters are rising to serious levels. Fishing is disrupted, and shellfish are more and more scarce. As a result, seafood is very expensive right now. To address this inflation, Alakonon is requesting her sixth loan from Alidé. She is a former Alidé client who indeed repays her loans and regularly.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh shrimp

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: El señor Carlos Arturo Gutiérrez García , tiene  41 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor Gutiérrez García tiene la actividad económica de  un taller de reparación de bicicletas, en la que además vende los repuestos. Este está ubicado en el mercado. Don Carlos Gutiérrez dio inicio a su negocio hace  12 años con una pequeña cantidad de repuestos, influenciado en parte por sus familiares que se dedican a la venta de repuestos de bicicletas. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos de bicicletas, ya que su negocio está ubicado en una zona de fácil acceso que le permite realizar la venta de repuestos y además instalarlos al mismo tiempo, por lo que vende más. Su esposa trabaja como comerciante de ropa y artículos varios, por lo cual también aporta para el sustento del hogar. Su sueño siempre ha sido tener un taller grande el cual pueda abastecer a muchas personas y también brindar empleos.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Arturo Gutiérrez García is 41 years old, married, and has two young children. Mr. Gutiérrez García has a bicycle repair shop, where he also sells spare parts. Mr. Carlos Gutiérrez started his business twelve years ago with a small quantity of spare parts. He began repairing bicycles in part at the urging of his relatives.

He would use the loan to buy more spare parts for bicycles, because his business is located an easily accessible area which would permit the sale of more spare parts. Also because he can install these parts as well, he sells more.

His wife works dealing clothing and various other goods, which also contributes to their household income. His dream has always been to have a large store that could meet the demands of many people and also provide jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more bicycle parts

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en:
Sandagsuren D. is 37 years old and the father of a 9-year-old daughter. He currently resides with his daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia’s central provinces. His daughter is a first grade student in a local high school.

Sandagsuren has been running a small bakery shop since 2001. He started his bakery business alone and, since then, his business has expanded and now employs three people. He mostly supplies his bakery products to nearby grocery and convenience stores. Since the start, his business has been quite successful and his business capital has increased from 200,000 MNT to 1,500,000 MNT (1 USD = 1,450 MNT).

In the near future, Sandagsuren would like to expand his business by making instant noodles for local customers. He sees a great potential for the product to be a success in the town. Sandagsuren requests a loan to purchase ingredients for his bakery business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his bakery business

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, and he is now settled in Absheron region. Ilgar was born in 1963, and he is married with three children. He started his taxi business 14 years ago. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Leycy

texts.es:
La Sra. Leycy A. A. tiene 21 años, vive con su esposo que se llama Victor Quispe Andia con el cual esta casada 5 años. Tiene 2 hijos uno acude a la escuela de la zona y tiene un bebe de 1 año y medio. Viven todavia en casa de los padres de Victor en una zona Lechera y agricola. 

La Sra. Leycy trabaja con ganado lechero desde hace 5 años, se dedica a esta actividad ya que su familia trabajaba con ganado lechero desde hace mucho tiempo y ella aprendio de ellos como cuidar al ganado lechero. Ella con la produccion de leche elabora queso para entregar a una empresa unipersonal que distribuye en los mercados mas cercanos a la ciudad de Cochabamba.

Ella y su familia requieren el dinero para invertir en una cabeza de ganado lechero, esto repercutira directamente y positivamente en sus ingresos para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Leycy A. A. is 21 years old and has been married to Sr. Victor Quispe Andia for 5 years. They have 2 children who attend the local school and also have a baby who is 1½ years old. They still live at home with Victor’s parents in an area known for dairy farming and agriculture.

Sra. Leycy has worked with dairy cattle for more than 5 years. Her family worked on a dairy farm, so she spent much time learning how to take care of the cows. The milk produced on her farm is sold to an individual enterprise that produces cheese and distributes its products to nearby markets in the city of Cochabamba.

Sra. Leycy and her family are requesting a loan to purchase another head of dairy cattle. This will positively impact their earnings and improve the quality of life for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Christina M. is a widow with three daughters. They are 23, 21, and 16 years old. Christina has a small restaurant where she sells rice, meat, “mishkaki,” “chipsi mayai” and other Tanzanian dishes. She opened the business five years ago and works from 5 am until 6 pm every day. She manages to make a monthly profit of $183, which she saves in case of family emergencies.

This is Christina’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She says she looks up to other women in her area who have larger businesses and wants to use this loan to rejuvenate her restaurant. She will buy glasses, cooking utensils, and more food such as vegetables, rice, and soda.

Christina will share this loan with her loan group, Parachichi, which means “avocado” in Swahili. The group has 18 members. Many of the group have small restaurants like Christina, but some of them have salons, tailoring shops, fish stands, and produce shops. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Christina is 2nd from the right in the first row.

loans.use: Glasses and cups, cooking utensils, food stock

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma D. is from the village of Owaon. She is 51 years old. Elma is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Elma raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years with an approximate average monthly profit of 1,700 PHP.

In 2007, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Elma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Elma's 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Wily

texts.es:
Wily, de 36 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable. Vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su querida madre (Juana) de 52 años, a quien desea dar una vejez tranquila.

El negocio de Wily es muy concurrido, sobre todo por los niños, él tiene un local de videojuegos, el cual le ha dado buenos resultados, ya que le deja el dinero necesario para mantenerse y ayudar a su madre. Juegos en Play Station, Nintendo 64, Pimball, etc., son los que ofrece a sus pequeños clientes, quienes prefieren ir a su local por los novedosos juegos que tiene.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la alegría que sienten los niños al jugar, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es controlar que los niños no malogren sus máquinas de videojuego. 
Para el futuro de su negocio espera incrementar el número de máquinas que tiene actualmente.

Este es el primer préstamo de Wily con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy respetuoso con el resto de sus socias. Con los mil soles solicitados hará arreglar sus máquinas de pimball, puesto que por el uso se han ido malogrando.
texts.en:
Wily, 36, is a very hard-working and responsible man. He lives with his beloved 52 year old mother (Juana) in the house his parents inherited. He wants to give his mother a peaceful old age. Wily’s business is very popular, especially with the children. He has a place with video games, which has given him good results. The business gives him the money he needs to support himself and to help his mother. The games he offers to his small customers are Play Station, Nintendo 64, and Pinball, etc. The children prefer to go to his place for the novel games that he has. What he likes most about his work is seeing how happy the children are when they are playing. He has been doing this for five years. The most difficult part is controlling the children so that they do not ruin his video game machines. In the future he hopes to increase the number of machines that he currently has. This is Wily’s first loan with MFP. He knows that he has to make his payments on time, and he is prepared to do so. He is very respected by the other members in his communal bank. He will use the 1,000 PEN that he is asking for to fix his Pinball machines. They has stopped working from so much use.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his video game machines

loans.name: Nwakwabel

texts.en: Nwakwabel is 38 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Delta State, Nigeria and sells food. Nwakwabel intends to expand her business in future. Consequently, she is asking for a loan of N 150,000 so that she can purchase more food to sell. Nwakwabel is a committed LAPO client. She hopes to be able to increase her earnings in the long run and thus be able to provide for her children's education. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more food to sell

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina U. is from the village of Quirino Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Fermina owns & operates a beauty salon. Fermina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fermina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to grow her business. Fermina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fermina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Concepción Group

texts.es:
El grupo concepción está integrado por  tres féminas esforzadas, perseverantes y tenaces una de ellas es  María Concepción P.  de 62 años quien en  1979 instaló su negocio de costura, decoración de eventos y piñatas trabajo que aprendió en la clases de artes manuales de la escuela y los cursos que tomo.

Esta señora asegura que encanta hacer su trabajo y que lo lleva acabo con amor y dedicación ya que la se siente realizada.  Sus compañeras Eveling María L. desde hace dos años vende ropa, cosméticos y piñatas  y Rosalia P. comercializa cosméticos y ropa usada.
texts.en:
The Concepción group is made up of three hard-working, persevering, and tenacious women. One of them is María Concepción P., 62, who started a business that's a combination of dressmaking shop, party decoration shop, and sale of piñatas (jar or pot ornamented with fancy paper and filled with sweetmeats, which is hung from the ceiling so that the merrymakers, one by one and blindfolded, try to break it with a stick) in 1979. She learned these skills in crafts classes in school and in other courses that she took. She assures us that she loves her work and she does it with much love and dedication because it makes her feel fulfilled. Her fellow group members Eveling María L. has sold clothing, cosmetics and piñatas for the last 2 years and Rosalia P. sells cosmetics and used clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy party decorations and fabrics.

loans.name: Lawrencia

texts.en:
Lawrencia is 41 years old, is married, and has given birth to four children. Currently all her children are in school.

Lawrencia has sold porridge in her neighborhood for six years now. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taken with what we call kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about twenty minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With a large customer base, Lawrencia wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar, peanuts and milk to increase production. With the loan she wants to trek to the major farming areas in Ghana like the north of Ghana so that she can buy stock in bulk. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make porridge and kose

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en: Imelda S. is from the village of Sagana, Santiago. She is 49 years old. Imelda is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Imelda S.'s group. Imelda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2005, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Willy Herbert

texts.es:
Willy tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su madre y sus hermanos en el sector Indoamérica de la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace dos años empezó a trabajar en el negocio de venta de balones de gas, el nos comenta que tuvo que empezar este negocio debido a que tiene bajo su responsabilidad el mantenimiento de su hogar  y los ingresos que percibía como peón agrícola no le eran suficientes para solventar sus gastos familiares.

El negocio goza de mucha acogida debido a que la zona en donde vive está alejada del centro de la ciudad y este negocio es el único de su tipo en la zona. Por lo que es de utilidad para las familias del lugar que dependen de este combustible para la elaboración de sus alimentos.

Willy desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más balones de gas pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un joven bastante responsable y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su madre y sus hermanos una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
