Willy, 26, is single and lives with his mother and siblings in the Indoamérica sector of the city of Ferreñafe, which is 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Two years ago he started to sell gas tanks. He told us that he had to start a business because it's his responsibility to support his household and the earnings he got as a field hand weren't sufficient to do so. His business is well-received in his area because the area where he lives is far from the city center and his business is the only one of its kind in the area and families in the area depend on this fuel to prepare their meals. Willy wants to enlarge his business buying more gas tanks but he lacks sufficient funds to do so. For this reason, he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, to request a 1000 new sol loan. He is quite a responsible young man who is dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to provide his mother and siblings with a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gas tanks.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland Tarawallie owns a shop at the back of the central market in Bo. He sells various cooking items both wholesale and retail and has operated this business for twenty years.

He is married and has 10 dependents, four of whom are his children. One of the sons usually helps in the business. His wife is also a trader.

Roland seeks to import more products (food items) from Guinea. He has a very good group credit history and used to be the leader of a solidarity group.

He hopes to use the proceeds to educate his children and to build a house.

loans.use: To import food items from Guinea

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos de 12 y 10 años de edad en el Caserío La Zaranda, una zona netamente agrícola perteneciente al distrito de Pitipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 18 años de edad, empezó trabajando como peón agrícola en los campos de cultivo cercanos y hace algunos años, con el dinero de sus ahorros, pudo adquirir una hectárea de terreno que viene utilizando para sembrar diversos productos que le aseguren un ingreso adicional con el cual mantener a los suyos.

Actualmente desea instalar en su terreno el cultivo de maíz, el terreno ya está limpio y próximo a prepararse. Elias desea sembrar un maíz de buena calidad para obtener una buena producción, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de semilla certificada.

Elias es un padre responsable y muy entregado a su familia y a su trabajo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Elias is a 34 year old father who lives with his wife and two children (ages 12 and 10) in the village of La Zaranda, a distinctly agricultural area that is part of the District of Pitipo in Ferreñafe Province. This area is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Elias has been farming since he was 18 years old. He began working as field laborer for the local farms. Several years ago, with the money that he saved, Elias bought a hectare of land that he now uses to grow a variety of crops to ensure additional income needed to support his family. He wants to grow corn on his land, so he has started clearing the area which is almost ready. Elias wants the corn that he plants to be of good quality so that he can obtain a good harvest. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can invest in the purchase of certified seeds.

Elias is a responsible father who is extremely dedicated to his family and his work. He has already worked with our Institution and has demonstrated that he is a punctual and responsible client when it comes to making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase certified seeds for planting corn

loans.name: Marta Victoria

texts.es: Marta Victoria C. D. H. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos. Marta se dedica a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, las cuales en su mayoría son elaboradas con pedidos previos, y en otras ocasiones ella cose para poder tener ropa a la venta, D. manera que pueda contar con una ganancia extra. DesD. hace 7 años que ella se dedica a este oficio, logrando obtener muchos clientes y al mismo tiempo muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus clientas quienes la recomiendan con mucho fe en ella. Marta solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. tela en diferentes colores y estampados, esto lo hace con el fin D. poder aceptar más trabajo y D. esta manera obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales la beneficien en gran manera, sobre todo porque ella es madre soltera y debe luchar por el bienestar D. sus hijos, quienes son su principal motivo para seguir adelante y esforzarse por ser mejor.
texts.en:
Marta Victoria C. D. H. is 52 years old and lives with her three children in Santa Tecla, which is in the Department of La Libertad. Marta manufactures garments, most of which are produced based on submitted orders. On occasion she will produce a few items to sell on her own so that she can earn some extra income. Marta has been in this business for seven years and has attracted many customers. At the same time, she has garnered very good references because her customers have recommended her with great confidence.

Marta is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can have the necessary funds to buy a large quantity of fabric in different colors and patterns. She hopes to be able to take in more work so that she can generate more income, which will benefit her in a great way. Since she is a single mother, Marta fights for the welfare of her children who are her main source of motivation to continue striving to be better.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric in different colors & patterns

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
La joven Maritza del Carmen H. C. es maestra de primaria en un colegio en el área rural del Municipio de Condega.

Maritza va a utilizar el crédito para la compra de  materiales de construcción para construir un dormitorio en la casa de sus padres y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones así como la de su hijos

Ella empezó a trabajar como maestra de primaria una vez que se graduó como maestra hace 4 años y desde entonces se ha dedicado a esta labor. Ella labora de lunes a viernes y viaja media hora en bus hasta su puesto de trabajo, trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.

Maritza espera poder construir su propio dormitorio en el terreno que sus padres le regalaron y de esta manera tener más privacidad para su familia. Ella es casada y tiene un par de hijos gemelos que aun esta en edad infantil y vive en la casa de sus padres

Este es el primer crédito que ella solicita en Ceprodel para poder realizar la contracción y die que el impacto a sido positivo y espera ir independizándose  a través de los financiamiento y de esta manera seguir construyendo poco a poco a que sus ingresos son bajos.
texts.en:
Youth Maritza del Carmen H. C. is a primary school teacher at a rural area school in the Condega municipality. Maritza will use the loan to buy construction materials in order to build a bedroom in her parent's home, improving their living conditions as well as her children's. She began working as a primary school teacher as soon as she graduated four years ago, and has been a devoted teacher ever since. She works Monday through Friday and travels half an hour by bus to her place of work, from 7 in the morning to 3 in the afternoon. Maritza hopes to be able to build her own bedroom on the land her parents gave to her and that way her family can have more privacy. She is married with infant twins and lives at her parent's house. This is her first loan request with Ceprodel, she will use it to carry out construction. She says the impact has been positive and she hopes to become independent through financing, with which she will continue to build little by little as her income is low.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials (zinc, nails, wooden rulers, etc. )

loans.name: Juana Pabla

texts.es: Doña Juana Menchú Cuenta con un pequeño taller de 1 telar donde elabora cortes típicos para Mujeres  y su residencia es en el  Caserío Chocanac, de la Aldea Vásquez, Totonicapán, su numero de clientes a aumentado por lo que solicita su préstamo ya que ella es Madre Soltera y así poder sacar adelante a su hijo dándole educación como poder tener mejores ganancias y poder cubrir su demanda. Ya que lleva 5 años de trabajar en la Artesanía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Menchú has a small workshop with one loom where she makes typical clothing for women. She resides in the Chocanac housing area of the Aldea Vásquez in Totonicapán. The number of customers has increased which is the reason for her requesting the loan. She is a single mother and wants to get her son ahead by giving him an education. She would like to have a better income and be able to meet her demand. She has been in this craft for 5 years.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Jennebby

texts.en:
53-year-old Jennebby P. is from the town of Sto Niño. She is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Jennebby owns and operates a business raising crops. She owns 3 hectares of rice field and harvests 80 sacks of rice per hectare. She also owns a hectare of coconut field. Jennebby has been engaged in her business for over 12 years now.

In 2008, she joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennebby has successfully repaid a previous loan from the MFI. Jennebby is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan she has taken out from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a hardworking and focused man who owns a barber shop. He has been running the business for seven years and has two employees. He is married and has four children in school. He works hard to educate his children and provide for the family's basic needs. 

He also rents out residential houses to supplement his family income. He has been an active member of Faulu Kenya in a group called Harvesters S.H Ass. He has previously taken out two loans through the group, which he successfully repaid. He has requested a loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a new shaving and smoothing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new shaving and smoothing machine

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María A. C.,  tiene 36  años de edad, hace 5 años se caso con Juan Carlos Delgadillo, viven en la comunidad de Polígono de la  provincia de mizque del departamento de Cochabamba, tienen dos hijos. Su esposo trabaja en construcción y ella le colabora en sus trabajos.  
 
Es muy querida y respetada en el pueblo de mizque, por lo dedicada a su familia y a su trabajo. Ella está solicitando el crédito para   comprar con su esposo una mezcladora para  facilitarle y colaborarle mucho más en los trabajos que realiza  y así  aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su condición de y que sus hijos puedan asistir al colegio en mejores condiciones. El crédito ayudara mucho en el duro trabajo que realiza su esposo juntamente con su familia.
texts.en:
María A. C. is 36 years old. Five years ago she married Juan Carlos Delgadillo and they live in the community of Polígono in the Mizque province, department of Cochabamba. They have two children. María's husband works in the construction sector and she helps him with his work. She is very loved and respected in the village of Mizque because she is devoted to her family and her work. She requests the loan to purchase a cement mixer with her husband. The mixer will enable her to help him even more in his work. This will increase their income and improve their situation, meaning that their children will be able to attend a better school. The loan will be of great help to her husband's and the family's hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement mixer

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba O. sells palm oil in both small and large quantities at Elmina. Araba has been through senior high school. Her husband is a mason. With the income she makes from her sales, she helps her husband take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy extra gallons of palm oil for sale. She anticipates using the new profits she hopes to generate as a result of the loan to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy extra gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis de 32 años, está casado con Flora de 32 años, con quien tiene dos hijos, todos viven en una casa que su tío le alquiló. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a sembrar papa, arveja, maíz, habas y gladiolos, en campos agrícolas, pertenecientes a su suegro, así como en otros arrendados. Él siempre cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, además juntos crían toros, en donde Elvis, los compra siendo terneros, para hacerlos crecer, ensebar y luego venderlos a mayor precio, asimismo cría asnos y animal ovino. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar papa, para protegerlos de las inclemencias del tiempo, porque tiene que ser cuidadoso a la hora de proporcionarle los insumos agrícolas. Él está seguro que su trabajo es rentable, porque cubre los gastos domiciliarios, la educación de sus hijos e incluso puede ahorrar para comprar terrenos productivos, donde sembrará más arvejas y papa, también, piensa comprar varias cabezas de ganado y con el tiempo instalar su establo. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y se siente feliz de seguir trabajando con cada uno de los integrantes de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que recibirá, comprará semilla de arveja y papa de la variedad Yungay.
texts.en:
Elvis, 32, is married to Flora who is also 32 and with whom he has two children. They all live in a house he rents from his uncle. For 10 years, he along with other lessors has planted potatoes, peas, corn, beans, and gladiolas in agricultural fields belonging to his father-in-law. He always has his wife's help. Together they breed bulls that Elvis buys as calves to fatten and sell later at a better price. He also breeds donkeys and sheep. What he likes most about his job is cultivating potatoes, protecting them from inclement weather and tending them with care. Elvis is sure that his work is profitable, because it covers the household expenditures and his children's education. He is even able to save money to buy fertile land, where he will plant more peas and potatoes. He also plans to buy several head of cattle and eventually install a stable. This is the fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and Elvis is happy to continue working with each of the members of his community group. With the loan he receives, he will buy potatoes of the Yungay variety and seeds for planting peas.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for peas and potatoes.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun K. (in the photo), is 54 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokhun Loem, is 51 years old. They have been married since 1982 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, two attend school and another one stays at home. They are living in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Saroeun sells firewood.  He buys trees from fellow villagers and cuts it for firewood. His wife sells vegetables in Phnom Penh market. He is applying for a loan of $1,000 as capital to help his wife to buy vegetables for resale. They will also use a part of the loan to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and firewood for resale.

loans.name: David Edison's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, working in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you teachers of the D.E.C Baptist Model School, Mabanta village, Makeni. D.E.C Baptist Model School was founded in September, 1984. This school came about as a result of the community’s dire need and the Baptist mission’s desire to propagate the Gospel of Christ to the children of the community, especially to the girls. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational area, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their salaries alone. With the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is responsible for deducting the repayments and pays SMT on their behalf.

David E. T. (on the left in the photo) is the leader of this group and headmaster at the school. David is 54 years old and was born in Makama village. He has been in the teaching profession for 29 years now. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has seven children:  two in primary school, three in secondary school, one in college and another who is now an adult. Mr. T. will be using his share of the loan to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school and college fees for his children

loans.name: Rita Araceli

texts.es:
Rita de 40 años, vende almuerzos en su casa vive en una zona periurbana llamada la Perimetral esta rodeada del estero salada y muchas casas de caña a su alrededor. 

Ella comenzó la venta de comida porque su familia siempre a vendido comida. Readecuo un local y lo convirtió en un comedor para vender comida. Inicio con pocas sillas y una mesa pero gracias a la demanda de clientes y sus ahorros pudo estabilizar su negocio. Sus hijas le ayudan a preparar la comida mientras que ella atiende el local. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, legumbres para hacer mas platos y variar un poco en el menú. En el futuro quiere tener  ya un negocio establecido y que su esposo tenga su propio taller de soldadura.
texts.en:
Rita, 40, sells lunches at home. She lives in a periurban area, called Perimetral, that is surrounded by a salty estuary and lots of houses made from sugar cane stalks. She started selling meals because her family has always sold food. She refurbished a spot and turned it into an eatery to sell food. She stared out with just a few chairs and a table but thanks to customer demand and her savings she was able to stabilize her business. Her daughters help her prepare the food while she tends to customers. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar and vegetables to make more dishes and vary the menu a bit. In the future she’d like to have an established business and that her husband has his own welding workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, sugar, vegetables.

loans.name: Juana Gelsamina

texts.es: Juana Gelsamina M. es una comerciante de 34 años de edad, casada, madre de cuatro hijos y junto a su familia reside en el Barrio Centro en la comunidad de San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho. Hace seis años su madre le enseñó a trabajar para que día a día se pudiera ganar el sustento. Desde ese tiempo ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y abarrotería en su casa de habitación, su horario de atención es desde las 6:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm y mientras ella cuida su negocio tres de sus hijos se van a la escuela.  Con el financiamiento obtenido podrá surtir sus dos negocios de más y variados productos. Una de sus dificultades es la ubicación de su casa ya que está un poco escondida y no tiene la oportunidad de exhibir mejor su mercadería. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera seguir  ayudando a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar, y ahorrar para poder alquilar un local que tenga una muy buena ubicación. Su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijos sanos y que se conviertan en personas que contribuyan a la construcción de una mejor sociedad. Es su tercer ciclo en FAMA  y con los financiamientos obtenidos ha podido ir mejorando su vida económica.
texts.en:
Juana Gelsamina M., 34, is married and has four children.  She and her family live in the Centro neighborhood in San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho.

Six years ago her mother taught her how to work so that she would be able to earn her own living.  Since then she has sold clothes and groceries from home.  She is open for business from 6am until 6pm.  While she tends to the business three of her children attend school.

With the obtained financing she will be able to stock both her businesses with a greater variety of products.

One of the difficulties she faces is her house’s location because it’s a bit hidden so she can’t display her merchandise very well.

With help from the loan she hopes to continue to help her husband support the household and save up to rent a place that’s better situated.

Her dream is to see her children grow up healthy and that they become persons who contribute to building a better society.

This is her 3rd FEMA cycle.  With loans received she has been able to gradually improve her economic life.

loans.use: To buy clothes and groceries.

loans.name: Cecilia Wanjeri

texts.en:
Cecilia has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last ten years. She is 26 years old and married to Patrick Gichuki. They have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid her first loan in full and in good time. She plans to use this loan amount to harvest and plant potatoes in her farm.

In future Cecilia hopes to open up a clothes shop in Olkalou town. This will diversify her source of income.

loans.use: To harvest and plant more potatoes in her farm.

loans.name: Tsogtbazar

texts.en:
Tsogtbazar G. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two teenaged children in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of his children attend a local high school, while Tsogbazar operates a small tire repair shop outdoors. He began this service in 2008 after purchasing necessary equipment and tools for his repair center from his brother. He had stopped operating his tire repair business due to cold weather in winter months. He provides a high quality service for his customers, therefore has gained a positive reputation among his customers. 

He is planning to build a small wooden house where will operate his repair shop. For the future, he hopes to have his own car repair center. Since operating his business, his family's standard of living has been improving and with his earnings, he paid for his mother in law's funeral. Tsogtbazar says, "Even though I have a good educational background, I do not regret having to do physical labor. I am glad that my business earnings have helped my siblings and mother and other many people. I used my business profits to provide for my family and siblings who all are very grateful for my business." He is requesting an 500,000 MNT loan to purchase wood and timber in order to build a tire repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase wood and timbers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 40 years old and married to Monica Njeri. They have three children. Monica helps with the farm, which they have been managing for the past two years. They normally sell the produce and farm animals, and from this he and his family get 6,000 Kenyan shillings a month as income. 

This is his first loan with KADET. He has never borrowed from any other microfinance institution before. He intends to buy seedlings, fertilizers and animal feed. 

He hopes to be a leading dairy and crop farmer in the future, which will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer and animal feeds

loans.name: Lynsey Maness

texts.en:
Lynsey Maness E. is a single woman who lives in Purok 8, Malabuhan, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a tricycle transport business. Lynsey Maness joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lynsey Maness has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,300, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use for maintenance of tricycle so that she can continue to save up for the future, to build a new house. Lynsey Maness E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her tricycle transport business.

loans.name: C5507 Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
Ernestine, a 26-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of two and six, is the president of a group called Duterimbere, and she has her hand raised in the picture above. This is her fourth successful year in the business of selling fish, and she works everyday from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m.

Ernestine has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell. With the use of this loan, Ernestine and her team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow each member of the group to start saving as well as building a better future for their families.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 55 años, es una madre de familia muy laboriosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. En un inicio tenía como primer negocio una librería, pero el tiempo le demostró que no le era rentable, antes esto decidió cambiar de rubro; hoy se dedica a la venta de productos perecibles de primera necesidad. Desde entonces se dedica a la venta de especias molidas, verduras y frutas, negocio que le esta yendo muy bien. Ella se siente muy contenta con su tienda, ya que además de vender sus productos, se interrelaciona con sus vecinas. Su buen trato y su paciencia, han hecho que su negocio sea el más concurrido y preferido por sus clientes, por lo que se siente muy motivada a seguir trabajando. Por el momento solo atiende por su ventana, ya que el ambiente de su casa no fue diseñada para este fin; es por ello que planea ampliar su negocio, asimismo desea vender productos naturales, productos que ella misma consume. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, y sabe que le será muy útil este aporte, por ello se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará gaseosas y productos lácteos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 55, is a very hardworking mother.  She lives in her own house, together with her husband and their two children.  Her first business was a book store, but time proved that it was not profitable so she decided to change direction.  Now she sells basic perishable goods like ground spices, vegetables, and fruits, and her business is doing very well.  She feels very happy with her store because not only does she sell her products, but she also gets to interact with her neighbors.  Her patience and good customer service have won her customers' preference and made her business the busiest around.  Therefore, she feels very motivated to keep working.

For now, she only tends to her customers through her window, as her house was not designed for this purpose.  For this reason, she plans to expand her business.  She would also like to sell natural products, which she consumes herself.  This is her second loan through MFP and she knows that this support will be very useful.  She promises to make punctual repayments according to the established schedule.

She will use this loan to buy soft drinks and dairy products to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and dairy products

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea V., 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells rice, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Three of her children are employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 60 on other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Rosa Digna

texts.es:
Rosa, de 31 años de edad, reside en Santiago de María departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad, el negocio lo inicio hace 2 años, lo atiende en el mercado municipal de 5:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos plásticos como guacales, sillas plásticas y Valdés, con los fondos del préstamo espera adquirir todos estos productos a mejor precio para ponerlos a la venta y obtener una mejor ganancia.

Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio cada vez más, que sus ingresos mejoren y dedicarle el tiempo necesario a su familia, ayudando a sus hijos y mejorando la condición de vida de ellos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 31 years old.  She lives in Santiago de María, in Usulután department, with her husband and 6 year-old son.  Rosa has been selling plastic products for 2 years.  She sells her products in the town market from 5.00am to 6.00pm.  Rosa is requesting a loan to buy plastic products such as  crates, chairs and buckets.  She hopes to use her loan money to acquire all these products at a better price so that she can sell them and make better profits.

Rosa's goal is to further strengthen her business, to improve her income, to dedicate enough time to her family, to help her children and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy plastic products such as plastic crates, plastic chairs and buckets

loans.name: Quirico

texts.en:
Quirico C. lives in the village of Libon, Gingoog City. He is 57 years old, married and has two grown children. He makes a living by providing painting services such as art and sign boards to local community members. Quirico has been in this business for more than 20 years and earns about 12,000 PHP a month from his work.

Last year, Quirico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, also for 5,000 PHP, to buy the materials he needs to provide products and services to his customers. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation for Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a small business

loans.name: Maguitos Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Maguitos, se encuentra localizado en Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, está compuesto por 3 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Aurelia Solís M. va a comprar con su préstamo batas de mujer para surtir su negocio, la señora Blanca Gutiérrez Domínguez va a comprar pollo y una lona para promocionar su negocio, la señora Juana Gutiérrez Martínez va a comprar maíz, gas, carne para surtir su negocio, la señora Blanca Gutiérrez Domínguez es integrante de grupo ella tiene 33 años de edad estudio el bachillerado, ella tiene 2 hijos Irma Samanta de 10 años de edad está estudiando el 5º. Año de primaria y le ayuda en el negocio con los mandados, Brando David tiene 12 años de edad está estudiando el 6º. Año de primaria esta con su papa en la Cd. De México, la señora Blanca y su esposo tienen un año de separados, la señora Blanca tiene su negocio venta de antojitos y va a utilizar su crédito para mejorar el negocio para comprar lonas para promocionar su negocio y comprar pollo para surtir su negocio, ella tiene su negocio de lonchería pero la quiere convertir en Burger Sami venta de pollo frito y hamburguesas, su negocio se llama Lonchería Gutiérrez pero en 15 días se va a llamar Burger Sami, sus clientes son las familias jóvenes, jóvenes, niños, y adultos jóvenes, ella ofrece a sus clientes tortas, hamburguesas, hotdog, papas a la francesa, baguete, sincronizadas, sándwiches, flautas, tacos dorados. Ella inicio su negocio hace 1 año, ella ya tiene experiencia tiene 13 años siendo comerciante gracias a su esposo que le enseño, el tiene un negocio en la ciudad de México de Hamburguesas y hotdog y él le enseño este negocio, ella empezó vendiendo en las fiestas del pueblo con un préstamo de su papa le prestó $ 1,500.00 pesos para invertir en la mercancía, con una parrilla que le prestó su mama, con una mesa de 3 divisiones, se instalo con una parrilla grande, una mesa, una hielera y en una mesa con todos los ingredientes, su negocio está en el centro de Cd. Ayala paga renta , esta a dos cuadras de su casa, llega caminando, su negocio es muy importante porque es el patrimonio de su hija de aquí comemos, nos vestimos y de aquí nos sostenemos, la parte favorita de su negocio es que ella es su propia patrona si se siente mal o tiene una emergencia no abre, ella está orgullosa porque su negocio es productivo de ahí paga la colegiatura, los zapatos, los uniformes y se siente orgullosa que no le pide nada a nadie, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son los costos elevados y ventas bajas en vacaciones en el mes de julio, agosto y diciembre, las ganancias del negocio las reinvierte, para vestirnos y calzarnos y en los gastos de la casa, ella quiere meter otro tipo de comida pollo frito tipo ken toqui,  y lo piensa lograr con promoción con una lona llamativa e invertir más en producto. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia cuando tiene dinero le da a sus papas para la despensa, para los alimentos, para el tanque de gas, ella tiene un terreno donde ya construyo los cimientos y le falta las paredes y el techo y quisiera progresar para hacer unos locales propios para su negocio, ella está contenta con este préstamo con la confianza de que sigue trabajando para sacar adelante este crédito y más adelante solicitar otro crédito, para crecer más en el negocio, las mejorías que dese para el futuro de sus hijos son que tengan una buena educación  con un mejor estilo de vida y la señora Blanca también le falta educarse más, ella está aprendiendo más cosas a comprendido que teniendo amistades que si hablan mal o actúan mal piensan que yo soy igual. Cd. Ayala es bonito, el clima es caluroso, hay varios balneario el Axocoche, el Colibrí, Agua Limpia, en estos balnearios nace el agua hay arroyitos donde corre el agua que nace. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por existir y por darnos estos créditos para mejorar nuestros negocios, esperamos y tenemos la confianza de no defraudarnos a nosotras mismas, echarle ganas y seguir en el negocio".
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called “Maguitos” and is located in Ciudad Ayala in the State of Morelos in Mexico. The group consists of three female members who know one another and are neighbors:

• Sra. Aurelia Solís M. will use her loan to buy women’s gowns to restock her business. • Sra. Blanca Gutiérrez Domínguez will buy chicken and a canvas sign to promote her business. • Sra. Juana Gutiérrez Martínez will buy corn, gas, and meat to restock her business.

Sra. Blanca Gutiérrez Domínguez is one of the group members. She is 33 years old and has her high school diploma. Blanca has two children. Irma Samanta is 10 years old and a fifth grade student who helps with the orders in her business. Brando David is 12 years old, is in the sixth grade, and lives with his father in Mexico City. Sra. Blanca and her husband have been separated for a year. She sells snacks and will use her loan to improve her business by purchasing canvas signs to promote her establishment, as well as buy chicken to replenish her inventory. Blanca wants to convert her business into a Burger Sami franchise that sells fried chicken and hamburgers. At the moment, her business is called “Lonchería Gutiérrez” but in fifteen days she will change the name to “Burger Sami”. Her customers include young families, teenagers, children, and young adults. She offers her customers sandwiches, hamburgers, hot dogs, French fries, baguettes, quesadillas, flautas, and crispy tacos. Blanca started this business a year ago, but she has thirteen years of experience as a merchant thanks to everything her husband taught her.

Her husband has a hamburger and hot dog business in Mexico City, so he imparted to her everything he knows about this trade. Blanca started selling at the town festivals. She borrowed 1500 MXN from her father which she used to invest in supplies. Blanca borrowed a grill from her mother and bought three tables: one for setting up the grill, one for holding an ice chest, and another for keeping all of her ingredients. Her business is in a rented location in the center of Ciudad Ayala that occupies two rooms of her house that is within walking distance. This business is very important because it enables her to feed, clothe, and support her daughter. Her favorite part about her business is that she is her own boss. If she feels sick or has to attend to an emergency, then she closes her business.

Blanca is proud that she does not depend on anyone else. Her greatest challenges are the rising costs and low sales that occur during the vacation season in the months of July, August, and December. The earnings from her business are invested in clothes, shoes, and the household expenses. Blanca wants to start selling another type of food, Kentucky Fried Chicken, so she plans to start a promotion with new signs and invest more into his product.

Her business has helped her family whenever she has had to repay her parents for groceries, food, and tanks of gas. Blanca owns a piece of land where the foundation of her house has been built, but it still lacks walls and a roof. She wants to keep progressing so that she can build rooms that she can set aside for her business. Blanca is pleased with this loan and confident that she will continue working to move forward. With this loan and any subsequent financing, she hopes to grow her business even more. She wants to make these improvements in the future so that her children can have a good education and a better lifestyle. Sra. Blanca lacks additional education and there are many more things that she has to learn. Fortunately, she has friends who do not speak badly about her and treat her like an equal.

Ciudad Ayala is a beautiful place with a warm climate. There are several resorts such as Axocoche, Colibrí, and Agua Limpia that have spas in which the water flows from natural springs. The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “We are very grateful that you exist and for giving us loans to improve our businesses. We are confident that we will not disappoint ourselves because we have every intention of moving forward and continuing with our businesses.”

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing fast food & signs for advertising

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes T. R. tiene 51 años, Es Soltera vive un hijo en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable y lograr una buena economía.

Le gusta salir a pasear en el pueblo y festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes T. R. is 51 years old.  She is single and lives with her child in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'Grupo Enmanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat, and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

María is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed from 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and sells her products in Guaranda's 'Feria de los Jueves' market.

María is requesting this loan so that she can grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to have a stable business and to reach a good financial position.

María enjoys going for walks around the village and celebrating fiestas.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals, feed supplies and supplies for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fit out her chicken shed and to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yéssica tiene 19 años, es soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Cliente vive en Mórrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Se dedica a la venta de aves de corral y animales menores, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los engorda y cuando ya han alcanzado un nivel apropiado de desarrollo los comercializa entre los comerciantes de la zona.  Los ingresos que percibe por esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a sus padres con sus gastos del hogar. Adicionalmente Yessica vende productos de belleza y cuenta con clientela fidelizada.

Yéssica desea comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y comprar productos de belleza para poder responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Yessica is 19 years old, single and lives in the home of their parents. She lives in Mórrope, a district populated by humble and hardworking people that work in agriculture. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells chickens and small animals, which she raises in pens in the back of the house. She fattens them and when they have reached an appropriate weight she sells them to merchants in the area. The income that she gets from this activity is used to help her parents with the costs of living. Additionally, Yessica sells beauty products and has a loyal clientele. 

Yessica wants to buy balanced feed for her animals and to buy beauty products to respond to the requests of her clients. In order to achieve her objective, she has asked for a loan of 800 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with seven children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in textiles for ten years starting with a capital of 300,000 shillings and she now has 2,500,000 shillings in working capital. Her hardship is limited capital to meet the increasing demands of her customers and her vision is to have at least an outlet in the city centre.

loans.use: To buy rolls of cloth for resale.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is a 50-year-old farmer from the village of Ilemi, Zestaponi District. She lives in the village with her husband Zaur. 

Gulnara leads the agricultural business of the family; Zaur has health problems and can’t intensively assist his wife. They own three milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold on the local market. Also the family owns a vineyard (2000 grape vines); they sell grapes and wine seasonally. Along with the above-mentioned, Gulnara has two sheep and sells lambs seasonally. The total average monthly income of the family is 320 Laris. 

The credit will be used to purchase an additional milk cow. When the family has four cows, Gulnara will produce and sell more cheese. That will increase the income of the family. For the future Gulnara plans to invest more in her dairy farm and increase the number of her cows.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his juice and soft drinks capital for the summer season

loans.name: Sokleap

texts.en: Sokleap is married and has three children, two of whom attend school.  They live on an Island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sokleap used to be a silk weaver, but she now sells sugar cane juice in front of a garment factory located in Phnom Penh.  Her husband is a construction worker. Sokleap is requesting for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo, 46 years old, is a married man from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He has 3 children. He is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 15  years now.

His average income from doing his business is PhP 13,000 per month. He utilizes his income to provide his family with their basic needs. Receiving a loan would help him buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Nilo hopes to be able to send all his children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 31 years old and single with two children. With two children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a business of buying and selling of silver jewelries in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of silver jewelries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as necklaces, earrings, and rings. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of silver jewelries

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en:
Eva‘s group is comprised of three hard working women. Eva is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children. One of her children is currently in school.  Eva has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Eva hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Eva hopes to own a plot of land. Eva is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar to resell

loans.name: Amalia Felicita

texts.es: Amalia Felicita tiene 56 años, su actividad es la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio a pesar de ser un trabajo agotador ha sabido realizarlo muy bien y se encuentra satisfecha por ofrecerle a su familia el alimento diario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de bananos, naranjas, melones, mangos, sandias y otros productos. La ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del mercado de la terminal en donde diariamente circulan más de veinte clientes a los que ella se encarga de ofrecerle un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Amalia Felicita is 56 years old and earns her living by selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for more than 11 years. Even though the work is hard, Amalia knows how to do her job well and is pleased to provide for her family’s daily needs.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bananas, oranges, melons, mangos, watermelons, and other products. Her business is located outside of the bus terminal market where she can accommodate more than 20 customers at a time each day. She makes sure that she provides them with good service.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, melons, mangos, watermelons, and other products.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Virginia works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish processing.  Virginia is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy passion fruit seeds.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: La señora Albertina es cliente antigua, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos los cuales los carnea y vende por kilos, cada mes aproximadamente de dos a tres cerdos, la señora tiene dos hijas, una en edad escolar y otra pequeña, el esposo se dedica a la venta de arena y piedras para las construcciones, ya que es propietario de una volqueta, los créditos que saco de emprender los utilizo especialmente en la compra de forraje para sus animales, ahora destinara para lo mismo y para arreglo de chiquero, ya que los traslado mas lejos de su vivienda, esto para evitar la contaminación en su casa. La Sra. Albertina es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Albertina is a longtime client. She raises pigs for the meat, which she sells by the kilo. Each month she sells approximately two to three pigs.

Sra. Albertina has two daughters, one who is of school age and another who is still small. Her husband sells sand and gravel. He also owns a dump truck.

The loans she has received from Emprender were used specifically to buy fodder for her animals. Her present loan will be used for the same purpose and she will also repair her pig pen, which has been moved further away from her house to avoid the smell.

Sra. Albertina is a responsible and hardworking individual who is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her pigs and to make repairs to the pig pen.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married with 6 children. She is 48 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Caroline sells medicines such as herbal capsules and herbal oil. She has had this business for 15 years. Each month she earns 10000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 to purchase  6 boxes of herbal capsule and 4 litres of herbal oil to sell.
Caroline has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Caroline hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 6 boxes of herbal capsules and 4 litres of herbal oil to sell

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Doña Luisa, sigue incrementando la venta de sus productos plasticos, el cual sigue elaborando junto a su esposo, y que durante muchos años, han captado su clientela en los mercados capitalino. Son productos accesibles por su precio, y que el ochenta por ciento de los Nicaraguenses compramos los platos plasticos, taza de tomar café, de tomar sopa, baldes grandes, pequeños, siendo de bajos costos y de alta duracion.
Su vivienda la han ido construyendo con ahorros y financiamiento que han hecho en Afodenic, en donde han avanzado mucho en las mejoras, asi como el aumento de su negocio.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para repellar paredes internas de los cuartos, mejorar techo, ya que se lo dejaron mal hecho el trabajo, y que podra dar a mejorar para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Luisa Amanda has continued to increase the sale of plastic items, which she does along with her husband. For years, they have gathered clientele from markets. The products are well-priced, and 80% of Nicaraguans buy plastic plates, coffee cups, soup bowls, and large and small buckets, since they are cheap and last a long time. 

Luisa has been building her house with savings and financing that she has received from AFODENIC. She has been able to make many improvements, similar to the improvements with her business.

Today with this new loan she will be able to plaster the walls in her home, improve the roof (since it was very poorly installed), which will improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to make improvements to the rooms in her house as well as the roof.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school, while one is too young for school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a coconut selling business for the past six years. Her potential clients are the people at the market and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods to the market. She dreams of being able to sell her products wholesale.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase more coconuts and vegetables for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it offers good services to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase more coconuts and vegetables for her new business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member who is an orphan. She sells fruits, vegetables and sweet bananas on a wholesale basis at the market. She has been in business for the last four years. She works six days a week.

She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of fruits, vegetables and bunches of sweet bananas. Her goal and aspirations are to start going to villages for fruits like oranges, pineapples, mangoes and sweet bananas, and also to educate her children to the university level. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the increasing prices of foodstuffs in Uganda. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fruits like oranges, mangoes, pineapples and bunches of sweet bananas.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old and married with two school-aged children. Girlie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like soap, sugar, shampoo, salt, dried fish, food for snacks, soft drinks, noodles, eggs and other items in the local community.

Girlie is very glad and thankful to the cooperative and to the people who supported the previous loan she acquired from GDMPC. She started with a meager amount of capital and now her general store is expanding. The investment grows well. The return is excellent. She was able to send her child to a good school and she oftentimes provides for her family's needs.

Girlie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Girlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional grocery products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Girlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie Ebelina

texts.es:
Marjorie de 42 años, empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien tiene su negocio en el centro de papeleria. Quien decidió ponerse uno en casa para que trabaje su esposa comprando al inicio papeleria, cuadernos, suministros etc. 

En la actualidad trabaja sola todos los días sin horarios fijos. Gracias a Dios no ha presentado ningún problema en su negocio. Tiene un hijo con su esposo, por eso quieren seguir trabjando y mejorar cada dia su estilo de vida con un prestamo y asi comprar papeleria, cuadernos para su negocio. 
 
Su meta a alcanzar es poder terminar de construir su vivienda para vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 42 years old.  She started her business with the help of her husband who has a stationery business in the city center.  He decided to set up a store in their home that his wife could work in and started off buying stationery, composition books, supplies, etc.

Marjorie currently works alone every day.  She does not work regular hours.  Thanks to God, she has not experienced any problems in her business.  She and her husband have a son and so they would like to continue working and improving their lifestyle.  With this loan, Marjorie will buy stationery and composition books for her business.

Marjorie's goal is to finish building her house so that her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy stationery, composition books and pens

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 48-year-old, Lebanese, married woman. She lives with her husband and one child. Elizabeth works with her husband to meet the family's needs and cover their expenses. Her husband works in a local company.  Elizabeth has worked as a cook for the past thirty years, but in 2005 she decided to open her own home business. 

Elizabeth requests a loan of $1300 to buy new cooking equipment. She says that this purchase will make her job easier and faster and definitely increase her revenues. In the future, Elizabeth plans to open her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy new cooking equipment for her home business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 52-year-old married man and a father of four children.

Ali has raised cattle and sold their milk for the past 25 years.  He is an expert in his business and most meat dealers visit him because of the good quality they get.  Ali is a hard worker and a man with a very good reputation. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to prepare his business for the autumn/winter season. He wants to buy a large quantity of cattle food at special prices.  In addition to that, he wants to do necessary maintenance to the cattle's living space.  So, he needs to buy special iron shields to cover the space as much as he can.

Ali is a talented man in his domain, and he hopes to keep improving he business as much as he can by increasing the size of his herd of cattle.

loans.use: to buy necessary food for his cattle for the winter season.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 44 years old, married to Michael and they have four children.  She has been in the tailoring business for the last twenty years sewing clothes for her customers, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 40,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000 to buy textile materials and sewing accessories i.e. buttons thread.  She plans to save the profits for future business expansion. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

Her hopes and dreams are to start a dress-making school and to open up other tailoring outlets.

loans.use: to buy more materials to sew for her customers.

loans.name: Integración Group

texts.es:
El comité “Integración” se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 12 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción. Las mujeres integrantes del comité se esfuerzan para sacar adelante a sus familias, para que ellos puedan disponer de lo que a ellas en su niñez les falto, para proveerlos de los recursos necesarios para su educación y formación.
Maria es una de las integrantes del grupo, y ella nos cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo tiene una despensa, la cual empezó con una pequeña inversión, pero hoy en día ya tiene un buen negocio bien surtido. Su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia. En miras a ese sueño solicita el crédito, para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, carnes, hortalizas y demás artículos de primera necesidad. Para poder abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Integración” committee is in its second loan cycle within Fundación Paraguaya's "Entrepreneurial Women" program.  The group has 12 members who are from Asunción.  The women who belong to this committee work hard to provide for their families so that they can enjoy what they themselves lacked during their childhoods.  They work to provide their families with the resources they need for their education and training.

Maria is one of the group's members.  She tells us that she worked hard to open her grocery store.  She started out with a small investment of money but today she has a good, well-stocked business.  Her wish is to be able to continue growing her business and thereby continue helping her family.  With a view to fulfilling this dream, she is requesting a loan to buy drinks, dairy products, meat, vegetables and other basic household products with which to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, meat, vegetables and other basic household products

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 33 year old married man from Al Karak Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for his home improvements, he wants to maintenance of the door and the stairs. In the future he would like to request another loan to buy an air condition and refrigerator. Also he hopes to improve her home furniture.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y su gran apoyo para seguir luchando cada día. Enrique aprendió desde muy pequeño a trabajar ya que sus padres tenían pocos ingresos y de esta manera el podía apoyarlos. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar uan carrera universitaria.

Día a día Carlos trabaja en su negocio de venta de drywall, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 16 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo porque es responsable en su trabajo.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas para su trabajo como sierra, medidores, tarimas, entre otros, de esta manera el podrá brindar un mejor servicio y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de diseño de interiores”.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man of 28 years of age, who lives in the city of Ica.  This is a place that is known for its warm and welcoming climate.  Carlos lives with his wife, who is his right hand and is his greatest support in his efforts to continue to persevere day by day.  Carlos learned to work from the time he was very young, because his parents had little income, and so in this way he was able to support them.  Due to a lack of financial resources, he was only able to get a high school education, but he would have liked to have been able to study at a university.

Each day, Carlos works in his drywall business.  He works about 10 hours a day, and over this time he tends to about 16 customers a day.  He believes that his business is doing well because he is very friendly, and most of all, is responsible in his work.

Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they are providing him, he will be able to buy tools for his work, such as: a saw, measuring tools, step stools, and other items.  In this way, he will be able to provide better service and can continue to strive to make his greatest dream a reality: to study for a professional degree in interior design.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Damai's Group

texts.en:
Damai is the simple lady standing to the right hand side of the photograph.She lives with her husband and two sons in a village of Koraput district,Odisha,India.She is a farmer and cultivates paddy from last 5 years in order to supplement her family's income and provide a better standard of living to her sons.Her husband helps her in the field to harvest the paddy and they lead a very contended life.

Damai along with her group member is requesting for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase compost and fertilizers to adequately maintain her crop. 

With this,Damai hopes to improve her production and offer a better quality product to her customers. This will allow her to get greater earnings, improving her quality of life and that of her family.

Damai is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers to adequately maintain her crop

loans.name: Jana

texts.en: Yana G. is 31 years old. She has high school education. She is single. After her graduation from high school she worked as a shop assistant-consultant. Five years ago she attended hairdresser’s courses and after that she began working as a hairdresser in a company of her colleague. At the end of 2005 she set up her own company and opened a hairdresser’s that is in the center of the town. Yana G. has a reputation of a good professional.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for hairdresser’s

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old, she is married, and has four children, one son whom they adopted. Josephine is married to a pastor, so apart from her tailoring work, she also works part time to assist her husband with church work. Apart from her children who are now grown up and in various colleges, Josephine also has two dependent children that she supports through paying their school fees back at home. Being the wife of a pastor also requires her to offer support to the members of their church and she therefore also supports two single mothers and one widow who is also her employee.

Josephine started her dress-making business in order to sustain her family in 1992, after she received a loan of Ksh7,000 (USD100) from a local NGO. This loan was to be shared amongst three people and was meant to be used to start a business. The three started a small business in partnership, but within a short time, the other two partners requested that Josephine take over the loan repayment, and to employ and pay them on commission. Josephine later attended a two-year course training in embroidery, tie-dye and fashion design. With the new skills learned, Josephine began to make bridal wear, African attire and even began to make curtains.

Since then, her business has expanded from a small stall which three people shared, to the four stalls that she now owns in the Jericho market, one of the market areas in Nairobi. Josephine now seeks additional support in the form of a loan to enable her to buy bridal wear materials in bulk. For this, she seeks a loan of USD725 repayable within 6 – 12 months. Purchase of these materials will enable her to cut the cost of the materials that she buys in small bits. This will also enable her to give reasonable prices to her customers, and will at the same time ensure that she gets higher income. This will improve the situation at her business, and will help her to continue to maintain her staff.

loans.use: To purchase bulk materials for making wedding gowns

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Gloria Cecilia, and I am a businessperson. I have a general store located in my home, a business which I started with my own effort, and thanks to God it was a good decision because, in addition to generating income, this business also permits me to take care of my family. I have been dedicating myself to this activity for several years. At present, I need to increase the variety of my business, because the customers are asking me for a greater variety of products.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es gloria cecilia, soy comerciante, cuento con una pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación, negocio que inicie con esfuerzo propio y gracias a Dios ha sido una gran elección porque este negocio a parte que me genera ingresos tambien me permite antender a mi familia, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio en vista que los clientes me estan pidiendo mas variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, lard, chicken, eggs, dairy products, flour, sardines, and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a high-breed seeds and organic manure for her farm

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E. is a farmer. She lives in Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria. She is 42 years, and the married mother of two children. She has been a LAPO leader for the past four years. To expand her business growing farm land, Patience is requesting a loan of US $800.

loans.use: To buy more seed for planting

loans.name: Mekhriban

texts.en: Mekhriban (her brother is pictured) has run this business for eight years. She is 23 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Khachmaz region, in Ashagi-Zeyid village. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy cattle to breed to increase the number of their cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
History of the client: Virginia is a traveling merchant. She sells perfumes, cosmetics, and decorations in large quantities. She travels to Santa Cruz (one of the largest departments in the country) every two weeks to carry out her work. This is the fifth time that she is requesting a credit with IMPRO. Her history in our institution qualifies her as a "1" client, which means that she has fulfilled her payment obligations very well. The requested amount will go towards the purchase of merchandise (barrettes, decorations, cosmetics, and perfumes).

Her previous loans and work allow her to request this loan, since she has good experience in her business which will let her earn income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Historia del Cliente: Virginia es comerciante viajera, vende perfumes cosméticos y adornos en cantidad, viaja a Santa Cruz (uno de los departamentos más grandes del país) quincenalmente para efectuar su actividad económica. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (trabas, adornos, cosméticos y perfumes).

Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like barrettes, cosmetics, and decorations for her business.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.en: Yesenia is thirty years old and a single mom, raising her two children alone.  Yesenia owns and operates a small clothing store in a rented locale in the Café community of Santo Domingo.  She plans on supplementing her business with new styles of men’s and women’s clothing.  She also wants to add an assortment of perfumes and deodorants to the business with the intention of attracting new customers.  Yesenia hopes to become the most well-established supplier of these goods in her community.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk and add other goods to expand her business

loans.name: Budumuli East B C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nassim N.. She is currently in the business of tape recording and CD writing and is requesting a loan to purchase a computer. Nassim is 22 years old and is married. Her husband is a matooke supplier. She has 2 children ranging from age 2.5 to 7 and her children go to school. Each week, Nassim makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy basic household needs. Nassim has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to buy a CD player and the loan was paid back on time.

Nassim is joined in her small group by Nalongo N., Nusula N., Christine M., Habiba B. and Hadijja N.. Nalongo N. has a business selling chairs and wants to purchase a carpentry machine. Nusula N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to buy more clothes. Christine M. operates a business of selling used clothes and wants to add more stock. Habiba B. is currently in the business of selling old clothes and is requesting a loan to increase inventory. Hadija N. sells used clothes and wants to stock more clothes with the loan.

loans.use: To increase capital stock

loans.name: Sanja

texts.en:
Sanja is a 22-year-old woman from East Sarajevo. She is not married and she lives with her parents.

Sanja will use this loan for 1000 KM for purchase on wholesale trade more plastic dishes, vases and other plastic items for household that she resells. She has a shop where she is retailing these items. Her wish is to expand the business in order to employ more people and to become a self-employed woman.

loans.use: For purchase more material.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly N. is a subsistence farmer and she also sells farming equipment. Aside of these activities, she is a Khmer noodle maker in Svay Phluos Village in Kampong Speu Province. Last year, she  obtained a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Ly N. now would like to buy one more cow  to plough her rice field during rainy season. Thus, she would like a loan for this purpose. She is 54 and a widow of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to plough her rice field during the rainy season.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Nieves is a 56-year-old woman who lives in a very poor community called Mata D. Palma, which is on the outskirts of Hato Mayor. Nieves lives with her husband and 15-year-old daughter in a small home. She started a small business two years ago selling homemaD. food to her community members. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more flour, oil, plantains, and chicken. Nieves operates her own `fritura,´ a small business that makes homemaD. snacks, such as empanadas.  In the Dominican Republic, it is very common for people to buy a snack on the street corner as they walk to work, their homes, or simply when they are out and about. The money from this loan will help Nieves to buy enough ingredients to make the food necessary to meet the demands she faces. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more stable with the help of this loan.  The profits she makes will enable her to better proviD. for her family.  On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Nieves herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

The loan will also help fund the businesses of the other group members. 

About Group Loans: In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults on the loan.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, plantains, and chicken

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng B., 44, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Pen Sophal, and their two children. She works as a farmer, growing vegetables and selling them in the market for US $5 each day. Her husband works as a construction foreman and typically makes US $7.50 each day. Her husband believes that he can increase his income and expand his business if he had the necessary capital.

Heng B. has asked for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more construction tools for her husband’s business. She looks forward to seeing the results of this investment and seeing how her standard of living can be improved.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly S., 39, and her husband, Mr. Bunna Saum, 41, who live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in a local school and the youngest is still young and stays at home.
