Richard is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which he will use as working capital and to purchase additional inventory of meat. This will be the first loan taken out by Richard from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of meat and for working capital

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Theonestine

texts.en:
Theonestine is 46 years old and married with three children, who are 2, 4 and 12 years old. Theonestine is a self-employed business woman who is well known for her business selling timbers. She has been in this business for about 9 years. Her business hours are from 7 am to 5 pm every day.

Theonestine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing additional timbers for sale. Hopefully, she will earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting so that she can buy a machine for cutting trees into timbers for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional timbers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more body lotion and lady's clothes.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora Xachatryan is married and lives with her in-laws and daughter-in-law. Flora’s son has gone to Russia to make money to buy an apartment back at home. Every member of Flora’s family plays an important role in their family’s household economy.  Flora is a teacher, her husband works in a factory. The family keeps cattle and cultivates the land as additional and main income. By now Flora’s son has been able to save some money to come back to the motherland and purchase an apartment to live separately with his wife. Flora and her husband would like to help the young family stand on their feet. Flora has applied for the loan to sow a special wheat that yields a rich crop, thus extending the family business and income.

loans.use: To purchase wheat to sow

loans.name: Tenke Ole Napuku

texts.en:
Tenke Ole Napuku, aged 40 years, is married to Saruni, a farmer and together they have five children: leparakuo, aged 22 years, Olobulu aged 20 years, Naeku, aged 17 years, Ntanani, aged 15 years and Nkaleyia, aged 12 years. They live in Bissil village and trade livestock at Bissil market in Kajiado, which is a busy market. Tenke sells his livestock to butcher men in Kitengela and Kajiado for slaughter. 

Tenke was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients. He has been running his livestock trading business for a period of two years and he gets a monthly profit of KES 26,000.

With the KES 40,000 loan, which is his first loan with KADET, he plans to use KES 20,000 to buy cows, KES 10,000 to buy goats and KES 10,000 to buy sheep, all for trading. If the loan boosts the business he will buy a pickup for transportation purposes.

Tenke's dream is to open a butchery in Kajiado. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy cows, goats and sheep for trade.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce W. M. is a single lady with two children aged ten and three years old. Her business is located at the busy Kongowea-Karama market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. She sells cosmetics, hair additions, lotions, relaxers and others. She also owns a salon and mostly works on the local women's hair.

She has been in this business for the last three years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoilt for choice. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more weaves, relaxers and carpets to expand her business. She hopes to be a market leader at Kongowea by opening many more premises. She hopes to give her children a quality education and own a house some day. She describes herself as determined, persevering and open minded.

loans.use: Carpets, weaves and relaxers.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ÑAUPASUNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Henry; el tiene 36 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de fotocopiadora, el tiene una pequeña tienda donde realiza fotocopias, anillados y empastados de cuadernos, tesis entre otros, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar la fotocopiadora. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar la fotocopiadora.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the “ÑAUPASUNCHIS” community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mr Henry. He is 36, single, and has one child. He alternates his daily activities with his photocopy store. He has a small store where he makes photocopies and binds documents (theses and other items). He wants to expand and improve his business. He is requesting this loan to install a photocopier. He is happy to have this loan and promises to pay the quotas.

loans.use: the member is requesting this loan to install a photocopier.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica L. is from the village of Macaopao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Jessica is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods & canned goods. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods & canned goods

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
Don Edmundo C. P., es trabajador de una empresa de acueducto y alcantarillado, en donde tiene 3 años de antigüedad.

El es casado de 38 años de edad, tiene 4 personas a su cargo, de los cuales tiene 2 personas menores de edad. El vive en el departamento de Managua en Villa Reconciliación.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene en CEPRODEL el cual utilizará para invertirlo en su negocio, y poder ofrecer a su clientela diversidad de productos y a crecer su negocio y por lo tanto mejorar los ingresos familiares y por lo tanto la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. Edmundo C. P. has been employed by a water and sewage firm for the past three years.

He is 38 years old, married, and has four people in his care, two of whom are minors.  He lives in Villa Reconciliación, Managua department.

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL which he will use to invest in his business to be able to offer his customers a variety of products and to grow in his business, improving his family’s income and thus the quality of life of his nuclear family.

loans.use: To invest it in a business he has in the market.

loans.name: Merie Ann

texts.en:
Merie Ann D. is from Banadero, Ozamiz City. She is 28 years old. Merie Ann is single. To make a living, Merie Ann owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Merie Ann has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merie Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merie Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Merie Ann is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing engine. This will be the twelfth loan taken out by Merie Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
JOSE ANTONIO G. M., ES DE MANAGUA, EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO AFANADOR, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE UN NIÑO, Y ESTE  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON  JOSE ANTONIO ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, HIERRO PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR  SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA Y PARA BRINDARLES MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA Y AGRADECE A CEPRODEL POR BRINDARLE EL APOYO DE MEJORAR SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
José Antonio García M. is from Managua.  He works as a cleaner and is a family man with a school-aged son.

Don José Antonio has requested a loan through CEPRODEL to use for home improvement.  He plans to buy construction materials such as sand, cement and iron to finish building his house.

This is to improve his environment and provide the best possible living conditions for his family.  He is grateful to CEPRODEL for this support.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Trini

texts.en:
Trini is one of our women entrepreneurs. She is requesting an individual loan, her 3rd loan, a year and a half after she decided to start a business and came to Esperanza to take a small loan to invest in clothing sales in her community around Hato Mayor. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and invested them in her business. 

Trini is a young, single, businesswoman. She sells clothes and will use this loan to purchase more clothing varieties. Her dream is to finish her university studies and to have an improved business. She will use her business profits to save. She enjoys sharing time with her friends. She says "Thank you for supporting me."

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio H. Q. de 25 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa, hermana cuñado y sobrina.  Durante mucho tiempo a trabajado para poder ofrecer a su familia un poco de dinero que les ayude a cubrir sus necesidades. Es un joven con mucha energía quién lucha día a día para mejorar su calidad de vida. Juan posee un pequeño negocio en el que ofrece productos varios como: ropita para bebe, artículos decorativos, papel, bolsitas para regalo entre otros. Sus productos los ofrece en un pequeño puesto ubicado en el Mercado Municipal del Departamento de San Vicente. Él es muy conocido en la zona por ser un joven confiable, amable y además  por tener concentrados en su negocio una gran variedad de artículos en donde los clientes tienen diferentes  alternativas para escoger y llevarse lo que más le guste. Los productos de Juan son muy demandados por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAl para poder comprar más artículos   y de esta manera poder atraer a más clientes con el objetivo de aumentar su nivel de ingresos para poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida tanto para él como la de su familia.
texts.en: Juan Antonio H. Q. is 25 years old and lives in his parents’ house with his wife, sister, brother-in-law, and niece.  He has worked for quite some time in order to be able to provide his family with some money to help them cover their needs.  He is a young and energetic man who works every day in order to improve his quality of life.  Juan has a small business where he sells a variety of products like baby clothing, decorations, paper, gift bags, and other items.  He sells his products at a small stand located in the Municipal Market in the Department of San Vicente.  He is well known in the area for being a reliable and friendly young man, as well as for having a wide variety of items so that the customers have different options to choose from and can buy what they like most.  Juan’s products are in high demand, which is why he has decided to request this loan from Apoyo Integral to buy more items.  This way, he can attract more customers in order to increase his income and work towards a better quality of life for himself, as well as his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products like baby clothing, decorations, paper, gift bags, and other items.

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en:
Kevina is 43 years old and a single mother of five children living in Hioma, Uganda. She longs to educate her children up to university. 

She has a retail shop and has been running it for 15 years. Through her business, she has been able to build a house and pay school fees for her children. She is proud of the way business is moving. 

She faces a challenge of impassable roads to market places and in the future she hopes to diversify her business and sell fresh foods. 

Kevina needs the loan to buy salt, beans and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: To purchase salt, beans and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a 53-year-old single mother of four living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been the sole caretaker of her children. Three of them have completed university, and her dream is to ensure that each one of them is self-sustaining. She has a bar/restaurant/lodge and has been in business for 10 years. Business is still booming, despite the country's current challenges with inflation. She has risen through the ranks there, a bar attendant first, now an employer of 23 workers. Her desire is to set up a mega hotel in town. Edith needs the loan facility to buy rice, wheat flour, and utensils.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat flour, and utensils

loans.name: Kamel

texts.ar: كامل عمره 38 سنة متزوج واب لولدان يعمل تعهدات البناء له في عمله 12 سنة يحب عمله ويسعى الى تطويره وتحسينه له خبرة كبيره في مجال عمله حيث انه ورثه من والده وكان قد طور نفسه حتى اصبح يتعهد ورش لوحده فهو طموح مثابر ونشيط يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة شراء معدات للتعهدات وتسديد ما تبقى من ثمن غرفة النوم التي إشتراها لاولاده. يعاني كامل من نقص في السيولة المادية، التي تعيق تطور عمله والاعتماد على ذاته في تامين مستلزمات عائلته كاملةً
texts.en: Kamel (38 y.o., married, two children) has been working for the past twelve years as a contractor. After inheriting this career from his father, Kamel progressively built up his expertise until he could contract workshops on his own. He is very determined and proactive in his work, although his limited financial resources have kept him back from more fully developing professionally. To this end, Kamel was interested in petitioning a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase materials for his business and to service the remaining payments on his home, which would then allow him to subsequently marry and start a family.

loans.use: priceto purchase construction materials for his business and to  pay what's left from his kids bed room

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

El socio Alberto,  tiene 29 años de edad y El socio es conviviente; El socio  tiene 1 hijo, de 3 años de edad;  El socio se dedica  a la artesanía, el socio tiene un stand de exhibición de artesanía y el parte de su mercadería compra hecho y parte de esto el mismo elaborara, el socio  en su stand vende ceniceros de arcilla, con figuras andinas, llaveros de carácter andino, chalinas de alpaca bebe y de oveja, gorros llamados chullos de lana, bisutería, vasijas, vasos de cerámica, pequeños monumentos en miniatura de los diferentes centros arqueológicos de Cusco; el socio desea invertir en crédito en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de diferentes trabajos para la venta. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales como arcilla, óxidos naturales para los dibujos.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank "Caminemos juntas". He lives in the district of Huanchac, Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. 

Alberto, 29, lives with his partner with whom he has a three-year-old son. He is an artist. He has an art exhibition stand, and he buys part of his merchandise already-made and the rest he makes himself. He sells clay ashtrays, Andean figurines, key chains with Andean characters, scarves made of wool and baby alpaca, wool hats called chullos, jewelry, jars, ceramic vases, and miniature replicas of the different archeological sites in Cusco. He wants to invest the loan in the purchase of materials to make his different objects for sale, like clay and natural oxides for the drawings.

He values and is grateful for the loan that he was awarded and through this he will be able to improve his quality of life. He promises to make the loan payments during the stipulated time frame.

loans.use: to purchase materials like clay and natural oxides for his drawings.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is a hard-working entrepreneur who is a manufacturer and dealer in herbal medicines in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her herbal medicine business.

Azucena has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming sugar cane and rice.

Azucena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of purchasing equipment for medicine manufacturing in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, age 26, has been in the farming business for the last eight years, with a monthly income of KES 2,500.

With first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET she plans to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers for her family farm. This will assist her in getting more capital for inputs that will boost her farm yields. 

She intends to continue with farming and hope that she will own her own farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers for her family farm

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 2  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de DIGAN dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, région de KOULIKORO (deuxième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 45  ans,  6 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide, du gombo tec.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  cinquième  prêt  de campagne.
MADJE, qui debout au milieu,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
MADJE compte réaliser , après l’écoulement de sa  production agricole, un bénéfice de 55.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 2 is a group composed of married women from the village of DIGAN in the sub-prefecture of OUELESSEBOUGOU, Region of KOULIKORO (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 45 years of age and six children. And they grow peanuts, okra, etc.

Concerned about making their plantations profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their fifth farm loan. 

MADJE, who is standing in the middle in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, sundry supplies and equipment, and some farm inputs at the grand market of OUELESSEBOUGOU.

Following the off-season, the harvested crops are stocked for a certain time, so that they gain in value. And then they are sold retail (often in bulk) for cash at the grand market of OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO, and at surrounding markets. The customers come generally from large cities. 

After selling her produce, MADJE plans on making a profit of 55,000 francs CFA that will be used for paying the loan interest and for typical family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sugar, soap, cooking oil and other goods for his shop.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Xiomara tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera de tres hijos pero solamente dos dependen de ella,trabaja como analista y seguimietos de proyectos diario en la ciudad de managua desde hace ya varios años.
ella visita las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un prestamo el cual sera utilizado para gastos de graduacion de uno de sus hijos.
ella a sacado adelante a su familia, y agradece a ceprodel por brindarle el financiamiento ya gracia a ese prestamo su hijo podra tener su graduacion.
texts.en:
Xiomara, 49, is a single mother of three children but only two are still dependent on her.  She has worked daily for many years as a Project Follow-up Analyst in the city of Managua.

She visits Ceprodel’s office to ask for a loan that will be used for one of her son’s graduation costs.  

She has moved her family ahead and is grateful to Ceprodel for providing financing because thanks to this loan her son will be able to have his graduation.

loans.use: to pay her son's graduation costs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 34, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Myrna has a retail shop selling snacks like banana cue and hot pancakes. She has had this business for three years. Myrna has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

She is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de fruta como platanos, manzanas, naranjas, uvas entre otras frutas, la socia vende en el mercado de Cusco, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de fruta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas como manzanas, plátanos, naranjas y uvas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the "IMASUMAC I" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Lucila is 24 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling fruit such as bananas, apples, oranges, grapes, etc.  She sells her products in Cusco market from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this business she gets her son ahead in life.  Lucila would like to expand and improve her fruit business.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruit such as apples, bananas, oranges and grapes wholesale.

Lucila is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, bananas, oranges and grapes wholesale

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 53 años, es un hombre muy bueno y responsable, onvive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos, que ya son mayores e independientes. Él vive en el fundo de su jefe ya que trabaja cuidanlo, y del cual también hae uso de los terrenos para cultivar y criar animales. El trabajo de Calos consiste en la siembra y cosecha de cítricos y algunos productos regionales como yuca, plátano, ají; además cría animales como gallinas, patos, pollo, vacas y más. Este trabajo lo hace en la chacra de su patrón, pues el trabajo que realiza cuidandolo a cambio le pagan para que aproveche y se beneficie del espacio. Él trabaja solo y cuando es necesario contrata peones para poder ayudarlo en la siembra. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que esta siempre en la naturaleza, además que tiene tiempo libre para muchas actividades. Espera poder mantenerse con su producción y comprar mas adelante su propio fundo en donde pueda él mismo trabajar y sembrar y criar. Este será el préstamo número cinco con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy responsable y espera poder seguir siéndolo, además está muy agradecido pues le dieron la oportunidad de crecer. Con el monto solicitado, comprará granos y algunos palos de yuca, además contratará jornaleros para que le ayuden en el siembra.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 53, is a good and responsible man. He lives with his partner and they have three children who are grown and independent. Carlos lives on an estate where he is the foreman in charge of taking care of the grounds. He also has use of the land for farming and raising animals. His work consists of growing and harvesting citrus fruits and a few regional products such as cassava, bananas, and chili peppers. Carlos also raises animals such as hens, ducks, chickens, cows, and other livestock. This work is performed on the farm of his employer. He is able to take advantage of the benefits of this space in exchange for taking care of the premises. What he enjoys most about his work is always being around nature. In addition, he has free time to devote to other activities. Carlos hopes to maintain his production and buy his own farm in the future where he can plant crops and raise animals.

This will be his fifth loan with MFP. Carlos has always been responsible and hopes to continue in the same manner. In addition, he is very grateful for being given the opportunity to grow. The amount he requested will be used to buy seeds and some cassava shoots. He will also hire workers to help with the planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and cassava shoots and to hire workers to help with the planting.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda, a 36-year-old married mother of one, lives in the Philippines where she has had a retail shop that buys and sells coconut lumber for the past six years. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a  a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of coco lumber in various sizes. In the future, Hilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of coco lumber in various sizes.

loans.name: Oscas

texts.es: Oscas tiene 20 años, es un joven soltero, alegre y entusiasta que desea salir adelante. Vive en casa de sus padres quienes lo ayudan para seguir estudiando. Él se esmera por seguir adelante; pero también tiene que trabajar en la chacra de sus padres para poder solucionar con sus gastos educativos. Hace 10 años que ayuda a sus padres en los cultivos de su terreno como: cacao y café. Lo que más le gusta es ir a sus tierras a trabajar saber que desde ya esta siendo conocedor de las plantas y con la ayuda de su cultivo puede educarse tranquilo y considera que lo más difícil es que a veces tiene que estudiar y trabajar a la vez, pero aún así no pierde las esperanzas de continuar adelante. Con el crédito solicitado podrá solucionar los gastos de estudio y seguir adelante con arduo empeño. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, pues sabe que este dinero le será muy beneficioso para su futuro. Se siente contento por pertenecer al grupo de socios de su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá pagar sus estudios.
texts.en: Oscas is 20 years old.  He is a single, upbeat, and enthusiastic young man who wants to get ahead.  He lives at home with his parents, who help him so that he can keep studying.  He puts a lot of effort into getting ahead, but he also has to work at his parents' small farm to be able to cover his educational expenses.  He has been helping his parents with their crops of cacao and coffee for 10 years now.  What he likes most is going to their fields to work knowing that he is becoming very knowledgeable about the plants and that with the help of their crops he can get an education without stress.  What he finds most difficult is that sometimes he has to study and work at the same time, but even so he does not lose hope of moving forward.  With this loan he will be able to pay for his educational expenses and move forward with rigorous determination.  This will be his first loan with MFP and he knows this money will benefit his future greatly.  He is happy to belong to his communal bank's group of members.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles he will be able to pay his educational expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his educational expenses

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been engaged in farming for eight years. His farm produces tea and milk, which he sells to the local market. He and his wife live in Litein with their three children, whose ages range between two and eight years old. For additional income, David also runs a motorcycle transport business.
 
David has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a dairy cow to boost his dairy business. He feels that the markets should be developed further to avoid common fluctuation in prices, but he is optimistic about his dairy business, saying his production could possibly double in five years, allowing him to uplift his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy is married with one child. She is 32 years-old. She raises ducks and also does rice farming. She has been raising ducks and farming for 10 years now. This is the first loan that she got from Kiva partner VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy duck feed and fertilizers for her rice paddy. With this loan, she hopes to feed her ducks to be healthy and fat to earn more for her family in order to have some savings and also to keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy duck feed and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Lobar

texts.ru: Лобар замужем, любящая мать троих детей. Она занимается купле продажей товаров ежедневного потребления. Ее доходы помогают ей в содержании семьи. Она ежедневно обновляет ассортимент своего товара. Приближаются новогодние праздники и она желает пополнить ассортимент товаров магазина. Но для этого ей нужны средства. Она хочет получить займ  в размере 5000 сомони для расширения своего бизнеса. Она уверенна, что не останется без внимания и найдет поддержку с вашей стороны. Она заранее благодарит вас. Cпасибо!
texts.en: Lobar is married and is a loving mother of three children. She buys and sells groceries and goods for everyday use. Her income helps her to support the family. She renews the variety of the merchandise daily. The New Year holidays are quickly approaching and she would like to restock her store inventory assortment. She needs money to do this. Lobar wants to take out a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to expand her business. She is certain she won't be overlooked and will find support from your side. She is thanking all of you in advance. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Mirella Maria

texts.es:
Mirella de 37 años de edad, empezó con su negocio de venta de madera hace dos años debido a que en el sector hacía falta un negocio. 

Para realizar su trabajo no tiene horario fijo. Hasta ahora no ha tenido ninguna dificultad con si negocio.
Esta felizmente unido y tie u hijo de7 años de edad.

El prestamo lo quiere para comprar cemento, madera, bloques para su negocio. Su meta es poder terminar de construir un departamento que está haciendo para alquilar y así también tener una ayuda para los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Mirella, age 37, began her business selling timber two years ago because there was a lack of a business in this sector. She does not have a fixed schedule for carrying out her work. Up until now, she has had no problems with her business. She is happily married and has a 7 year old boy.

The loan she wants is for the purchase of cement, wood, and concrete blocks for her business. Her goal is to finish the construction of an apartment she is building to rent out in order to help with household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cement, timber, and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Jua Welfare Group

texts.en:
Akoinasi is the facilitator of the Jua Welfare group. Akoinasi and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Akoinasi is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, he had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Akoinasi and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from his maize sales, he will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jua Welfare group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Margaret has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days a week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and the increasing price of used clothes in Uganda. She aspires to see her business grow and to start importing clothes. 

Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur YACOUBA est un homme marié de vingt sept ans et père de deux enfants qui vit dans une famille monogame avec sa femme et ses enfants à OUELESSEBOUGOU. 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans réussite, il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel .
Il compte acheter 10 sacs de sucre, 5 cartons de thé et autres divers produits de boutique tels les sachets de lait en poudre, des biscuits, les conserves,  à Bamako qu’il stockera chez lui. 
Il effectue sa vente marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et  dans les villages environnants, d’une façon ambulante, en détail au comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000 FCFA par mois, qu’il compte utiliser pour les dépenses de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
Yacouba is 27 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He lives in a monogamous family environment with his wife and children in Ouelessebougou.

Having tried his hand at several different business ventures without success, Yacouba decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program and is now requesting his first individual loan. He will use the money to buy 10 bags of sugar, 5 boxes of tea and other products such as sachets of milk powder, biscuits and canned food. He will get his supplies in the city of Bamako and store them at home.

Yacouba is a travelling salesman and he sells his products to a varied clientele at the market of Ouelessebougou and surrounding villages, for cash or credit. He predicts a monthly profit of 80 000 FCFA, which he will use to cover his household expenses and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 37 years old, married to Bonface and they have two children.  She has been operating a second hand clothes hawking business for the last nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000 to buy stocks of second hand clothes to sell on.  With the anticipated profits she will expand her business and educate her children.

Her hope is to own and operate a clothing boutique in future.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell on.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 30 years old. She has spent four years selling foodstuffs. She has two children seven months and three years old. Angelique has requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used for savings. She would like to have a big stock in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell such as beans and sorghum.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Joycel her daughter is 16 years old and is 4th of seven children in the family. Her mother Josie is a member of Project Dungganon and supports the family through her general store and buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines.


Joycel is studying Bachelor in Secondary Education and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Joycel is borrowing 6000 to pay for tuition fees of the second semester of the school year 2013-14.

When she graduates, Joycel plans to her parents and brother and sister to finish college also.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is a 24-year-old farmer from Macaresti village, Ungheni. She is married and has two nice children. Her husband Pavel works as a border police inspector. 
Natalia has got about one hectare of land and grows corn, vegetables and grapevines. Selling of agriculture goods is a good addition at family income. But work land manualy is difficult and take more time. So what Natalia decided to purchase a mini tractor. Using it, the agriculture works will be easier and Natalia will have more time for her children.
This loan will help Natalia to purchase a mini tractor and as result the level of life of his family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a mini tractor

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is married with five children. 

Her husband and children are fishermen and she helps sell the fish at the market in the capital of Apia three days a week. She has used her previous loans to help this activity. She now wants to start a canteen selling snack food to the village and local school. Pictured in the photo are icy poles which are very popular with children. Fortunately Hana has a refridgerator which is also shown in the photo. The sort of things she will buy for her canteen will include a gas cooker, sugar, flour, plastics, rice.

loans.use: Purchase cement, timber for home improvement and inputs for her canteen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy Wanjiru Mwangi intends to buy animal feeds and other dairy supplements

loans.name: Larn

texts.en:
A19-year-old ambitious man, Larn R., lives with his wife (pictured here) and ailing mother in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is a struggling husband and grateful son who works very hard at construction in order to support his entire family. He is the one who handles all the family's expenses with a meager wage from construction.

Larn R., who has two little children, is humbly requesting a $700 loan to help him in purchasing some construction tools to facilitate his job and to buy a simple motor-bike to travel from and to work so that he no longer spends so much for his daily transportation. Larn R. hopes sooner or later he would become a construction foreman, so that he would make additional income for his family, especially for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for his business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor R. has 25 years of experience selling shoes and clothes. He started working in the biggest market in Ecuador named Bahia. His boss at a previous business sent him to rural towns to sell his products. When Victor and his wife decided they would go into business together, they based their business model on Victor’s previous job. They had success early on because they knew exactly which towns were the most lucrative markets, and they offered promotions to the best buyers, whom they knew personally.

Each day they work from 5am until 10pm. They have recently been so focused on sales that they have not had the time to replenish their inventory with new stock, so they sell goods in the morning and then use the proceeds from those sales to buy just enough shoes to still sell in the afternoon. Victor’s wife is a great salesperson, and she typically sells in the small towns and at the local festivals which occur fairly often.

They have two grown children who help sell their goods, and the family unit has maintained a strong foundation over the years. Their house is their greatest collateral. Victor will used his second loan to continue to increase the volume of shoes and clothing in stock to sell when the Riveras go to market. He is a 48 year-old with four children, who also contribute to the family business. His wife is his right hand, and he could not do anything without her. She is responsible for the finances, taking care of the house, and looking after the children.

Many years ago they lived in Victor’s mother-in-law’s home, but they saved enough money to move out on their own. Their new home was made of cane and they slept on the floor. Now, after working hard, they enjoy a house that is made of concrete, and each child has a room of his own. The Riveras are proud to have gotten out of their previous situation, which was dire poverty. Although they are still poor, they enjoy an average standard of living for the people in their sector. Their wish is to continue growing the business and open a store located next to their house.

loans.use: To invest in clothing stock

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
Mrs. Elodia Gomez is 54 years old and is happily married to 56 year old Benito Gonzalez. The couple has three children. Their oldest, a daughter, is married, the middle daughter is working in Spain, and their youngest son lives with them and is a college student. In the year 2000, Elodia began to open her own business, a clothing store, with a small amount of cash from her husband, who works in agriculture. Her business is located in the City Market in Caaguazu, and she has a well-established clientele thanks to her excellent location and the great variety of merchandise that she has in stock. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as women's blouses, undergarments, towels, jeans, and men's tshirts, which are the products in highest demand in this season and also to be able to add to the variety of the products she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Elodia G. de 54 años de edad se encuentra felizmente casada con el Sr. Benito González de 56 años de edad. La pareja tiene tres hijos de los cuales la mayor de todos es casada, la segunda se encuentra trabajando en España y solo el menor de ellos vive con sus padres y es estudiante de una carrera universitaria. En el año 2000, Doña Elodia emprendió su propio negocio, que es una ropería, con un pequeño aporte de capital que le facilito su marido, quien se dedica a la agricultura. Doña Elodia tiene su negocio ubicado en el Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de Caaguazú, en el cual le va de maravillas, ya que tiene su clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención y por la gran variedad de mercadería que tiene en su stock. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: blusas para dama, ropa interior, toallas, vaqueros, y remeras para hombre, atendiendo que son las prendas que tiene mayor demanda en esta temporada y para variar aún más su stock de mercaderías.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as women's blouses, jackets, undergarments, towels, jeans, and tshirts for men.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Doña Alejandrina, 48 years old, is an admirable family woman that has proven herself to be a hard-working lady and a fine weaver throughout her life . After completing her projects, she sells them in bulk in the capital city. Her new project is exporting her goods, and this encourages to her to devote more time to her weaving and to caring for her guinea pigs at home. She does all this without ever neglecting her housework or the needs of her three children. Hoping to improve their standard of living and to reach her exporting dreams, she wants to increase the number of woven items she has available. She requires raw materials for her works, such as threads and fabrics, so that her handiwork can be admired and purchased abroad. We’re counting on your generous support to make Alejandrina’s dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Alejandrina D. 48 años, es una admirable madre D. familia, que en el transcurso D. su vida, se mostró siempre como una dama trabajadora y una muy buena tejedora D. tapetes, que al término D. su confección comercializa en gran cantidad en la ciudad capital D. su país.

El nuevo proyecto D. exportar sus artículos, la anima a seguir esforzándose y a dedicarle más tiempo a sus tejidos y al cuidado D. sus pequeños cuyes en casa, sin descuidar ni por un momento la atención D. su humilD. hogar y la demanda D. sus tres hijos.

Con el deseo D. incrementar su nivel D. vida y el D. alcanzar su sueño D. exportación desea incrementar el número D. sus tejidos. Y para lograr este objetivo requiere D. materiales D. confección (hilos, telas, etc). Con El propósito D. que la obra D. sus manos pueda ser admirada y comercializada en el extranjero.

Contamos con vuestra gentil contribución para hacer realidad los sueños D. Alejandrina.

loans.use: Purchase of fine materials to continue her lovely weaving.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, 43, is married with four children, three of them boys.  They don’t attend school.  Her husband works outside her community.

Rosa has always been an active woman.  When she is not working as housekeeper, you’ll see her selling anything just to support her children, since her husband's income is not enough to bear all the family's expenses.

Now, Rosa plans on doing business more reliably.  With her loan, she will purchase rice, beans, vegetable oil, bread and other foodstuffs to sell within her house.  Her general store’s name will be “D’ Rosa Colmado”.  Given the loan, Rosa will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy goods to start a grocery store.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị S., 54 years old, lives in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa province. She is a member of branch 14 of the TYM Fund. Her family’s main activities are fishing related. Her husband goes on weeks long fishing trips and she sells fish at the open market. Beside that she farms and raises a small animal stock. All that effort are for raising her children with the best education available. Her wish now is to continue to taking out loans from the TYM Fund to do business and saving for their future. She discusses with her husband a bout applying for a loan of 375USD to buy fishing net and equipment.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị S., 54 tuổi, sống tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa hiện đang là thành viên của chi nhánh 14 Quỹ Tình thương. Nghề nghiệp chủ yếu của gia đình là từ đánh cá. Thông thường anh đi đánh bắt cá một hai tuần mới về còn chị bán cá ngoài chợ. Ngoài việc bán cá chị S. còn làm thêm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn gà. Hiệu quả kinh tế mang lại giúp chị S. có điều kiện cho các con đi học tới mức cao nhất. 4 người con của hai anh chị đều học hành thành đạt và hiện đã ra trường. Mong ước của chị S. hiện nay là tiếp tục tham gia Quỹ để vay vốn tạo thu nhập tích lũy sau này. Để việc đánh bắt cá hiệu quả, mang lại thu nhập cao chị S. bàn bạc với chồng và xin vay 375USD để sắm lưới và đồ nghề đánh cá mới.

loans.use: Buy fishing net and equipment

loans.name: Ilonka

texts.en: Ilonka H. is married and lives with her husband and their two kids in the village of Mramoren near Vratza. She breeds 10 sheep and needs to buy three more. Daily, she gets about 15 litres of milk that she sells to one of the biggest dairies in the region.

loans.use: To buy three more sheep

loans.name: Busanzi. A. North D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fauza A.. She is currently in the business of running a drug shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs to sell. Fauza is 26 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 3 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Fauza makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. Fauza has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fauza is joined in her small group by Bena M., Nubu N., Rukia Y., and Fazira M.. Bena M. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy more fabric. Nubu N. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to add more stock. Rukia Y. operates a business selling fish and wants to boost business. Fazira M. is currently in the business of selling mandazi and is requesting a loan to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To add more drugs and offer better services

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
“I have tried to improve my home but, in fact, the financial situation is very difficult. I would like to build two fences in the patio. The houses in the projects where I live are publicly subsidized and the space is very limited. As you can see in the picture, there is little privacy as they are built one right next to the other. I am requesting $800 to build the fences in the backyard of my house.”

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

“He tratado de hacerle mejoras a mi vivienda, pero en realidad la situación económica esta muy difícil. Me gustaría levantar dos bardas en el patio, ya que las casas del fraccionamiento en donde vivo son de interés social, el espacio es muy reducido y, como pueden ver en la foto, tienen muy poca privacidad, ya que están construidas muy pegadas. Solicito 800 dólares para levantar dos bardas en el patio de mi vivienda.”

loans.use: Build fences in the backyard of my house.

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.en:
Nazirjon Khudoinazarov is 29. He’s a father of two children. He’s married and his wife, Bibijamol, helps with farming. Nazirjon is working hard on the farm and his business includes growing and selling of agricultural products such as onion, garlic, potatoes and maize.

He wants to buy chemicals and seed and so he needs a loan of $900 for a term of nine months. After gathering his harvest he wants to sell it to local inhabitants with lower prices than in the market.

Nazirjon is promising to be accurate with paying the loan. Nazirjon and his hopeful wife are counting on your help. Be an important part of Nazirjon’s business.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Ernesto Francisco

texts.pt:
Ernesto is 55 years old and was born in the province of Gaza. He was trained to be an elementary school teacher. He is married and the father of 4 children, 2 girls and 2 boys, all are adults (the oldest is 32 years old and the youngest is 22). The first two are already employed, and the other 2 are studying at the university but are still his responsibility.

Ernesto and his family moved from the province of Gaza to Namaacha in 1986 due to a job transfer so he could work as a professor in the teacher-training school located in Namaacha. Since then Ernesto and his family have lived there and he works in the same school.

Ernesto has a monthly salary of 7,400MTn and works from 7:30am to 10:00pm with a 2-hour lunch break. Besides 2 of his children, Ernesto supports two nephews in the Chibuto province of Gaza sending them 1,500MTn monthly. Still he is able to save approximately 2,500MTn per month with the help of receipts from a small stand he possesses.

It has been 10 years since Ernesto began his selling activities in a small stand (store) in response to the increase in the cost of living. His activities consist of selling a variety of drinks and basic staple products. The best seller is a national beer with a 2M mark that is acquired for 200MTn per box and sold for 300MTn. The monthly receipts vary between 2,000MTn and 3,000MTn depending on the time of year (winter or summer, respectively).

Ernesto has his own home. This is his second loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. The first loan for 20,000MTn was used to purchase construction materials to build a coop to raise chickens, a business that still isn't up and running. Ernesto paid that loan off early and without difficulties.

With this loan Ernesto intends to purchase products for his stand, increasing his stocks as well as his sales. In the future Ernesto would like to purchase baby chicks to begin his poultry business now that the coop is almost finished.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Ernesto tem 55 anos de idade e nasceu na província de Gaza. Ernesto fez a formação de professor primário, é casado e pai de 4 filhos, sendo duas meninas e dois rapazes, todos já maiores de idade (o primeiro filho tem 32 anos de idade e o ultimo 22 anos). Os dois primeiros já estão empregados e os dois últimos estudam na universidade sob sua responsabilidade. Ernesto e sua família mudaram-se da província de Gaza para Namaacha em 1986 devido a transferência que ele teve para ir trabalhar na escola de formação dos professores situado em Namaacha como professor. Desde então Ernesto e sua família lá vivem, Ernesto ainda trabalhando na mesma escola. Ernesto tem um salário mensal de MTn 7,400, trabalhando das 7:30h as 22:00h com intervalo de 2 horas de almoço. Ernesto para alem dos dois filhos sustenta mais dois sobrinhos que se encontram em Chibuto província de Gaza, enviando mensalmente MTn 1,500. Ainda assim consegue poupar do salário aproximadamente MTn 2,500 com ajuda das receitas da pequena barraca que possui. Há dez anos Ernesto iniciou a atividade de venda em uma pequena barraca (loja) como resposta a subida do custo de vida. A atividade consiste na venda de variedades de bebidas e produtos de necessidade básica, onde destaca com mais saída a cerveja nacional de marca 2M que é adquirida por MTn 200 a caixa e vendida por MTn 300. A receita liquida mensal varia entre MTn 2,000 a MTn 3,000, dependendo do período do ano (inverno ou verão, respectivamente). Ernesto tem casa própria. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro empréstimo de MTn 20,000 foi usado para compra de material de construção para construir uma capoeira para criação de frangos, negocio ainda não iniciado. Ernesto pagou este empréstimo sem dificuldades antes do tempo. Com este empréstimo Ernesto pretende comprar produtos para sua barraca, aumentando assim o estoque e as vendas. No futuro Ernesto gostaria de comprar pintos para iniciar sua atividade avícola, já que esta quase concluída a capoeira.

loans.use: Purchase goods to restock his store

loans.name: Leua

texts.en: Leua S., 52, is married with 8 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village and public people 5 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (approximately $187 USD).  SPBD loans are Leua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  This loan will be used to purchase items for her business.

loans.use: Sewing machine ,threads and children's school fees

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 39 years,She is a married with 2 children ages 18 and 12. She has been a bites seller since in february 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Farida has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Farida now hopes for a loan to buy and to makes more bites products for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San C., 45, and her husband, Mr. Nun C., 50, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have three sons. Two of them are fishermen and other one studies in the local school.

Mrs. San and her husband have been farming since they were young. They grow rice, vegetables, and many kinds of crops on the farm not far from their home. Currently the couple needs money to buy a new staircase to replace the old one that is very old and broken. So San is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a new staircase to replace the old one for her house.

loans.use: To purchase one staircase for her house.

loans.name: Paulina Alberto Mavanga

texts.pt:
Paulina Alberto mavanga M. nasceu em Cabo Delgado, no distrito de  ao norte de Moçambique, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos com idades o mais velho tem 26 anos e o dois últimos são gémeos com 13 anos todos ainda são estudante. Para alem da sua família tem ajudada a sua  mãe enviando dinheiro para cidade de pemba.

Paulina estudou até 7ªclasse do antigo sistema nacional de educação, e parou de estudar por problemas de saúde e falta de condições financeiras para suportar as despesa. Paulina saiu de cabo delgado acompanhando o seu marido transferido pelos serviços e por cá ficaram até data hoje.

Paulina dedica se a vende de roupas e camarão, negocio que aprendeu desde pequena através das suas irmãs. O melhor produto é a roupa de trajem africana feita de capulanas e vende por 125,00mt a Blusa e o fato por 950,00mt. Tem um rendimento mensal de 5.000,00mt e poupa mensalmente 2.000,00mt.

Para Paulina este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva nunca solicitou noutras instituições, conheceu a hluvuku através das amigas que já são clientes, pretende com este empréstimo aumentar a mercadoria e fornecer mais produtos aos seus clientes, tem sonho para os próximos empréstimos construir uma loja.
texts.en:
Paulina Alberto Mavanga Mondiane was born in Cabo Delgado, in the district in the north of Mozambique. She's 43 years old, married, and mother to six children. The eldest is 26, and the two youngest ones are 13-year-old twins. All are still students. Besides her family, she helps her mother, sending money to the town of Pemba. Paulina studied until 7th grade in the old national system of education. She stopped her studies due to health problems and financial difficulty in paying the fees. Paulina left Cabo Delgado, accompanied by her husband, who was transferred by his work, and they have been here until today. Paulina works at selling clothes, a business that she learned from her sisters ever since she was little. Her best product is clothing made out of African wax print cloth, sold for 125 meticais per blouse and 950 meticais for a suit. She has a monthly income of 5000 meticais and saves 2000 of it. For Paulina, this is her first loan from Hluvuku and Kiva. She has never solicited a loan from other institutions. She heard of Hluvuku through friends who are clients. She plans with this loan to increase her amount of stock and supply more products for her clients. She has a dream of constructing a store with future loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing for resale

loans.name: German

texts.es: German tiene 50 años, es divorciado, así que vive solo en un cuarto que alquila. El es un hombre honesto que ha venido trabajando en el servicio de aplicado de parket  para una empresa desde hace 9 años, tiene mucho talento para esta labor, además de que con sus ganancias solventa sus gastos. German no tiene un horario fijo, ya que los contratos llegan esporádicamente, pero cuando lo contratan el trabajo dura de tres semanas a más, es un trabajo que requiere mucha precisión. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es que no sea estable, ya que si bien recibe muchos contratos, también hay veces que se queda semanas sin conseguirlos, haciendo que no tenga mucha estabilidad en realizarlo. German quiere ser un hombre útil y sabe que aun la vida le depara muchas oportunidades, es por eso que quiere estar preparado para afrontarlas. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere comprar sus propias herramientas para el asentado de parket y poder trabajar paralelamente de forma independiente. En el futuro German quiere poner su propia empresa del rubro en el que trabaja, pero a su vez le gustaría otro negocio el cual aun no decide cual puede ser.
texts.en:
German is 50 years old and divorced, living alone in a rented room. He is an honest man who has been working for a business installing parquet floors for nine years. He has great talent for this work, and with his earnings is able to meet his expenses. German does not have a set schedule since contracts come in sporadically. However, when he is contracted out he works hard for three weeks or more. It is work that requires great precision. The most difficult part is that it is not stable employment and, at times, he receives many contracts but there are also weeks at a time when he may not receive any work. German wants to be a useful man, and knows that life still provides many opportunities which he wants to be prepared to confront. With the money from the loan, he wants to buy his own tools for parquet installation so he can also do work independently. In the future, German would like to have his own business in his current line of work but also would like to start another enterprise which he has yet to decide on.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the necessary tools to carry out his work, so that he can also take on projects independently.

loans.name: Mrs. Samouern Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank loA. group consists of ten members who live in Phsar village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Samouern S. is the Village Bank president. She owns a small stand where she sells Khmer noodles to villagers and visitors. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loA. to add to her saving to buy more Khmer noodles. Her husband, Mr. Kim Samleang, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice.

Mrs. Samouern S. is 47 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a driver for a company. Four others are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

This is a group loA., some portions of which will be paid back in installments while other portions are paid back in one lump sum at the end of the term. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loA. until the very end of the loA. term.

End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the best way to help Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loA. term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09 percent, and AMK has a default rate of zero on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy items for several small businesses

loans.name: Rachana

texts.en:
Mrs. Rachana S., 29, lives in a nuclear family with her husband, Mr. Ramesh S., and one daughter in Khapichhen, Lalitpur. Her husband works in a medical shop and her daughter is now just 11 months old.

Mrs. S. makes different types of woollen sweaters. She took 2 months' training for this work. She sells woollen sweaters to sweater dealers. Mostly, foreigners love hand-made woollen sweaters. So nowadays, the demand for these sweaters is constantly increasing and she is very busy weaving sweaters.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs15,000 to buy different varieties of wool for weaving different woollen sweaters. She wants to save her earnings to provide a good education for her daughter because in Nepal the cost of education is very high.

loans.use: To buy wool to knit woollen sweaters for sale

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy C., 32, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store and typically makes US$ 5 a day, while her husband, Chhive Mab, is a true entrepreneur, selling pork in a busy market. On average, he makes US$ 20 in revenue a day. This couple has three school-aged children. Mrs. Soy C. is asking a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase pigs to expand the butcher shop.

loans.use: To expand butcher shop

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Rahel C. from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with one child who is 20. Rahel has been running a cloth business since 2005. She sells on the street, and most sales are credit sales. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by two employees. Rahel currently earns about US$500 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional stock of cloth. In the future, she plans to open another business. Rahel thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cloth.

loans.name: Radjab

texts.ru: Раджаб мужчина в возрасте 58 лет ,женат имеет троих детей. Жена работает техничкой в городской поликлинике.Сам Раджаб работает лаборантом в  санпидемстанции  г.Гафурова. Его работа заключается в снятии анализов с продуктов питания продаваемых на рынках.Его зарплата очень низкая и не хватает на жизнь.Поэтому он имеет дополнительный доход на проживание с бизнеса животноводства.для покупки ещё несколько голов скота он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Radjab is a 58 year old man, he is married with three children. His wife works as a technician in a city hospital. Radjab himself works as a laboratory assistant in a sanitation and epidemic control center in the town of Gafurov. His job consists of testing produce and food sold on the markets. His salary is very low and is not enough for their livelihood. This is why he has an additional income from his animal husbandry business. He wants to take out a loan to buy several more heads of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and sales of cattle

loans.name: Cira Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cira Cecilia Vda. D. A. tiene 61 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudio superior incompleto, tiene 4 hijos, los cuales apoyan económicamente a la empresaria.
Cira Sánchez se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en una tienda comercial ubicada en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Santa Lucia II”, lo invirtió en la compra productos para forma sus pequeña tienda, inicio con cosas pequeñas pero con el apoyo del crédito empezó a comprar sus productos al por mayor y así poder vender mas.
Con el crédito D. 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. abarrotes al por mayor así como andamios, pizarra, balanza en otras cosas que requiere su negocio.
Edelmira tiene como un sueño, poner una gran tienda surtida D. abarrotes  y crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Cira Cecilia Vda. D. A. is 61 years old and lives in the Moche district, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. Although she did not finish her studies, she is a business woman with 4 children who depend upon her. She dedicates herself to selling groceries from a shop built into her home. With her first loan from the Santa Lucia II Communal Bank, of 300 soles, she bought small quantities of the products she sells in her store. Bit by bit, and with the help of such loans, she has been able to buy her products in larger and larger quantities and sell more of them. She will also invest this next loan of 1,000 soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, into her business. She will buy groceries to stock up her store, but will also buy scales, display boards and construction materials to improve the store itself. Cira Cecilia dreams of expanding her store and of growing as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock and construction materials.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace más de 15 años se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, empezó a dedicarse a esta actividad por medio de haber obtenido en herencia los terrenos de sus padres y por de los padres de su esposa. Desde ese entonces, labran la tierra incansablemente año tras año, de acuerdo al calendario de la siembra y la cosecha. Paralelamente a esto, Lorenzo se dedica a la ganadería, ya que tiene 4 vacas en su establo, de ellas extrae la leche para su consumo propio y para venta. Para Lorenzo y su familia dedicarse a las tareas agrícolas es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen porque no solo les genera recursos económicos, sino que también les provee de alimentos básicos para su hogar. Es la segunda vez que Lorenzo está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y es de su agrado trabajar con sus propios vecinos, los cuales forman parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora requiere lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizante para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 42, lives with his wife and 4 children in his own home. For more than 15 years he has been working in agriculture and with livestock. He got started in this work because he inherited some land from his parents and from his wife’s parents. From then on they have been working the land tirelessly year after year as they follow the schedule for planting and harvesting. Along with this, Lorenzo has livestock. He has 4 cows in his stable. He milks them for his family’s use, and he sells the rest of the milk. The agricultural work is the only source of income for Lorenzo and his family. This work not only generates economic resources, but it also provides them with basic foods for their home. This is the second time that Lorenza has asked for a loan with MFP. It is his pleasure to work with his neighbors who form part of his community bank. He will use the loan to buy bags of fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria C. B. ella es Originaria de la Comunidad de Juchanep actualmete ellas de dedica a la confeccion de playeras, Blusas y otros y la cual los entraga en diferentes puntos de ventas, la cual nesecita hoy en dia de un credito para poder compra algunas piezas de las maquinas y telas para poder producir un poco mas y con la idea de buscar otros nuevos mercados con el objetivo de mejor el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maria C. B. is originally from the community of Juchanep. She currently makes T-shirts, blouses and other items, which she delivers to different retail locations. Now she needs a loan to purchase machine parts and materials to increase her production. She is looking to find new markets in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
The man in the picture above is Mr. Sam C.. He is 32 years old and has been selected as the group leader by the other four women in the group loan. Sam C. generates his daily income by driving a motor taxi, and earns around $2 per day. He uses the profit to manage his family's daily expenses. He is married with two teenage children, who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is a staff member at a restaurant in Siem Reap province. He has been trying to build his house since past few months, but the construction has been halted due to lack of money. Therefore, Sam C. has decided to seek a loan to complete his house construction. 

There are other four borrowers in the group loan: Mrs. P. is a grocery seller seeking a loan to buy more items to sell. Mrs. P. is a fish catcher who is asking a loan to purchase more tools for fishing. Mrs. E. is applying for a loan to expand her grocery item selling business. Mrs. L. is involved in fishing at Tunle Sap Lake; she requests a loan to buy a boat for fishing. All the borrowers live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To complete house construction

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid is 43-year-old married man with three children, living in Keter Maya, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a car service and maintenance shop since 2003. Today, Walid is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es:
El señor Baltazar vive con su esposa la señora Cristina y un pequeñín. 
El labora para el tribunal de justicia como jefe de oficiaría de partes desde hace 9 años. 
Y su esposa la señora Cristina es coordinadora de guarderías en el Instituto Medico, mas reconocido del país, donde tiene una antigüedad y experiencia de 28 años. 
Son una familia muy estable económicamente, pero sobretodo se apoyan mutuamente y están muy consolidados. 
Por el momento están tramitando este crédito ya que como están construyendo el segundo piso en su casa, todos los gastos de construcción los han realizando en efectivo, 
Pero les esta haciendo falta la colocación del techo de madera, motivo para esta solicitud.
texts.en:
Señor Baltazar lives with his wife, Señora Cristina, and their little one.

He works for the judicial court as head officiate and has been for nine years. His wife, Señora Cristina, is the daycare coordinator at the most well-recognized Medical Institute in the country, where she has seniority and 28 years of experience.

They are a very economically stable family, but above all they support each other mutually and are very strong.

For the moment, they are arranging this loan because they are constructing the second floor of their home. All the construction costs they have paid with cash, but they still need to lay the wooden roof, which is their reason for this request.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a wooden roof on the second floor of their home

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: El señor Jose Carlos tiene la edad de 55 años, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casado y con  cinco hijos de 14, 17,19, 21, 25 dos  de ellos  trabajan y los otros estudian.  Su negocio es la venta de ropa, electrodomésticos  y productos plásticos, que desde hace diesiciete años vende, el cual comenzó con ahorros y  liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Con este crédito va a comprar ropa, y electrodoméstico para ofertar a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder aumentar inventario para tener mejores utilidades y poder apoyar a sus hijos con la universidad que es muy costosa, es por eso su empeño de trabajar y vender. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo de los préstamos ya que este es su décimo crédito y se ha beneficiado para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Jose Carlos is 55 years old. He lives in the neighbourhood called Villa Reconciliación. He is married and has 5 children, of 14, 17, 19, 21, and 25 years of age. Two of them are working, and the others are studying. His business is the sale of clothing, domestic electronics, and plastic products. He has sold these things since he was 17 years old, when he began with his savings and by liquidating his previous business.
