With this loan, he wants to buy clothing and domestic electronics to offer to his clients. His plans are to increase his inventory in order to be of greater use and to be able to help his children with university, which is very expensive. This is why he began working in sales. Thanks to the institution for the help with the loans, this is already his tenth loan and he has benefited by investing in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and domestic electronics

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
Emelina S. hails from the town of Jala-jala, Rizal province, in  the Philippines. She is determined to break down  the wall of poverty that stands between her family and success. She is 44 years old and mother of two sons.  Emelina is married to Guillermo, who is 47 years old.

In 1999, Emelina joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc., an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines), hoping to have access to capital for her fishing business. The business appeared sound and worthy of being continued. Now on her fifth loan, Emelina is seeking 25,000 pesos to pay for bundles of nets and payments for labor to prepare fishing gear.

She is hopeful that with the opportunity given by ASHI and KIVA, she can bring her family out of poverty. She dreams of building her own house, sending her children to college and to find jobs, so that her children do not experience the same life that she has.

loans.use: To pay for bundles of nets and payments for labor ito prepare fishing gear.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: Edith est née vers 1977 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Edith est mariée à Amorin, mécanicien-moto de formation et vendeur des postes récepteurs. Edith et Amorin ont un seul enfant et il est scolarisé. Edith a été à l’école mais elle s’est arrêtée au cours primaire. Ensemble avec son mari, Edith supporte les charges de la famille. C’est des condiments de cuisine que Edith vend ainsi que des sachets d’emballage mais comme activité secondaire.  Edith achète ses produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C’est à son domicile que Edith vend les condiments ; les sachets, Edith les vend de façon ambulante. C’est depuis six ans que Edith est dans ces deux activités. Edith est à son quatrième crédit avec ALIDé et a toujours bien remboursé ses crédits. Les activités d’Edith connaissent plus ou moins d’évolution mais toujours est-il qu’elle rencontre la mévente de temps à autre. Edith souhaite bénéficier de l’appui financier d’ALIDé pour agrandir ses activités et les diversifier à la vente de fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
Edith was born around 1977 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to Amorin, a motorbike mechanic by training and a seller of radio receivers. Edith and Amorin have one son, who attends school. She attended school, but she stopped in primary school. Together with her husband, she is meeting family expenses. Sauce condiments are what she sells, as well as baggies for packaging, as her secondary business. She buys her goods in Dantokpa, the international grand marketplace of Bénin. She sells the condiments out of her house; the baggies are sold door-to-door. She has been in these two businesses for six years. Edith is on her fourth loan with ALIDé and has always repaid her loans. Her businesses are more or less improving. Yet it’s true she experiences a loss in sales from time to time. She wishes to benefit from financial support from ALIDé in order to expand her businesses and to diversify them by selling school supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags for packaging and school supplies

loans.name: Diene

texts.fr: Diene N.   est horticulteur  fleuriste  il est âge 27 ans  marié et père de deux (2) enfants  .Sans formation professionnelle il a su se faire un nom dans le domaine du jardinage  par l’aménagement des maisons et de espaces publiques  dans la zone touristique de saly située à 80km de Dakar la capital sénégalaise. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille. Avec le prêt il compte acheter de nouvelles plantes ornementales pour préparer les fêtes de fin d’année.

loans.use: ACHAT DE MARCHANDISE

loans.name: Alan Víctor

texts.es:
Alan tiene 24 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 2 años de edad en casa de sus padres, a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Santa Rosa.
 
La necesidad de trabajar por su familia le ha llevado a crear un pequeño negocio de venta ambulante de pescado, usualmente trabajaba durante la noche como ayudante en una panaderia de la zona y desde hace seis meses también trabaja vendiendo pescado fresco en los pueblos del distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 10 minutos del lugar en donde vive.
 
El va muy temprano al terminal pesquero del lugar a comprar pescado de tres a cuatro veces por semana, luego viaja hacia Monsefú y vende su mercadería, llega a su casa por la tarde, descansa y después va a la panadería a trabajar; los ingresos generados por estas actividades le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia y también para apoyar a sus padres.
 
Alan desea juntar el dinero suficiente para crear su propia panadería, ya que disfruta mucho de esta actividad y dado el tiempo en que estuvo trabajando ha aprendido ya todo respecto a este oficio, pero es consciente de que debe seguir vendiendo pescado para continuar ahorrando su dinero, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 900 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para mantener su negocio.
 
Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno y construir su casa, Alan es muy conocido y respetado por sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo que lo consideran un joven cariamático, responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Alan is 24 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year old daughter in his parents’ house, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo in the Santa Rosa district. The need to work to support his family led him to start a small business selling fresh fish on foot. He usually works at night as an assistant in a bakery in the area. For the past six months, he has also been working selling fish in the towns located in the Monsefú district, which is ten minutes from where he lives. He goes very early to the docks to buy his fish, and then travels to Monsefú to sell his product. He arrives home in the afternoon, rests, and then goes to the bakery to work. The income he generates through these activities helps him get ahead in supporting his family and his parents. Alan wants to gather enough funds to start his own bakery, since he very much enjoys this activity and has been learning the trade for some time. However, he is conscious that he must continue selling fish in order to save money. For this reason, he is approaching Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 900 soles. He thinks he will invest these funds into the purchase of more merchandise to strengthen his enterprise. His dream is to buy some land on which to build his own house. Alan is well-known and respected by his neighbors and workmates, who consider him a charismatic, responsible and hard-working young man.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Besilia

texts.en:
Besilia is from the village of Calamagui San Pablo, Isabela. She is married to Romeo, a mechanic in their village and they have six children. Their youngest is already 16 years old and still studying. Besilia is hoping that their youngest will finish her study since her five children did not finish their studies.  

Besilia is helping to maintain their vulcanizing shop business.  Aside from that, she also manages a hog raising business for extra income.  For them to pursue their two businesses, she is now asking for a loan from the KIVA lenders of PHP 7,000.  With this amount, they will have the support needed for their business.

loans.use: Additional capital for their vulcanizing shop business

loans.name: Ismael Mohammed

texts.en:
Ismael is 36 years-old and is married. His electronic business is located at Likuyani market in Likuyani area, Eldoret. He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a business partner. With the loan Ismael intends to add electronic products to his shop such as cables. His future dreams is to open a big electronic shop and to be able to manage his family well.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy electronic goods.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra H. lives in Russey Srouk village in Takeo province. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school. She is a Khmer cake seller.

Her husband, Mr. Chey Kakada, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a pig breeder. Since his pig breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it.

In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Ra H. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase three more piglets and a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family’s living with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Bramwel

texts.en:
Bramwel is a 40-year-old father of six children, three of whom are attending school.

Bramwel has a retail shop, selling mattresses and cushions. He's been in business since 2007 and employs two people. He previously worked at a foam mattress company. He describes himself as ambitious and says he would like to build a better life by working hard and expanding his business.

Bramwel has successfully completed one loan of Kes 20,000 through Faulu. This loan is for Kes 40,000 and he will use the funds to open a similar business in two different new locations.

loans.use: To open in two new locations

loans.name: Nkiru

texts.en: Nkiru is 35 years old, married with 5 children. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist and he also supports the household. She sells firewood at retail prices to her customers. Her greatest joy in her business is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more firewood to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna D. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Rosanna is single and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosanna owns & operates a business buying and selling coconut in the local community. Rosanna has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosanna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosanna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosanna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosanna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El señor Oscar Danilo M. S., tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y su esposa trabaja como camerciante asi mismo le apoya en la agricultura y de esos ingresos aporta a los gastos de la casa, ellos tienen 2 hijos y es por ellos que la familia M. desea trabajar ardudamente para poder ofrecerles mejores condiciones en su vivienda, ellos se dedican al cultivo de la piña y por este trabajo desean invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas que aseguren un mejor cuido a los cultivos, esto les traeria grandes beneficios debido a que podran vender la cosecha de forma rapida y podran recuperar lo invertido, este proceso les traera beneficios y podran planificar a un corto tiempo la reconstruccion de su hogar y poder ofrecerles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo M. S. is 32 years old and married. His wife works as a storekeeper as well as helping him with farming and these incomes take care of the living expenses. They have two children and it is for them that the M. family wishes to work hard so that they can provide them with better housing conditions. They grow pineapple and it is for this work they wish to invest in fertilizers and fungicides that will allow them to provide better care to the crop. This will bring them big profits due to the fact that they will be able to sell the crop quickly and will be able to recover the investment. This process will bring them profits and they will be able to plan in a short period of time the rebuilding of their home and be able to provide their children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricutural material for the care of the crop

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong N., 47, and her husband, Mr. Nhaun Kheav, 48, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, They were married in 1983 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. The oldest son works in a garment factory and the others attend school.

Kong has been selling vegetables and meat for more than six years; she buys it from Phnom Penh for resale in the village. Her husband has been a construction worker for more than ten years. Besides the business, he is also a motorbike taxi driver. Kong is requesting a loan of $1,200 to repair the motorbike. She will also use part of her loan to buy more vegetables and meat for resale.

loans.use: To repair a motorbike and to buy vegetables and meat for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Gladys es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Gladys tiene cabinas de Internet, negocio que esta ubicado en la casa de su mama, además vende golosinas, recargas telefónicas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermano.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mas maquinas.
Los sueños de Gladys son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Gladys is member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which in Quechua means "harvest." She lives with her partner, is 27 years old, and has one son. Gladys owns an Internet booth or cybercafé, which is located at her mother's house. She also sells candy and phone cards with her brother's help. Gladys needs a loan of PEN 1,500, which she will use to buy more computers. Gladys' dream is to buy a car and land to build herself a house.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying computers for her cybercafé.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying millet and soy beans

loans.name: Isabel Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 56 años y  vive con una de sus hijas en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 7 años, se dedica a la venta de comida que prepara en su casa, por las mañanas adquiere los ingredientes frescos y durante la tarde, luego de cocinar, sale a vender sus comidas ya que sus clientes son los comerciantes de la  localidad donde vive. Su negocio de venta de comida es muy rentable ya que el pago es  al contado y sus ganancias se ven reflejadas  a diario, además durante los fines de semana  prepara diferentes platos típicos de su región y los vende en la carpa que arma en la puerta de su casa. Para el futuro planea instalar  un local o cafetín en una escuela para  preparar mayores cantidades de comida.Es el 17ava vez  que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al préstamo que le permitirá continuar progresando.El dinero que Gloria solicita lo invertirá en  la compra, al por mayor, de ingredientes como sacos de quinua, azúcar, además de vasos descartables, para abastecerse bien y seguir trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
Gloria ia 56, and she lives with one of her daughters in her own house. For seven years she has been selling food that she prepares in her house. She gets fresh ingredients in the mornings, and after cooking she leaves to sell her food in the afternoon. Her customers are the merchants in the area where she lives. Her business of selling food is very profitable because she is paid in cash and she gets daily earnings. Also, on the week ends she makes different dishes that are typical of her region. She sells them in the tent that is set up at the door to her house. In the future she plans to set up a place or a small cafe in a school in order to make greater quantities of food. This is her 17th loan with MFP. She is very grateful to all of the people who make it possible for her to get a loan that will allow her to continue progressing. Gloria will use the money she is requesting to buy wholesale ingredients like sacks of quinoa, sugar, and disposable glasses. She will do this to be well stocked and to keep working without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients wholesale in order to stock her business

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
"Brigida S. is a 58 year-old woman living in the town of Brgy II Siaton, Negros Oriental.  She is married and has 7 adult children.  To making a living, Brigida owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Brigida has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 Php a month.

Brigida joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Brigida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19500 Php from NWTF. Brigida is now requesting a new loan of 19500 Php to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be her 7th from NWTF.  Brigida plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.
------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon."

loans.use: Purchase additoonal products to sell.

loans.name: Johany Jackely

texts.es:
Johany tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de La Unión, perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la crianza y venta de aves de corral: ella cría patos, gallinas y pavos en la parte posterior de su vivienda para venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona y a sus vecinos. Este negocio le brinda ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

Johany siempre da lo mejor de si para mejorar la calidad de sus animales de modo que estos tengan buena acogida y pueda percibir mayores ganancias, por ello piensa ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas aves de corral así como de alimento balanceado de modo que su desarrollo se acelere y pueda lograr su objetivo rápidamente. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera ves a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Johany es una joven responsable y con grandes planes para el futuro, ella sueña con seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder instalar una granja. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una joven trabajadora y que siempre ayuda cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Johany is 21, single, and lives with her parents. They live in the La Unión district, which belongs to the Piura province in the region of the same name. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For one year she has been raising and selling poultry. She raises ducks, hens, and turkeys in the back of her house. She sells them to the business people who visit her area and to her neighbors. This business provides income to pay her personal expenses and to help with the household economy. Johany always gives the best of herself to improve the quality of her animals. She does this so that they will be well received and she will be able to get greater earnings. She plans on expanding her business by purchasing more poultry. She will also buy balanced feed to speed up their growth and achieve her objective quickly. That is why she is requesting, for the first time, a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Johany is a responsible young woman who has big plans for the future. She dreams of continuing to grow as a businesswoman and being able to set up a farm. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high esteem. They consider her to be a hard-working young woman who always helps when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry and balanced feed to expand her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen R. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old. Helen is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she is currently engaged in a business where she buys bananas from the neighboring village and then sells them in the city. Helen has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $105 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. 

Helen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more bananas to sell. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina. a married mother of two grown children, works at a small market in Zaporozhye, selling clothing and bed shirts, a successful business she has operated for 10 years. Valentina enjoys it very much, her kindness, experience and openness attracting many clients to her kiosk. She would now like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase her assortment of bed shirts, hoping to earn additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of bed shirts

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sophorn P. lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is 39 years old and works as a farming laborer to earn a little income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Hun Thoeurn Yos, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he grows crops to sell. Unfortunately, her husband’s field is infertile and it has a lot of insects. To improve production, Mrs. Sophorn P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others are enrolled in local public school.  Her husband is pictured in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growth of cultivatable surface and purchase of grain

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn N. is a 37-year-old mother of three. She raises pigs and grows rice as part of her daily routine. Besides the profit earned from her farming, she relies on her husband's business of climbing palm trees, and fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. The family includes three children, and one of them is enrolled in primary school. 

The coming rainfall is good for growing, however, Thorn N. requires additional capital to use on her farm. So, Thorn N. is requesting a loan to use towards planting rice crops.

loans.use: To use towards planting rice crops.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es: El Señor Justino tiene un taller de costura, desde hace seis años, trabaja junto con su esposa, actividad donde confeccionan poleras, chamarras, deportivos, actividad donde les va muy bien le realizan pedidos y también su esposa entrega a los distintos puestos de venta del mercado de la ciudad, este crédito es para la compra de telas e hilos, tiene un pedido de  poleras para un sindicato. Tiene casa propia, tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, es su primer crédito con emprender, el señor es garante de un cliente antiguo, según referencias indican que es responsable y muy trabajador, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Justino has had a tailor shop for the past six years. He works alongside his wife. They make jackets, t-shirts and athletic wear. They do well in that they get orders to fill and his wife also distributes product among various market stalls in the city. The loan will be used to buy fabric and thread because he has a pending order for t-shirts for a labor union. He owns his own house and has three school aged children. This is his first loan with Emprender. He acted as guarantor for a long-standing client and, according to his references, is responsible and very hard working. He is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him upon granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To carry out home improvements.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em N., 63, lives in Kouk Roka village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhorm Chhay, are farmers who own a four-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Their field's soil is infertile and has a lot of insects. To improve rice production, Mrs. Em N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline. She is the mother of two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Rosa viaja los días sábados y domingos a la feria del Distrito de Tambo en donde vende frutas, canchas y de allá compra cereales que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Rosa tenia una tienda de lubricantes en local alquilado, negocio que dejo de realizar porque termino el contrato de local, pero aun sigue vendiendo sus productos a pedido, Rosa tiene proyectado construir un local propio para vender sus productos. Rosa solicita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de maíz y frutas.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and has 4 children. On Saturdays and Sundays she goes to the Tambo District market to sell fruit and corn nuts (roasted corn kernels). From there she brings back cereals to sell in Ayacucho’s wholesale foodstuffs market. Rosa used to have a vehicle lubricants store in a rented space but she left it when her rental contract for the location expired. However, she continues to sell these products by special order. Rosa plans to build her own structure to sell her products. She needs a 900 sol loan to buy corn and fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and fruit.

loans.name: Lorena Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Lorena esta en su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por las facilidades que le han dado para obtener  los créditos. Tiene 27 años y esta casada hace 8 años, de  esta  relación tiene 3 hijos todos son menores de edad, los dos mayores  están estudiando en la escuela.
 
Ella junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, trabajan desde la madrugada hasta la tarde, ella vende en su casa ya que tiene un pequeño puesto y su esposo recorre la ciudad de Manta en un triciclo los martes jueves y viernes, ella dice que antes acompañaba a su esposo en sus recorridos pero ahora que sus hijos están en la escuela no puede porque tiene que ayudarlos y cuidarlos, los productos los compran en Portoviejo, porque allá se consiguen más baratos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas verduras y otros productos para su negocio y el de su esposo.

Sus sueños son terminar su casa y poner una tienda.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Maria Auxiliadora meets at the Sequita church parrish part of Montecristi a prosperous Manabí canton full of hard-working dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parrish whose members are honest and all they know is work and family. Lorena is in her fifth term with the communal bank and she has enjoyed it due to the ease of obtaining her loans. She is 27 years old and has been married for 8 years, a marriage that produced 3 children. All her children are minors and the two eldest are in school. She and her husband own a business selling fruits and vegetables and they work from sunrise until dusk. She sells from home where she has a small stand and her husband sells all throughout the city of Manta on a tricycle every Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday. She states that she used to accompany her husband on these runs but can't now that her kids are in school because she has to help them and look after them. They purchase their produce in Portoviejo because they are cheaper there. She will use this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables and other products for their business. Her dream is to finish her home and set up a store.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oranges, bananas, papayas, mandarines, tomatoes, ettuce, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie Z. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 24 years old. Eddie is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Eddie catches and sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Eddie has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Eddie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eddie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment and tools for boat maintenance. Eddie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tools for boat maintenance and for working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Eddie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools for boat maintenance and for working capital

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel tiene 22 años, tiene 1 hijo. La ubicación del negocio es de manera ambulante ya que recorre las calles para ofrecer sus productos. La actividad económica de ella es la venta de artesanía hace más de 6 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, ya que surgió porque a Maria es una mujer que le gusta trabajar fuertemente y es así como decide vender estos productos. Ella es una mujer humilde que disfruta de hablar con sus clientes y de ofrecerles buena calidad en productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar los materiales necesarios en sus productos y en comprar mayor cantidad. Los sueños de Doña Maria son de establecerse en su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 22 years old, and has one son. Her work is selling handicrafts, which has been her business for more than 6 years. She walks around the streets to offer her wares. She has been successful at it because she is a woman who enjoys working hard and decided to sell her products this way. she is a humble woman who enjoys talking to her customers and offering them good quality products. The loan she is seeking is to buy the materials needed in her products, and to buy them in bulk. Maria's dream is to establish a home for herself.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Katikko Small-Scale Farmers Association-Mityana Group

texts.en: 48-year-old K. George has had his fish-selling business in Katikko landing site-Mityana for 12 years. Previously this married father of 12 operated a retail shop. George, who belongs to the Katikko small-scale farmers group, says success has always been within his grasp given the dedication he puts into his work. George has an amiable disposition and that has endeared him to many of his customers. George also ekes out side profits from agriculture, poultry, pig husbandry and cattle. His weekly profits are about 60,000 shillings. George says that with this loan, he is looking forward to purchasing nets and a boat. He envisages better prospects for his business.

loans.use: The purchase of fish nets and a boat to improve his business.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 35 years old and is married with four children. He does dairy farming in Kiambu. To earn extra income, James is employed as a matatu (public service vehicle) driver in Kiambu. He is hardworking and God fearing and hopes to be self-employed in the future. In five years, James plans to be a prosperous dairy farmer. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow to add to his already existing livestock.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en: San K. is 50 years old and lives with her parents.  She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land where she cultivates rice and different vegetables for a living. However,she does not have some needed farming supplies. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline. There are twenty one members in this village loan group. They are located in Trabaek Pok village in Kandal province. This village loan group selected San K. as the village bank president. Each member of this village will use their portion of the loan to support different purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita L. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Cristita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling a variety of viands like fried fish and chicken adobo in the local community. Cristita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cristita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.
